ftbquests.chapter.dependency_chain.quest: This little setup is used to unlock quests specific to certain modes, such as HNN chain.
ftbquests.chapter.dependency_chain.title: dependencies
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest1.desc: Remember to keep the MV area separate from your LV area. &eHooking up an LV machine to MV current will result in the machine being destroyed! Also, LV cables will burn up if you put MV current through them&r. That's why it's probably best to keep the areas separate until you're comfortable and confident with voltages. Eventually, you can use transformers to switch voltages within a single setup, but don't feel forced to try that until you've got a grasp on the basics.

All RF power is the same (it has no voltages), so you can use RF conduits to route power from wherever you're generating and converting to EU with &3Energy Converters&r for each voltage. You don't have to use this setup, but it's the most foolproof one for a beginner. And if you're an expert, well... you don't need my advice.
For your MV cables, you can use &6Copper&r to start with. &6Energetic Alloy cables&r are lossless though, so consider them if you're able to mass produce those ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest10.des: A hefty amount of &6Silicon Dust&r and a pinch of &2Gallium Arsenide &rcooked in an &3EBF&r will net you a &6Silicon Boule&r, the starting point for &6Circuit Wafers&r.
Make sure your power system is up to the task. These take &27.5 minutes and 1,080,000 EU&r to process.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest11.des: &6Wafers&r are thin pieces of silicon cut from a &6Silicon Boule&r.
Their primary purpose is engraving &6Circuit Wafers&r.

You'll be needing huge amounts of these Wafers for circuits. Silicon Boules currently take a very long time to craft, so consider parallelizing the recipe in multiple &3EBF&rs and making a stockpile of them.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest12.des: The &3Cutting Machine&r is able to cut wafers, rods, wood, and various other things for you, making it a versatile crafting tool. Cutting blocks into 9 plates may be faster than using a &2Bender &rto make them one at a time.
The MV version is required for cutting &6Silicon Boules&r for easier &6Diodes&r once you get &9Polyethylene (PE)&r, and for cutting &6Wafers&r into usable components.
The blade will require you to make &2Vanadiumsteel&r.

Cutting Machines work with plain &9Water&r for all recipes. You can also use &9Distilled Water&r which speeds up the processing somewhat, or &9Lubricant&r that speeds it up greatly (and uses very little per operation). These might be a little tricky to make right now, but are very worthwhile upgrades in the future.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest13.des: &6Circuit Wafers&r are batches of integrated circuits engraved onto a wafer of electronics-grade silicon.
You need to run these through the &3Cutting Machine&r to dice the wafers into individual integrated circuits (called dies).
These are important components and will be used for making more advanced Circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest14.des: A &3Precision Laser Engraver&r is used to engrave circuits onto &6Wafers&r.
The type of circuit will depend on the kind of wafer used and which &aLens&r is in the machine.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest15.des: &2An expensive advanced component used in the construction of the MV Precision Laser Engraver and MV Circuit Assembler.
Process some Emerald Ore in the Sifter to get the Flawless Emerald required to craft this.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest16.des: You'll need a variety of &alenses&r for use in &3Precision Laser Engravers&r, all of which are made in the &2Lathe&r.

Initially you'll need a &a&3&2Ruby Lens&r. Soon you will need &2Diamond, Emerald, and Sapphire Lenses. &2You can choose to use an MV Lathe to get a lens from a plate, or sift for an Exquisite Gem and use an LV Lathe.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest17.des: This alloy is cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r into a &6Kanthal Ingot&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest18.des: &2A bit of Vanadiumsteel is used for progression. It's also a very strong tool material.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest19.des: &6Chromium&r is used in the production of many alloys. &6Stainless Steel&r, &6Vanadiumsteel&r, and &6Kanthal&r are the ones you will encounter soon.
It is primarily obtained by electrolyzing &6Ruby Dust&r, although you can also mine some &6Chromite&r in The End. You will need a lot of this soon, so be sure to accumulate a lot of it.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest2.desc: &aMV Batteries&r function essentially the same as &aLV Batteries&r, only stronger. They also need to be put into &3MV Machines, MV Battery Buffers&r or &3MV Turbo Chargers&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest20.des: An &3MV Electrolyzer&r allows you to process recipes that require up to 128 EU/t, and can optionally overclock recipes costing at most 32 EU/t.
This means you can split more kinds of things for useful products.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest21.des: &2In GTCEu, higher-tier blends of dusts require higher-tier Mixers to mix. The MV Mixer is required for making Vanadiumsteel and Stainless Steel.
There will not be more mixer quests after this one. Remember this when making higher-tier dust blends.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest22.des: &6Diodes&r are a component in the next Circuit tiers. They are made in an &3Assembler&r from liquid &9Glass&r, &6Fine Copper Wire&r and &6Gallium Arsenide&r.
Always be on the lookout for &ebetter recipes&r! &6Fine Annealed Copper Wire&r doubles your yield, and &9Polyethylene&r unlocks a few more efficient recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest23.des: &2Assembling Machines come early in CEu! Circuit recipes are handled through a separate machine, the Circuit Assembler. &r

Assembling Machines open up a plethora of &eequal or more efficient recipes that don't require hand tools&r. &2For example, you can make up to 4 Vacuum Tubes in a single craft! &rCheck EMI&r for all the components you've been making to see if the Assembler can improve their recipes.
Many of the Assembler's recipes require &9fluids&r. Hence, the &3Extractor&r will be required to take full advantage of this machine.

Hand tool recipes also don't play nice with &bApplied Energistics&r. Take advantage of Assembling Machines: &cphase out all use of hand tools for crafting items in your automation going forward.&r Once you have all the important machines, you will never need hand tools for crafting.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest24.des: The &6Machine Controller&r is a cover that manages the operation of &bGregTech&r machines, similar to a &aSoft Hammer&r. These are crucial for &epassive automation&r, where a machine is dedicated to keeping something in stock for you.

"Machines" here is broader than you might think. It of course works on single-block machines, but can also be used on &eMultiblock Controllers&r like your &3Electronic Blast Furnace&r. But it's even more flexible than that: you can use it on any &bGregTech&r block that accepts transfer covers, as long as the controllable cover is placed on it first! This means it also works for things like &6Chests&r, &6Drums&r, and Multiblock inputs.
The cover works by detecting a &eredstone signal&r. By default, the entire machine will be disabled if a sufficiently strong signal is detected by the cover.
When you open the Machine Controller's GUI with a &aScrewdriver&r, you will see several options for configuring its behavior:
The strength of the signal required to trigger the Machine Controller is configurable using the top slider.

Another button allows you to select whether to control the whole machine (where applicable) or a specific cover. This lets you do things like stop moving items into a machine, but also allow the machine to continue working.

Switching from &eNormal&r to &eInverted&r mode will make the Machine Controller instead disable the machine until it receives the requisite redstone signal. This is often preferable when working with &6Level Emitters&r to prevent machines from starting up if your &eME Network&r is offline.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest25.des: The &3Extruder&r is an alternative way to form shapes from metal. &aExtruder Shapes&r are used for telling an Extruder which shape to make.

Extruders are &2no longer strictly needed for Large Pipes.&r Extruders use ingots, but are as efficient for making &6Gears&r as melting and solidifying. They are also the most efficient way to make &6Bolts&r, &6Small Gears&r, and &6Rings&r.
You can also use Extruders to make things from other machines like plates and wires, but they are less efficient than using the dedicated machines for these purposes.
&2There is also an LV version, but most of the Extruder's recipes must be run at MV or higher.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest26.des: &9Phenol&r is produced as a byproduct from making &6Coal Coke&r in a &3Pyrolyse Oven&r.
These boards will enable the next tier of circuits, as well as a much cheaper method of circuit production.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest27.des: The place for your very first chemical reactions, namely making some improved substrates.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest28.des: &2Sodium Persulfate and Iron III Chloride&r are used to make cheaper &9Good Circuit Boards&r, as it cuts the Silver amount by a factor of four. They are also &9required&r to make &9Plastic Circuit Boards&r, and circuit boards afterwards.

Making &aSodium Persulfate&r with &6Salt&r will yield &aHydrochloric Acid&r as a coproduct, which you may re-use to make &aIron III Chloride&r. This is the best approach right now, but the decision is entirely yours. With more automation later in the game, Iron III Chloride will be the cheaper and more straightforward path.
Sodium Persulfate&r can also be used in &9Ore Processing&r in the &3Chemical Bath&r to get various bonus outputs you would not normally obtain. It is completely optional, but pretty rewarding.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest29.des: &6Stainless Steel&r will be your primary material for HV, in the same way that &6Aluminium&r was for MV and &2Steel&r was for LV.
&6Manganese&r comes from electrolyzing &6Tantalite&r, &6Pyrolusite&r, or &6Spessartine Dusts&r. You already have &6Chrome&r.
Mix up a bunch of the dust in a MV &3Mixer&r and begin processing it through the &3Electric Blast Furnace&r. This may be a good time to reevaluate your power generation and storage infrastructure.
You will need HV power to smelt this, which you can achieve with 2 MV Energy Hatches.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest3.desc: &3Centrifuges&r have a chance of creating additional materials when processing ore dusts. Sometimes it's the main dust, but often it's a different useful material that is otherwise unobtainable.

Instead of washing &6impure dusts&r (made from macerating or hammering ores) in a cauldron, you can get more out of each dust by centrifuging it. The same is true of &6pure dusts&r, when you eventually make a &3Washer&r or &3Chemical Bath&r. Note, however, that pure and impure dusts will usually give different byproducts (always check in &bEMI&r).
Centrifuges also have other uses like unmixing compound dusts and fluids, or getting &6Rubber Pulp&r, which can be chemically reacted with &6Sulfur&r to efficiently make &9liquid Rubber&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest30.des: An advanced component used for the Circuit Assembling Machine.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest31.des: The &2MV Assembling Machine&r allows you to craft &6Medium Voltage Coils&r, and your &3Laser Engraver&r can make &2Ultra Low Power ICs with a Sapphire Lens.&r
Combine them with some MV parts and you can finally craft an &6MV Energy Hatch&r.
Higher tiers of energy hatch will require similar resources.
Note: For extracting energy from GT multiblock generators, you will need &6Dynamo Hatches&r instead. Those are crafted similarly to Energy Hatches, but with &6Springs&r in place of 1x Cables.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest32.des: &2With the MV Assembling Machine, you can assemble a few necessary parts for the next Circuit tier.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest33.des: Time to upgrade your &3Electric Blast Furnace&r! &6Kanthal&r is the second coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 2700K so it can process more advanced materials.

&6Kanthal Coils&r are required primarily for producing &6Silicon&r, required for Circuit parts, and &6Titanium&r, used for &5EV&r machines. An &bMV &3Assembler&r is required to produce them, and they require &62x Kanthal Wire&r, &6Aluminium Foil&r, and &9Liquid Copper&r.

&2In CEu, using higher-tier coils provides some bonuses to their multiblocks.&r For the &3Electric Blast Furnace&r, running recipes hotter than required can reduce the energy cost and time taken. The &9temperature&r of the EBF depends on the coil used and the voltage it is running at. For Kanthal Coils, this means that recipes you could run with &6Cupronickel Coils&r will save &95%&r energy.
Refer to the coil tooltip and EBF controller tooltip for the other bonuses provided.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest35.des: &6Transistors&r are semiconductors that can amplify or switch electrical signals and power. They're probably one of the most important inventions of the 20th century.
You're going to use them as a component for better circuits. This one is a bit pricey, requiring &2PE, Silicon Plates and Fine Tin Wire.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest36.des: The &3Multi Smelter&r is an absolute smelting unit, and is most likely the best furnace &9and alloy smelter&r added by a mod.

It's a 3x3x3 multiblock machine capable of &esmelting huge amounts of items per second&r. By upgrading its coils and power tier, it can become capable of smelting up to literal thousands of items per second.

Shift and hover over different coil blocks: they tell you the number of items a Multi Smelter can smelt per operation: &e32 items per level&r. The most basic Multi Smelter essentially does 32 items in the same time as a furnace does one. With a set of &9RTM Alloy&r coil blocks, that jumps to 128 items per operation.

This quest doesn't ask for coils, hatches or buses: feel free to choose whatever combination you want. You'll need &a8 coil blocks&r, &a1 input bus&r, &a1 output bus&r, and &21 maintenance hatch&r, &21 muffler hatch&r, and at least &a1 energy hatch&r, all of any tier.
&9The Multi Smelter can have its mode swapped between Electric Furnace and Alloy Smelter recipes by pressing the robot arm button in its GUI&r. Some other multiblocks use this mechanic as well.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest37.des: &6Annealed Copper&r is made &2in an Arc Furnace&r by treating &6Copper&r with &9Oxygen&r. It has less power loss than regular Copper when used as a cable, and is also required for more advanced electronic components.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest38.des: With &6HV Machine Hulls&r made, you've made your first step towards &eHigh Voltage (HV)&r power machinery!
While you can make these in a crafting table with &6Polyethylene Sheets&r, liquid &9Polyethylene&r can be used to craft these directly in an &3Assembling Machine&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest39.des: With tier three circuits in hand, it's time to make a &3Distillation Tower&r, which gates petrochemistry and more advanced plastics like &6Epoxy&r.

The Distillation Tower is a highly flexible multiblock structure, able to be anywhere from &62 blocks high to 13 high&r (12 fluid outputs). The way that it works is that each level of the tower after the first will output an additional fluid from the recipe. &cIf the number of fluid outputs from the recipe exceeds the number of available hatches or those hatches are too small to hold the output, the recipe will not run&r.

What you need the Distillation Tower for initially is to break down &9Oil&r and &9Fermented Biomass&r into useful resources.&9 Oil&r distillation, with its four outputs, will require a &efive-block-high Distillation Tower&r (the quest materials are for such a tower; if you want to build it bigger, you will need &ean additional 7 casings and 1 fluid output per floor&r).

Any recipe with more than four output fluids (like &9Fermented Biomass&r) will need a larger tower. Make sure to increase the height of your tower to accommodate all of the outputs you want to keep. Also check the voltage requirements of the recipes, as many Distillation Tower recipes need higher voltages than MV. &eYou can swap out your Energy Input for a higher tier one when that time comes&r. Also, any recipe that has an item output will need an &6Output Bus&r, anywhere on the bottom layer.

The tower we'll be building at first is 3x3x5 (LxWxH), with a hollow center. The &6Fluid Input Hatch&r &2can go anywhere on the bottom layer.&r. The &6controller&r goes in the middle of an outer edge of the bottom layer. The &6Energy Input Hatch&r can go wherever you can fit it on the bottom layer. The rest of the 3x3 must be filled with &6Clean Stainless Steel Casings&r.&2 Each level above that is a ring of 7 Clean Stainless Steel Casings, one &6Fluid Output&r and nothing in the center, except for the topmost layer which needs an eighth casing to fill in the center, capping off the top.
For distilling fluids which only have one useful output, like &9Biomass&r, it is recommended to use single-block Distilleries, due to their energy efficiency and generally lower costs.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest4.desc: Note: this quest accepts both LV and MV Canning Machines.
&aLV Batteries&r were very simple to make, but more effective forms of power storage will be more complex to build, so we'll need to lay the groundwork now.
Put your &3Centrifuge&r to work for the &6Antimony&r you'll need, which comes from &6Stibnite Ore&r and processing &6Tetrahedrite Ore&r and &6Realgar Ore&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest40.des: The &3Pyrolyse Oven&r can make more interesting products than just &9Phenol&r.

&9Charcoal Byproducts&r breaks down into various wood products, such as &9Wood Tar&r, &9Wood Gas&r, and &9Wood Vinegar&r, each of which can be further broken down into various useful chemical compounds, such as &9Toluene&r, &9Methanol&r, etc.

However, to take full advantage of decomposing these wood products, a &3Distillation Tower&r is required, so that all possible outputs can be obtained. You will need more &eDistillation Tower Slices&r than requested in the&r Distillation Tower quest, so be prepared to spend some more &6Stainless Steel&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest41.des: &9Polyethylene (PE)&r is the most common category of plastic, made from polymers of &9Ethylene&r. Adding &9Oxygen&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r recreates (with some artistic license) early accidental synthesis of Polyethylene.

When you have large amounts of &6Rutile&r and &6Bauxite&r (probably after you visit the Moon) you can consider using &9Titanium Tetrachloride&r as a catalyst to improve your Polyethylene yields. For now it's not a great idea, as in addition to its Overworld rarity, you need it for &6Titanium&r.

Form &6Polyethylene Sheets&r using a &3Fluid Solidifier&r and a &aPlate Mold&r for use in crafting electronics components. You'll need both the liquid and the sheets. For &9Polyethylene (PE)&r pipes, you can either pulverise your sheets into dust and use those in the extruder, or solidify &9Polyethylene (PE)&r into &6Polyethylene Bars&r seperately.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest42.des: &6Capacitors&r are devices that store electrical energy, which is useful for circuits.
Not to be confused with &bEnder IO&r's capacitors&r, which store redstone flux.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest43.des: &2You can make HV Batteries like LV and MV ones, but there is a better option.
&2Energium Crystals can store 6,400,000 EU, at the cost of some crafting complexity. They need an HV Autoclave.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest44.des: &2The next tier of Assembling Machine. This one can make quite a few nice things - check the surrounding quests.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest45.des: &2With Silver, LPICs, NaK, and an HV Assembler, you can finally make HV Energy and Dynamo hatches.
You should get the gist of making these now, so there will not be further quests on Energy and Dynamo hatches.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest46.des: &2Sodium Potassium is an alloy of... take a guess.
&2It's used in the construction of HV and above Energy and Dynamo hatches.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest47.des: &6Surface Mounted Devices&r, or &6SMD&rs for short, are &2more efficient ways to produce the Circuit components you've been making.&r
All SMD components must be produced in at least a &2HV Assembling Machine&r, and they all will require liquid &9Polyethylene&r.
Start off with the &6SMD Transistor&r. These are simply a &6Gallium &2Foil&r and &6Fine Annealed Copper Wire&r.
Next up are &6SMD Resistors&r, which are also simple: &6Carbon Dust&r and &6Fine Electrum Wire&r.
Next up are &6SMD Diodes&r, which are fairly simple. &2Gallium Arsenide Dust&r and &6Fine Platinum Wire&r net you half a stack.&r

Then are &6SMD Capacitors&r. You'll need sheets of &6Polyvinyl Chloride&r to make these, or they can also be made more slowly with &6Silicone Rubber&r. &2Using Tantalum Foil in place of Aluminium doubles your yield.
Finally, and new to CEu, SMD Inductors. Made with Nickel Zinc Ferrite and Fine Cupronickel Wire.&r

Invest in a robust system of automation for SMD components and all of their ingredients, since you'll never stop needing them. They will also work in place of the non-SMD versions you've been using in all but the simplest of recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest48.des: &4Not yet implemented - quest is kept as-is for when the devs get around to it!&r

&2Ender Fluid Link Covers are GTCEu's Ender Tanks&r. Each Cover sends their fluids through a frequency defined by an &68-digit hexadecimal number&r (0-9, then A-F for each digit). That gives you &64.29 billion&r channels to work with!
Ender Fluid Link Covers work as long as their chunk is loaded - regardless of distance or dimension.

Setting the mode to Import will &o&c&opull&r fluids from the world location it is attached to, while Export will &o&9&opush&r fluids to the world. You must turn the I/O to Enabled for it to start working. Each channel has a buffer of &964 buckets&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest49.des: &9Vinyl Chloride&r is an industrial chemical made from chlorinating &9Ethylene&r (adding &9Chlorine&r at high temperature) in a &3Chemical Reactor&r. &9Ethane&r can be used as an alternative reagent.

It is used to create the plastic &9Polyvinyl Chloride&r, most well known as PVC. While it deviates from reality, in GregTech you chemically react Vinyl Chloride and &9Oxygen&r to polymerize it into PVC.
Later, you can use &9Titanium Tetrachloride&r to catalyze this reaction as well for greater yield.
You'll only need to solidify this into sheet form. If you want PVC pipes too, you can pulverise the sheet into dust and use that in the extruder, or you can solidify it into bars seperately.
&6PVC Sheets&r are superior to &6Polyethylene Sheets&r for making plastic substrates, producing twice as many &6Plastic Boards&r per craft.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest5.desc: When you first started the pack, we told you that ore doubling can wait, and that's true... But you &owill&r need to start doing some rudimentary ore processing for &ebyproducts&r.

- &3Thermal Centrifuge&r: not to be confused with the regular Centrifuge. &2Less slow and power-hungry now, but still so. However, it yields a chance for byproduct, and macerating the Centrifuged Ore can grant a special third byproduct.
&2- Sifter: filters high-quality Gems from Purified Crushed gem Ores for an overall higher yield.
- Electromagnetic Separator: filters magnetic metals from certain ores, increasing their yields.&r
Your first forays into ore processing for byproducts will be the Electrolyzer and the Centrifuge.

Byproducts are additional materials that can only be obtained from processing ores in certain machines. For example, there is no "Gallium Ore" or "Arsenic Ore". You get &6Gallium&r and &6Arsenic &ras a byproduct from processing other ores &ein a machine that is HV or higher.&r

Ores have various means of processing, and eventually you'll use machine pipelines to process ores in specific ways to optimize what byproducts you gain. You can look at the &6Ore Byproduct Page&r of an ore in &bEMI&r, accessed by pressing 'U' on an ore and navigating to the byproduct tab, to see the required route to obtain desired byproducts.
The relevant machines are as follows:

- &3Macerator&r: turns ores into &6Crushed Ores&r, Crushed Ores into &6Impure Dusts&r, and &6Purified Crushed Ores&r into &6Pure Dusts&r. Higher tiers of macerators have byproduct slots and gain a chance to get a full pile of byproduct from ores and both types of crushed ores.

- &3Ore Washer&r: cleans Crushed Ores with &9Water&r, making Purified Crushed Ores&r, and a chance for a full pile of byproduct. Using &9Distilled Water&r makes them go faster. &2You can also perform a simple wash that is similar to Cauldron washing. It is extremely fast, but grants no byproducts.&r
- &3Chemical Bath&r: &2uses Sodium Persulfate or Mercury to purify certain ores, granting a chance to yield a full pile of a byproduct.
&r- &3Centrifuge&r: separates Pure or Impure dusts into the final material, with a chance for a full pile of byproduct.

- &3Electrolyzer&r: uses power to split compounds into individual elements, sometimes gaining useful byproducts in the process. &2Be warned that certain dusts may be better to directly smelt instead of electrolyze!&r
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest50.des: &9Ethylene&r is a hydrocarbon obtained from &9Oil Processing&r, or by dehydrating &9Ethanol&r with &9Sulfuric Acid&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r. Choose a method that works for you:
- The &9Ethanol&r route allows you to use your existing &6Sugarcane&r farm to produce &9Ethylene&r. However, the recipes require &bMedium Voltage&r machines to run.

- The &9Oil Processing&r route requires &2only LV machines&r, but you will have to source &9Oil&r, or its variants, from somewhere. &2Severely Steam-Cracked Light Fuel&r is most efficient with &9Oil and Heavy Oil&r. &2Severely Steam-Cracked Naphtha&r is more efficient when you are using &9Raw Oil and Light Oil&r.

It is an extremely important chemical in the production of plastics, as you'll need &9Ethylene&r in your production of &9Polyethylene (PE)&r, &9Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC)&r, and can be used in the production of &9Styrene-Butadiene Rubber (SBR)&r, the best form of rubber.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest51.des: &6Sulfur&r will be used in a variety of upcoming chemical reactions.

It can be electrolyzed easily from &6Sphalerite&r (which also provides &6Gallium&r), &6Cinnabar&r, and &6Pyrite&r. Alternately, Sulfur can be acquired through &bHNN&r- look into that quest line if you haven't already.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest52.des: Note: this quest accepts both LV and MV Brewery.
You can turn &6Plant Balls&r and other various &6sugary crops&r into &9Biomass&r with a &3Brewery&r. Biomass is the first step towards making Plastic in the form of &9Polyethylene&r.

The Brewery is a &overy&r slow machine, but it requires almost no power. Building &2many Breweries&r is necessary to brew enough Biomass for plastics. &2An alternative and more resource efficient way of making biomass is with a Pyrolyse Oven, Water, and Bio Chaff.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest53.des: It might seem crazy right now, but you'll want a dedicated &3Chemical Reactor&r for pretty much every chemical you want to process. You probably want to hold off on doing that until you've got a solid base of autocrafting though... it stings a lot less when you can just request crafts of Chemical Reactors from your AE2 system.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest54.des: &6Uraninite Ore&r is the first source of &6Pulsating Dust&r but is not a very good one in the long term. Instead you should make &6Resonant Clathrates&r, which are an infinitely-renewable and effective source of Pulsating Dust.

Resonant Clathrates are made by melting &6Ender Pearls&r with a &3Fluid Extractor&r into &9Resonant Ender&r, then mixing that with &6Nether Quartz&r in an MV or better &3Chemical Reactor&r. Smelting this clathrate gives Pulsating Dust.

With Resonant Clathrates now accessible, everything you need for crafting &6Pulsating Prediction Matrix&r can be automated in a net-positive loop.&r Doing so is the first step in automation of &bHostile Neural Networks&r, which is &ea primary source of important materials for the rest of the pack&r.

The exact implementation is up to you. Make use of the various LV and MV machines you have, and look through &bEMI&r and the Processing Lines Tab for the ways to get infinite sources of each ingredient (like &aEnderman Models&r for pearls).
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest54.ric: This is an important part of a Processing Line. Visit the
tab to have more info, useful tips, and a visual representation of how to passively automate this.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest55.des: Your &3Chemical Reactors&r will be making a lot of different fluids. You'll need to manage the logistics of routing and storing all the different fluids you're automating.

Wherever possible, having one Chemical Reactor output directly into another machine that needs its output chemical saves you from having to figure out additional storage and routing. &aFluid Filters&r and &aPump covers&r are very useful for moving fluids around a compact processing pipeline.
But what about the final output fluids that you need elsewhere?

One option is to use the output tanks of the Chemical Reactors as a small storage buffer, letting it back up and stop crafting automatically. A &aFluid Storage Bus&r on the machine will expose the fluid to your ME Network. Whenever you need some of this fluid, your AE2 system will pull the needed fluid out and the machine will resume processing.

There's some catches with this approach though. First is that the inaccessible input tanks will also show up in AE but you won't be able to access them. You will want to set the Storage Bus to &eExport Only&r so AE doesn't try to store random fluids in the Chemical Reactor, and you may want to &ereduce the priority&r of the Storage Bus as well: this will signal to AE that you want it to remove fluids from that location first. Also, if multiple fluids are produced, &ethe machine will not resume processing if it doesn't have room for all fluid outputs&r.

When you get access to them, it's probably just better to use single-fluid-formatted &aFluid Storage Cells&r and dump outputs into AE via Fluid Interfaces. You can fill up the cells, then pull the fluids out wherever else you need them. An alternative to this is storage buses on &3Gregtech Tanks and Drums&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest56.des: &oNote: this quest accepts both LV and MV Distillery. &2
If you are distilling Ethanol, you now need an MV Distillery.

&rThe &3Distillery&r is a single-block machine which only outputs one distillate out of several and &cdiscards&r the rest. You can use this now to get &9Ethanol&r from &9Biomass&r, or to selectively distill &9Oil&r in multiple steps to &9Ethylene&r. Its advantage over the full Tower, apart from cost, is its &9energy efficiency&r. Therefore, it is recommended for fluids with only one useful output, like &9Biomass&r, &9Diluted Sulfuric Acid&r, and &9Diluted Hydrochloric Acid&r.

However, the Distillation Tower is recommended for advanced chemistry, as most things have more than one important output: &9Fermented Biomass&r, &9Charcoal Byproducts&r from your &3Pyrolyse Oven&r, and the entire line of petrochemicals from &9Oil&r, to name a few.
You're going to need it soon!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest57.des: You'll need &9Chlorine&r at this point. It is an important ingredient in many chemical processes, and you can currently get it from electrolyzing either &6Salt&r or &6Rock Salt&r.
&2Later, you can use Fluid Rigs or break down Ghast Tears to obtain Salt Water, and electrolyze it to Chlorine.
&rUsing Fluid Rigs is the best way to obtain mass amounts of Chlorine.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest58.des: &oNote: This quest accepts any Super or Quantum Tank.
&2Super and Quantum Tanks are the high-tier GT Fluid storage solution.&r
The first tier holds &68,000 buckets&r, and higher tiers hold more. They can also be used like Drums to put fluids in and out of machines.
You can conveniently configure &cvoiding&r for them to always void, start voiding at 95% capacity, or never void.
The item equivalent are &3Super Chests&r, which are used in certain &6Micro Miner&r recipes.
Higher-tier versions of these are called &3Quantum Tanks&r and &3Quantum Chests&r. They all require their respective tier &3Hermetic Casings&r to craft.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest59.des: &2The successor of Small Coils, Inductors are another circuit component you will need.
&2For the best results, use Nickel Zinc Ferrite and Annealed Copper to make these.
&2But depending on which setups you build first, you may not need to make many of the basic version over the SMD version.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest6.desc: &2This quest accepts an LV or MV Sifter.
&2The Sifter gets you Flawless and Exquisite Gems from Crushed Purified Gem Ores. Overall it results in a higher yield. Higher tiers of Sifter increase the yield further.
&2You will need small quantities of Flawless Emeralds for MV Emitter and Sensor components.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest60.des: Holding one of these reveals &aTravel Anchors&r in range.
Shift + right-click after aiming to warp to one, or point it anywhere to teleport forward a short distance (works through walls).
These are powered with RF, and can be further enchanted through &bEnder IO&r's enchanting mechanics.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest61.des: &aEnder Fluid Conduits&r are the most powerful fluid transportation mechanism offered by &bEnder IO&r.

Not only are these faster than &aPressurized Fluid Conduits&r, but because they teleport fluids instead of flowing them in the conduits, it possible to have a large number of fluids moving through a single line.
In addition to &aFilters&r they also have multiple channels which can be used to direct fluids through the same conduits to various destinations.
If you don't want to (or haven't unlocked access to) routing fluids through &bAE&r, these are your best alternative.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest62.des: Conduits to carry even MORE RF power.
You're making these in an &3Assembling Machine&r, right?
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest63.des: A pair of &6Double-Layer RF Capacitors&r combined with some &6Vibrant Alloy&r and &6Glowstone&r creates an &6Octadic RF Capacitor&r, which is a tier three &bEnder IO&r capacitor.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest64.des: Combining &6Basic RF Capacitors&r with some &6Coal Dust&r and &6Energetic Alloy&r produces a &6Double-Layer RF Capacitor&r.
This is a tier two capacitor. Higher tier RF Capacitors will make &bEnder IO&r machines process faster and depending on the machine will expand their capabilities further (like area of effect).
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest65.des: Two &aCapacitor Banks&r can be grafted together with a &6Double-Layer Capacitor&r and &6Electrical Steel&r to create an &aAdvanced Capacitor Bank&r, which stores four times as much RF as the basic bank.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest66.des: Two &aAdvanced Capacitor Banks&r can be grafted together with a &6Vibrant Crystal&r and &6Vibrant Alloy Plates&r to create a &aVibrant Capacitor Bank&r, which stores four times as much RF as the advanced bank, for a total of sixteen times as much as the basic bank.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest67.des: Overclocking aside, as you continue to progress in &5Monifactory&f, materials made in the &3Electric Blast Furnace&f will take longer to complete. &eMore advanced coils allow for the furnace to &eget hot enough to process more advanced materials&f, &2and they also granting energy efficiency bonuses and speed bonuses to overclocking.&r
Despite this, you'll still need to continually expand your smelting and power generation infrastructure.
You don't have to get all four of these Electric Blast Furnaces completed and running just yet, but be prepared to make many of them over the course of the pack.
&2As a reminder, all blocks and hatches can be shared across EBFs, except Maintenance!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest68.des: &eSuperconductor wires won't kill you when touched now. In fact, you have to use Wires for Superconductors, because they don't even have cables!

&2There are an additional set of superconductors, one for each tier, which are the CEu default superconductors. Their advantage is their higher amperage rating, reaching the hundreds of amps for higher tier 16x wires. They are also used in crafting Field Generators. They are:

&bEnder IO&r and &bThermal&r alloys are a bit more expensive than the normal wires, but they come with the huge advantage of being &2superconductors&r. Lossy cables like &6Tin&r and &6Copper&r will bleed out energy for every block they travel, but &2superconductors&r do not.
LuV - Indium Tin Barium Titanium Cuprate
UV - Enriched Naquadah Trinium Europium Duranide

MV and higher cables are made in an &3Assembling Machine&r, with liquid &9Rubber&r and &6Wires&r. &2Keep in mind that you can't combine cables into thicker cables, so you have to make the thickness of cables that you will use.
The &2cheap superconductors&r for each tier are:
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest69.des: All this &9Phenol&r needed for MV circuits and all the &6Steel&r needed for everything else may be putting stress onto your coal supply, so it may be worth looking into building a &9Greenhouse&r, and converting &6Wood&r into &6Charcoal&r to help solve the issue.
Providing it with &6Fertilizer&r will significantly increase its output.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest7.desc: &2Initial circuit components are a bit more difficult in CEu, and you need Arsenic in addition to Gallium.&r
For &9Gallium&r, you may, ranked from worst to best:
- &3Electrolyze &aSphalerite&r for a low chance of small dust. Note that you lose on direct smelting value.
-&r Put &aCrushed Bauxite&r in the &3Chemical Bath&r. Note that this requires &9Sodium Persulfate&r.
- Obtain it as a Byproduct of &aSphalerite&r Ore Processing, in the &3Thermal Centrifuge&r or &3Centrifuge&r.
&2For Arsenic, you must centrifuge Realgar Dust, or (more involvedly) flash smelt Cobaltite Dust in the EBF, and electrolyse the resultant Arsenic Trioxide.
Combine both in a Mixer to make Gallium Arsenide.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest70.des: Placing a &9Wireless Charger&r in a area that you frequent (such as where you do your crafting) will ensure that your items are always topped off on energy.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest70.sub: Because waiting for items to charge is so last version
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest71.des: The &6Steam Separator&r functions as 5.3 &7LV &3Centrifuges&r in parallel! It requires an input of &9Steam&r through a &eSteam Hatch&r, but it uses very little Steam.
While it can't process &9fluids&r, it's perfect for ore processing, letting you get the most out of your dusts and letting you not have to deal with washing your ores in a &3Cauldron&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest72.des: These devices can help you build, swap blocks, destroy massive areas, or even copy-paste regions. You need the blocks you plan to paste in your inventory though; it doesn't make them from nothing.
Also important to note is that it won't work with TileEntities, so it pretty much only works with simple blocks (not stuff like machines).

A very cool feature of this mod is how you can &9shift-right click&r an &ainventory&r with any gadget (if you are using a &6Copy-Paste Gadget&r to do this, it must be on &ePaste&r mode) and the gadget will &9pull items from the inventory&r, 'connecting' the gadget to the inventory.
For example, if you shift-right click a chest full of cobblestone, the gadget will use cobblestone from that chest to place blocks.
By default, the config GUI is bound to &6G&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest73.des: Now that you have some &6MV circuits&r, you can make a &6Factory Augment&r that lets you &2smelt multiple items at once&r with your furnaces!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest8.desc: The &3Atomic Reconstructor&r is capable of reconstructing standard materials into special variants.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest9.desc: Vanilla enchanting mechanics are just so tedious. Don't you wish you could just make a specific enchant instead of grinding levels and rolling the dice?

The &3Dark Steel Enchanter&r is a device that uses &6Book and Quill&r, experience levels, lapis, and enchant-specific items to create an &6Enchanted Book&r with an enchantment of your choosing. Then you can just use an Anvil to enchant your item like usual.

You can also make the &9Mending&r enchant which allows you to infinitely repair the item when damaged using &9Liquid XP&r in an &bEnder IO &aFluid Tank&r or &aPressurized Fluid Tank&r. Keep in mind that &9Mending&r does not work on &3Gregtech Tools&r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.title: Early Game
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest1.descri: A catalyst forged from &9Omnium&r, &6Empowered Gears&r, various enhanced &6Nether Stars&r, and a core made of &6The Ultimate Material&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest10.descr: These are quite expensive and two of them are required for each Tier Ten Micro Miner.
&6Neutronium Solar Panels&r generate an enormous amount of RF power in sunlight, so once you get your tank it's also a good choice for compact power generation.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest10.subti: How much do you think these solar panels weigh?
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest10.title: &9Neutronium Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest11.descr: The &3Simulation Supercomputer&r is a multiblock structure that performs &9HNN&r simulations like the &3Simulation Chamber&r, but is capable of overclocking these simulations to incredible speeds.

One of these structures can perform the equivalent work of hundreds of individual Simulation Chambers more efficiently. This will make it far easier to generate pristine matter you'll need for things like &6Dragon Lair Data&r.

The data model you place in the input bus will &2have a fixed 30% chance of producing Pristine matter regardless of its tier. &eOverclocking does not alter the chances of pristines&r: those come at fixed rates per iteration.

As a &9Creative Tier&r structure, it is rather expensive to make. However, it is an investment that will easily pay for itself as you progress through the endgame. You should strongly consider making one of these with your first batch of &9Hearts Of A Universe&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest11.title: &2Simulation Supercomputer
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest12.title: The Final Solar Panel
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest13.descr: Reinforcing your Microminer with &6Activated Netherite&r lets it retrieve &9Creative Storage Data&r.
Similarly to how the Creative Tank Data works, the Creative Storage Data lets you assemble the means to create infinite storage, in the form of drawer upgrades, as well as Quantum Chests and Tanks.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest13.title: &9Creative Storage Data
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest14.descr: Allows you to assemble 3 kinds of creative energy blocks.
&2The Gregtech Energy Emitter is configurable to output any number of GT Volts and Amps.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest14.title: &9Creative Power
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest15.descr: Instead of using cables to move your data around, why not just have all the data packed in a single block?
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest15.title: &9Creative Data Access Hatch
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest16.descr: Changing the circuit value on your newfound &3Subatomic Digital Assembler&r will allow you to assemble &9ME Infinity Cell Bases&r.
To do so, combine the &9ME Infinity Cell Base&r with a &efilled&r &6Fluid Cell&r in a &3Crafting Table&r to assign the cell to that fluid.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest16.rich_: These can be used to make infinite sources of fluid in ME cell form like the
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest16.title: &9ME Infinity Cell Base
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest17.descr: The &3Loot Superfabricator&r is a multiblock structure that is made to match the incredible speeds of the &3Simulation Supercomputer&r.

One of these structures can perform the equivalent work of hundreds of individual Loot Fabricators more efficiently. This will make it far easier to generate said &6Dragon Lair Data&r from all that pristine matter you now have.

As a &9Creative Tier&r structure, it is rather expensive to make. However, it is an investment that will easily pay for itself as you progress through the endgame. You should strongly consider making one of these with your second batch of &9Hearts of a Universe&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest17.title: &9Loot Superfabricator
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest18.descr: &6Omnium Coils&r, made in the &dOmnic Forge&r, are the final coil type you will need. At &a15000K&r, they're capable of smelting every material and make your EBF look &4f&6a&eb&au&2l&3o&9u&ds&5.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest18.title: &9Omnic Matrix Coil
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest19.descr: This highly advanced alloy will require you to extensively process Ancient Debris and combine the results with a few other items in an Omnic Forge.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest19.title: &9Activated Netherite
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest2.descri: Reinforcing a &6Heart of a Universe&r with &6Hadal Energy Cores&r, many &6Piles of Neutrons&r, and a bunch of &6Eternal Catalysts&r produces an &cInfinity Catalyst&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest20.descr: The &bSubatomic Digital Assembler &fcan be used to produce some creative items from the required data and computational power, the first of which is the &dCreative Quantum Tank.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest20.title: &9Subatomic Digital Assembler
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest21.descr: The &3Hyperbolic Microverse Projector&r is the most powerful projector, capable of running hundreds of missions in parallel. It can perform all previous Micro Miner missions, and opens the door to many new ones.
&6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest21.title: &9Hyperbolic Microverse Projector
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest22.descr: The &6Dimensional Superassembler&r uses dimensional warping to process hundreds of Assembly Line recipes at once.
Notably, the Dimensional Superassembler bypasses the need to use &9ULV Input Buses&r, so you are free to stuff the entirety of a recipe into a single input bus.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest22.title: &9Dimensional Superassembler
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest23.descr: The IPMEPS is capable of altering the laws of physics on a microversal scale, thus allowing the production of previously impossible materials.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest23.title: &9Tier Twelve Micro Miner
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest24.descr: Infinity can be manipulated to create Monium, the strongest possible material.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest24.title: &9Monium
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest25.descr: Turns out corrupting a Microverse has some other interesting consequences, including creating singularities. These impossibilities may just be what you need to create an impossibly perfect circuit line, but you do need to be able to contain it in some way.
Thankfully, you already have a metal that bends the rules, so that should be a good starting place.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest26.descr: This is the largest Extended Crafting Table, capable of handling 11x11 recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest26.title: &9Epic Crafting Table
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest27.descr: &fThe Omnic Forge will allow you to produce post-tank coils and casings. It is also part of the Netherite processing line.
Note that Omnic Matrix Machine Casings are twice as expensive when crafted using the Assembler, so make sure to use your first Omnic Forge to build any extra ones.
Now, you could make this before you get tank, it's perfectly doable, but there's nothing that really needs it.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest27.subti: Wow, that's a lot of omnium!
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest27.title: &9Omnic Forge
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest28.descr: Taking a look at the &6Corrupted Universe Data&r has given you a couple of ideas, but to properly take advantage of it, a new Micro Miner is needed.
This Micro Miner requires an Epic Extended Crafting Table to fit all the things required for a foray into a corrupted universe.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest28.title: &9Tier Eleven Micro Miner
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest29.descr: Using the &6Shattered Universe Data&r and a Tier Eleven Micro Miner, Scrap can be retrieved. Scrap can be sifted into various bits of ruined tech, each of which go through their own miniature processing line to be recycled into &6Holmium&r.
Scrap processing can also yield a variety of other important elements.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest29.title: &9Scrapping
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest3.descri: &6Hadal Energy Cores&r are the ultimate tier of &bSculk&r core, used for the most powerful and advanced items.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest3.subtit: The culmination of so much effort.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest3.title: Hadal Cores
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest30.descr: Thankfully, &9Holmium&r itself does not require any special processing, and can just be smelted.
&9Holmium&r will see use in the next tier of SMDs, as well as things requiring strong magnetic fields.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest30.title: &9Holmium
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest31.descr: Attempting to replicate Universe Creation Data will instead &eshatter the universe inside&r, giving you this unsightly mess.
Not all may be lost, though...
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest31.subti: &7&oUh boss? I think putting the &6Universe Creation Data&r &7&oin the Subatomic Digital Assembler was a bad idea.&r
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest31.title: &9Shattered Universe Data
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest32.descr: &9Complex SMD Components&r are required for &9Dimensional and Monic circuits&r. They can also be substituted for the equivalent of 4 normal SMD components in Crystal, Wetware, and Matter circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest32.title: &9Complex SMD Components
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest33.descr: The precursor to &9Matter Processing Units&r. Note that these boards require circuits themselves to craft.
These circuit boards will also find use in all of the remaining circuit tiers, as they will be upgraded into their respective circuit boards.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest33.title: &9Matter Circuit Board
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest34.descr: A &9Multidimentional CPU Wafer&r needs to be enhanced and cut before it is usable in circuit recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest34.subti: Technically, all CPU Chips are multidimensional.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest35.descr: These Boules have a hefty cost up front, but a single one will last you quite a while, in addition to allowing the creation of new Chips.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest35.title: &9Universe Boules
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest36.descr: The last circuit board. These require UV circuits, but at this point it shouldn't be an issue for you.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest37.descr: The precursor to &6Dimensional Processing Units&r. These will be your first major use for &6Holmium&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest37.title: &9Dimensional Circuit Board
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest38.descr: An amalgamation of gems that is needed for the final circuit tier.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest39.descr: Forcefully combining this Shattered Universe Data with some Shattered Star Data will return &6Corrupted Universe Data&r - a realm with &eglitched duplicates of assorted valuable resources.&r
Using this data alongside some infinity catalysts will return multiple &6Hearts of The Universe&r, making a nice net profit.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest39.subti: Sometimes you gotta spend money to make money
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest39.title: &9Corrupted Universe Data
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest4.descri: The &9Creative Tank&r is a major milestone. Great work!
This tank is your first proper creative item, which can be set to a fluid and then provides an infinite quantity of that fluid.

While your first instinct would be to set up massive rows of fluid solidifers and calling it a day, instead, try using these powerful tanks to passively produce items and materials that were previously complex chains.

&2The GT Creative Tank has been enhanced. You can turn it on and off, configure exactly how much fluid you want it to push and how often, and change which direction the fluid is pushed out. You can even configure the fluid you want directly from EMI!&r

All that said, &ethe pack will still be challenging to complete&r. Infinite resources and power is nice, but it's not everything. There are plenty of materials you can't melt, and creative items will push your factory automation engineering skills to their limits.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest4.subtit: Now this is not the end.\nIt is not even the beginning of the end.\nBut it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest4.title: &9Creative Tank
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest40.descr: The final Nether Star tier. These take advantage of &6Shattered Star Data&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest41.descr: Combining &6Eternal Catalysts&r, &6Activated Netherite Ingots&r, and &6Neutronium Ingots&r will give you the core to one of the most powerful materials.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest41.subti: Are you ready to go infinite?
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest41.title: &9Dormant Infinity Compound
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest42.descr: Bending the laws of physics is no small feat. Thankfully, you've come up with a solution that is compact enough to fit on a Micro Miner.
As you can probably guess, these are expensive.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest42.subti: Handle with care: could destroy the universe.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest42.title: &9Field Stabilised Omnic Pulsar Compound
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest43.descr: The first of a couple creative datas that will allow you to replicate extremely powerful marvels, such as the &9Creative Tank&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest43.title: &9Creative Fluid Data
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest44.descr: These RAM chips will find use in the remaining Mainframe recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest45.descr: The strongest circuit needs the strongest SoCs.
These also can be used to make &6Matter Processors&r more easily.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest46.descr: An upgraded form of the &6Infinity Catalyst&r. It processes 4 &cDormant Infinity Compound Ingots&r at a time, essentially increasing your &6Infinity Ingot&r output per &6Heart of a Universe&r by &e4x&r. They also are recyclable afterwards.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest46.subti: Gee, that's a lot of Infinity Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest47.descr: The final form of the &6Infinity Catalyst&r. It processes 16 &cDormant Infinity Compound Ingots&r at a time, essentially increasing your &6Infinity Ingot&r output per &6Heart of a Universe&r by &e16x&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest47.title: &9Serene Infinity Catalyst
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest48.descr: &9Ruined Hull&r is more abundant than &9Ruined Machine Parts&r but gives less &9Holmium&r overall.
It also drops high-end materials such as &6Neutronium&r, &6Tritanium&r, and &6Crystal Matrix Dust&r, although these are mostly irrelevant to you as you already have the &9Creative Quantum Tank.&r
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest49.descr: &9Ruined Machine Parts&r provide greater amounts of &9Holmium&r compared to &9Ruined Hull&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest5.descri: The &9Stablized Microminers&r are a major milestone! These allow for you to reuse microminers, allowing you to refactor your base a bit.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest5.subtit: Now this is not the end.\nIt is not even the beginning of the end.\nBut it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest5.title: &9Stablized Microminers
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest50.descr: The first of a couple creative datas that will allow you to replicate extremely powerful marvels, such as &9Omnium&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest51.descr: The &9Cryococcal Reverberator&r is a means of using &6Cryococcus&r to convert matter directly into energy more efficiently than any other means.
It only works with a handful of highly energy-dense items and consumes a wealth of &6Cryococcus,&r so you'll need to find a way to produce these consistently and in bulk.

If you manage to supply it with &6Contained Singularities&r, you'll be awarded with enough energy to saturate a &6UIV 4,096A Laser Source Hatch&r while avoiding the explosive risk of &elarge spheres of superheated dragon metal.&r
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest51.title: Cryococcal Reverberator
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest52.descr: The &9Helical Fusion Reactor&r is a very large multiblock structure used for fusing elements into heavier ones &ein parallel&r.
For every Hatch it has, its buffer increases by 80M EU, and has a maximum of 1280M.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest52.title: &9Helical Fusion Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest53.descr: As the most advanced polymer you will need to make, Polyethyl Cyanoacrylate is required for a few endgame crafts.
Fortunately, you won't need too much of it.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest53.title: Polyethyl Cyanoacrylate
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest6.descri: Blasting your &9Dormant Infinity Compound Ingots&r and &cInfinity Catalysts&r together will give you &6Infinity Ingots&r, one of the strongest materials ever created.
Infinity Ingots see a couple of uses, the most notable at the moment being their use in the creation of &9Dimensional Circuits&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest6.subtit: I bet we could make robot arms out of this.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest6.title: &9Infinity Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest7.subtit: No hypothetical aliens were harmed in the harvesting of this item.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest8.descri: You have become Death, destroyer of Universes.
It might probably be obvious, but this miner is your sole source of &6Hearts Of A Universe&r.
It also can be used later to obtain &6Creative Storage Data&r and &6Creative Computation Data&r, and is used to obtain &9Contained Singularities&r for &6Monic Circuits&r.
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest8.title: &9Tier Ten Micro Miner
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.quest9.title: &9&lCreative Chest&r
ftbquests.chapter.end_game.title: End Game
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest1: &3Large Plasma Turbines&r are a powerful late game method of generating power. One Large Plasma Turbine produces &2a base of 16384 EU/t when using an IV Rotor Holder&r.
&2Plasma Turbine
Climbing the ladder of fissile materials will require some specific raw materials and machinery.

&2Uraninite is the base resource you will need, which comes from Uraninite and Pitchblende Ore. You will need to react it with Fluorine and Hydrofluoric Acid in a Chemical Reactor to form Uranium Hexafluoride.

The Uranium Hexafluoride must then be separated into Depleted and Enriched Uranium Hexafluoride in a Centrifuge. The Depleted UF₆ will grant Uranium 238, while the Enriched UF₆ will grant Uranium 235.
&2Uranium Fuel Infrastructure
Thorium is a basic fissile material that can be used to get into the fissile chain. Thorium comes from &6Pitchblende Ore&r, &6Thorium Ore&r, and even &9Deepslate&r (with a few processing steps).
Thorium-Bred Uranium, or &6TBU&r for short, is made from nine clumps of &6Thorium 232&r, made from Thorium enriched in a &3Thermal Centrifuge&r.

This fuel is processed in your &3Fission Reactor&r by placing it in the controller. When a redstone signal is applied it will burn the fuel, generating some power from the reactor and after a while you'll get &6Depleted TBU Fuel&r&r.
The depleted fuel provides tiny clumps of &6Uranium 233&r, &6Uranium 235&r, &6Neptunium 236&r, and &6Neptunium 237&r.
&2Thorium Fission
When you have enough materials, you can craft Uranium isotope clumps into Low-Enriched Uranium-235 Fuel (or &6LEU-235&r, for short). This fuel uses an 8:1 ratio of U238 to U235.

This fuel is processed in your &3Fission Reactor&r by placing it in the controller. When a redstone signal is applied it will burn the fuel, generating some power from the reactor and after a while you'll get &6Depleted LEU-235 Fuel&r.
The depleted fuel is separated in a regular &3Centrifuge&r, resulting in many tiny clumps of fissile materials: &6Uranium 238&r, &6Neptunium 237&r, &6Plutonium 239&r, and &6Plutonium 241&r.
Uranium 235 Fission
Low-Enriched Neptunium 236, or &6LEN-236&r, is the next step in the fissile material fuel chain.
This fuel requires an 8:1 ratio of &6Neptunium 237&r to &6Neptunium 236&r. Using only the results from Thorium fission, it will take two batches of &6Depleted TBU Fuel&r to make your first LEN fuel.
Of course, higher order reactions also will result in small amounts of Neptunium that you can work with as well.
&6Depleted LEN-236&r gives a small bit of Neptunium 237 back, but principally provides &6Plutonium&r and &6Americium&r isotopes.
Neptunium Fusion
&6Uranium 233&r is obtained exclusively from the fission of &6TBU Fuels&r.
&6LEU-233&r is made from one &6U233&r and eight &6U238&r.
&6Depleted LEU-233&r will give you various &6Plutonium&r isotopes and some &6Americium&r.
Uranium 233 Fission
&oNote: this quest accepts Plutonium 238, 239, 241 or 242.&r

Low-Enriched Plutonium 239, or &6LEP-239&r, is made from the usual 8:1 ratio of two isotopes of &6Plutonium&r, 242 and 239, acquired from earlier depleted fuels. You will also need &6Plutonium&r in large amounts for &eSunnarium&r.
The two sources of Plutonium are Uranium-based fuels and Neptunium-based fuels.
&6Depleted LEP-239&r will give you some different isotopes of &6Curium&r for further enrichment.
High-Enriched Plutonium fuels will give better results, but &cgenerate a lot more heat&r. Make sure your reactor cooling is up to the task.
You only need one of this quest's dependencies
Plutonium
&oNote: this quest accepts Americium 241, 242, or 243.
&6Americium 242&r and &6Americium 243&r are used to make &6LEA-242 Fuel&r.
There's also &6Americium 241&r, but this is only useful for making RTGs (which produce small amounts of RF continuously) or decaying down into &6Neptunium&r.
&6Depleted LEA 242 Fuels&r&r will return a lot of &6Curium 246&r, and small amounts of the other three isotopes.
You only need one of this quest's dependencies
Americium
Americium Fission
&oNote: this quest accepts Curium 243, 245, 246 or 247.&r
Low-Enriched Curium 243, or &6LECM-243&r, is made from &6Curium 243&r and &6Curium 246&r. You will also need &6Curium&r in large amounts for &eSunnarium&r.
&6Depleted LECm-243 Fuel&r gives mostly Curium 246 back, but also small quantities of &6Berkelium&r and &6Californium&r isotopes.
&6HECM-247&r is a better alternative for strictly Californium, if your reactor can withstand the heat.
Curium
&oNote: this quest accepts Berkelium 247 or 248.
&6LEB-248 Fuel&r is made with &e8 &6Berkelium 247&r and &e1 &6Berkelium 248&r. When depleted, it results in several different isotopes of &6Californium&r.
Berkelium
Berkelium Fission
&oNote: this quest accepts Californium 249, 250, 251 or 252.
&6Californium&r is the final fissile material in the NuclearCraft processing chain.
&6LECf-249 Fuel&r is made with the 8:1 ratio of &6Californium 252&r and &6Californium 249&r. When depleted, it results in... different isotopes of Californium.
Unless you want &6Californium RTGs&r or are experimenting with further fission routes, this step is probably unnecessary for general materials processing.
Californium
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest2: &6Fusion Coils&r are used in the &2Fusion Reactor MK II&r and &2Fusion Reactor MK III&r.
&2Fusion Coils
&6Sunnarium&r is an alloy formed using &6Plutonium&r, &6Glowstone,&r and &6Curium&r on the &3Crafting Table.&r
It is a common ingredient in higher tier &6Solar Panels&r.
There is a more efficient recipe made in an IV or better &3Mixer&r, but it'll take a long time to produce so consider stocking it passively.

Now that you have all the basic building blocks of nuclear fission, you'll need to start creating breeding chains to mass produced stabilized versions of each element, for the synthesis of &9Omnium&r.
Please note that stabilized versions of each element cannot be turned back into fluids, nor turned back into their original &bNuclearCraft&r isotopes.
Experiment around with larger breeder reactors that can handle highly enriched fuels.
You'll probably want to build multiple reactors to make all the fissile elements in any reasonable amount of time.
Further Adventures In Fission
The &3Data Bank&r acts as a mass storage for &6Data Sticks&r and &6Data Orbs&r. It is also required for reading &6Data Modules&r.

Connect an &3Optical Data Transmission Hatch&r on the Data Bank to an &3Optical Data Reception Hatch&r (replacing the &3Data Access Hatch&r) on your &3Assembly Line&r using &aOptical Cables&r, and it will be able to read the data of all data items within the Data Bank.
You can connect multiple &3Assembly Lines&r to a single Data Bank, but each one will need its own &3Transmission Hatch&r on the Data Bank.

&3Data Access Hatches&r and &3Optical Hatches&r can replace any of the &aComputer Casings&r in the structure, but it must have a minimum of &e3&r &aComputer Casings&r. Each &3Data Access Hatch&r and &3Optical Hatch&r within the structure will consume &d1,920 EU/t&r regardless of their usage.
You will also need a &aMaintenance&r and &aEnergy Hatch&r, which can replace the &aHigh Power Casings&r in front.

Although this is not strictly required until you need to make and read &6Data Modules&r, your single &3Data Access Hatch&r on your &3Assembly Line&r will not have space to hold all the items you need to craft otherwise.

If your Assembly Line setups grow enough, you may need to &echain&r Data Banks. Connect the &3Transmission Hatch&r on the Data Bank with data to the &3Reception Hatch&r of a second Data Bank. The &ereceiving&r Data Bank will be able to read all the data within the transmitting Data Bank, and can send that data to more Assembly Lines or more Data Banks. However, this comes at a greatly increased energy cost for the transmitting Data Bank.
&2Data Bank

&2Optical Fiber Cables&r are used to transfer &eResearch Data&r&r between &3Data Banks&r and &3Assembly Lines&r, or &eComputation Data&r between &3High Performance Computation Arrays&r, &3Network Switches&r, and &3Research Stations&r.
Note that Optical connections are limited to one &aTransmission Hatch&r to one &aReception Hatch&r.
&2Optical Fiber Cables

The &3High Performance Computing Array (HPCA)&r is a computer which provides &dComputation Work&r to be used in the &3Research Station&r. The amount of &dComputation Work&r it provides depends on the type of HPCA parts within it. It also needs to receive adequate &dCooling&r provided by Coolers within its structure.
Connect the &3Computation Data Transmission Hatch&r to the &3Reception Hatch&r on your &3Research Station&r to transfer the &dCWU/t&r produced to it.

The HPCA accepts almost any combination of &3Computation Components&r, &3Coolers&r, &3Bridges&r and &3Empty Components&r within the 3x3 area behind the &aComputer Heat Vents&r. The suggested components will build a &d16 CWU/t&r HPCA, enough for scanning the &3Fusion Reactor Mk2&r, &6UV Circuits&r, and all &6ZPM Components&r. You can get away with less at first, but you will eventually need to upgrade to this computing power. Refer to &eEMI&r for some other possible setups.

The &dCWU/t&r of the HPCA is determined by the sum of the outputs of the &3HPCA Computation Components&r within it. Regular &3Computation Components&r produce &d4 CWU/t&r each, and require &d2 Cooling&r each. &3Advanced Computation Components&r, which you do not have access to yet, produce &d16 CWU/t&r each and require &d4 Cooling&r each.

&dCooling&r is provided by &3Cooler&r blocks within the structure. &3Passive Coolers&r provide &d1 Cooling&r each for free, whereas &3Active Coolers&r provide &d2 Cooling&r each with a steady flow of &9Dielectric PCB Coolant&r, provided through an &3Input Hatch&r. If the Cooling within the HPCA is insufficient, the components may be &cdamaged&r from overheating. The physical position of the components within the HPCA does not matter.
A &3Bridge Component&r may be installed, allowing the HPCA to connect to &3Network Switches&r.

The energy consumption of the HPCA is determined by the sum of its parts. 'Max Energy' refers to the power draw while the HPCA is computing, while 'Upkeep Energy' refers to the power draw when the HPCA is idling.
&2High Performance Computing Array
The &3Research Station&r is an advanced Scanner which consumes &dComputation Work&r provided by connected &3High Performance Computing Arrays&r to research &cZPM&r and higher items.

The function of this multiblock is similar to the Scanner. Place the &6Data Orb&r or &6Data Module&r into the &3Object Holder&r alongside the item to be scanned. After sufficient &dCWU&r has been drawn, the item will be &cconsumed&r and the corresponding data will be written to the data item. Ensure your &3HPCA&r is supplying sufficient &dCWU/t&r - check the scan recipe in &eEMI&r for how much is required.

&3Energy&r, &3Maintenance&r, and &3Computation Hatches&r can only replace the 9 &aComputer Casings&r between the &aComputer Heat Vents&r at the back of the structure. The &3Object Holder&r &cmust face&r the &3Research Station&r controller block.

The Research Station can be accelerated with excess &dCWU/t&r, but it &cdoes not overclock&r with extra &dEU/t&r. Initial recipes run on &dLuV&r power, but &cZPM&r will be required soon, and higher tiers of energy will be required for more advanced scans. As most Research scans take a long time, you should start this process early.
&2Research Station

Once you scan and make your first &6UV Circuits&r and &6ZPM Field Generators&r, you can upgrade your &3HPCA Computing Components&r to &3Advanced Components&r. These produce &d16 CWU/t&r each and require &d4 Cooling&r each.
With them, you can upgrade a single HPCA to produce &d32 CWU/t&r total - enough for basic &6UV components&r and the &3Network Switch&r, which will allow you to go higher.
&2Advanced HPCA

The &3Network Switch&r combines any number of &3Computation Data Reception Hatches&r into any number of &3Computation Data Transmission Hatches&r. This will be required when the &dCWU/t&r requirements of your &3Research Station&r exceed what a single &3HPCA&r can provide.

Connect the &3Computation Data Reception Hatches&r&r to your &3HPCAs&r with &3Bridge Components&r within them, and connect a single &3Computation Data Transmission Hatch&r to your &3Research Station&r, and it will receive the sum of &dCWU/t&r from all of your HPCAs!
Now, all &3Assembly Line&r recipes are available to you, given you have the &dCWU/t&r to research them. The most computationally demanding scan, for the &6Ultimate Battery&r, requires &d144 CWU/t&r.
The Network Switch consumes &d7,680 EU/t&r per &3Computation Hatch&r in its structure.
&2Network Switch
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest3: ...or building a new one, which is probably better.

Yet again this quest asks for the minimal number of casings. Make an extra &229&r if you don't want more than &a2 Fluid Inputs&r&r and &a1 Fluid Output&r. Don't forget the extra &e31 Fusion Glass&r or &6Fusion Machine Casings&r!
&bYes, the Fusion Glass is the same tier as last time, but the Fusion Machine Casings are more expensive.&r
Make sure you're using &6ZPM Energy Hatches&r!

If you insist on upgrading instead of making a new one, don't dismantle the current one before you're sure you've got everything you need to upgrade it, or you might end up having to rebuild the &3MK I Fusion Reactor&r again.
The &3MK II Fusion Reactor&r has an energy buffer of &e320M EU&r.
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest4: &9Darmstadtium&r is formed by fusing Arsenic and Ruthenium, and is the main material for UV machines.
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest5: To make &9Tritanium&r, you first need to make &9Duranium&r. This is done by fusing &9Liquid Gallium&r and &9Radon&r in a &3Fusion Reactor MK I&r or better.
Once you have Duranium, you can fuse Tritanium in a &3Fusion Reactor MK II&r using the Duranium and &9Liquid Titanium&r.
If you're having trouble figuring out the right item and fluid ratios for batching up these processes, consider plugging the relevant recipes into &aEMI&r.
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest6: &2Tritanium Coils are the eighth coil material. At 10800K, it's capable of smelting nearly every material.
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest7: This baby can do any fusion recipe, notably giving you access to &6Neutronium&r.
The multiblock layout is the same as the MK I and MK II, with the same hatch and casing substitutions permitted.
Obviously though, this one uses &6Fusion Machine Casing MK &2III&r and only works with &aUV Energy Hatches&r.
The &3MK III Fusion Reactor&r has an energy buffer of &e640M EU&r.
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest8: This Hull is made with &2Darmstadtium, Yttrium Barium Cuprate Cables, and Polybenzimidazole.&r
You'll need it mainly for the &6Fusion Reactor MK III&r.
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.quest9: &6Americium Ingots&r are obtained by placing &9NuclearCraft&r Americium isotopes into an &3Extractor&r and solidifying the fluid. As with other GT materials, use the ingot or fluid to forge the other forms.

&2You're gonna need quite a bit of Americium.&r You cannot convert this form of Americium back to NuclearCraft Americium isotopes. These are also the best &aItem Pipe&r material, in terms of throughput.
ftbquests.chapter.fun_with_fusion.title: Fission and Fusion
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest1.descrip: This pack is in &eBeta&r. Issues are to be expected at this stage of development.

Do note that a decent number of mods in this pack are also in alpha or beta as well, so before reporting an issue, make sure that the issue can not be replicated with the mod on its own, and if it can, report it to the mod's repository instead.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest1.rich_de: If you find something broken/missing/etc, make an issue on the
, or submit a Pull Request to fix it yourself.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest1.title: &9This pack is in beta!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest10.descri: &2GTCEu Fluid Pipes&r are now available, much improved from CE. Their advantage is higher &9throughput&r, but they have limitations on the kinds of fluids (&eacids, gases&r, etc) they can transport safely. Check each pipe material's tooltip for details. Fluid pipes do require a pump to be able to pull fluids from tanks or machines that lack an autooutput function, but &9ULV pumps (as well as other covers) are now buyable with Monicoins&r.
There are also &6Quadruple and Nonuple Pipes&r for transporting multiple fluid types through the same block.

&bEnderIO&r&6 Fluid Conduits&r are also an option. They have the advantage of being &6Conduits&r, allowing them to fit in the same block as other &6Conduits&r. However, they are &every slow&r to compensate.
You also have access to &9LaserIO&r, which while a little costly, allows for some rather complex and compact filtering.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest10.title: &9Fluid Transport
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest11.descri: &6Gregtech&r adds a decent bit of extra crafting to the earlygame. Thankfully, &bEMI&r has some tools to help make your life &9&lMUCH&r easier when doing all this crafting.
When looking a recipe in EMI, you've likely noticed 3 buttons that appear on each recipe, being &c[❤]&r, &a[┴]&r, and &9[+]&r.

Let's start with &9[+]&r, as it's the simplest: right-click a crafting table, look up the recipe you need and press the &9[+]&r button: if you have all required items for the recipe, this will put them all into the crafting table for you.

&c[❤]&r and &a[┴]&r are used in tandem to create &arecipe trees&r. Pressing &a[┴]&r will pull up a &arecipe tree&r for that given item. Pressing &c[❤]&r on a recipe will mark it as the &cdefault recipe&r for that item, and will show that recipe (and the items used to craft it) in &arecipe trees&r. You can then add &cdefault recipes&r for the items used to craft that recipe, repeat ad nauseam. Note that you can click on a item in the &arecipe tree&r and its recipes will be pulled up.

In the &arecipe tree&r GUI, you can change the batch size by scrolling on the number to the right of the final result. Finally, and most importantly, you can press the &6Magnifying Glass&r to switch to &6Crafting Tree Mode&r, this will &edisplay the items that you need for every step to craft the number of items that you specified&r in your sidebar, and will dynamically update as you craft items. You can click on these &6Synthetic Favorites&r with your Craft to Inventory bind (unbound by default) to &eautomatically craft and then push items back into your inventory&r when using a crafting table, or push the exact number of items needed if using a different inventory.&r

Also note that EMI will commit &cdefault recipes&r to memory, meaning that as you save more and more recipes, EMI will remember them all, and will automatically use them when you pull up a &arecipe tree&r for any given item. Also, you can change the &cdefault recipe&r for an item, and EMI will automatically update the &arecipe tree&r as well. You can also click the &a[┴]&r button found in the bottom left of your inventory screen and it will pull up the &arecipe tree&r GUI as well.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest11.rich_d: On the topic of crafting, if you are not already familiar with how
like EMI or JEI work, read that quest first.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest11.title: &9Recipe Trees and Crafting Trees
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest12.descri: The &eTool Belt&r is a item which can store your tools and exchange them easily! Right now, it has 2 slots, but later, once you unlock &6Steel&r, you can upgrade it all the way to 9 slots with &6Belt Pouches&r, an &3Anvil&r, and some &aXP&r!
Make the Tool Belt, and you can use the keybind (default is &6R&r), while the belt is in your inventory or Bauble Slots &cand you are holding something, or the belt is not empty&r, to open its GUI.
Alternatively, you can right click while holding the belt to open its inventory.

The Tool Belt is equippable as a &bBauble&r. Open your inventory and look for the Baubles button, then click it to reveal the additional bauble slots menu, and put it in the Belt Slot. Or, if you can't tell which bauble slot looks like a belt, just click in every bauble slot until it goes in.

The Tool Belt can store anything with a stack size of 1, like swords, pickaxes, &bGregTech&r tools, and the &6Terminal&r. It has also been modified a bit, so it also allows any &bStorage Drawers&r key, and &cdoesn't allow any Thermal Satchel&r.
Now, you can insert and extract from the belt! You can also use the Keybinds '&eCycle Tool Left&r' and '&eCycle Tool Right&r' whilst you are in the GUI.
