ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest12.subtit: &2A brand new and highly requested mod to CEu to help you manage your tools!&r
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest12.title: &2Tool Belt
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest13.descri: No hoops to jump through here. Smelt &6Wood Logs&f to get &6Charcoal&f. It will serve you well as a fuel source until you locate a vein of &6Coal&f.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest14.descri: &3Iron Furnaces&f can smelt an item in &a160 ticks&f, which is somewhat faster than a vanilla &6Furnace&f, which takes &a200 ticks&f. The fuel efficiency remains the same for all furnaces.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest14.title: Furnace v2.0
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest15.descri: &3Copper Furnaces&f are another step up in speed, taking &a100 ticks&f to smelt an item.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest15.title: Furnace v3.0
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest16.descri: &3Silver Furnaces&f are another step up in speed, taking a mere &a80 ticks&f to smelt an item.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest16.title: Furnace v4.0
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest17.descri: &3Gold Furnaces&f are yet another step up in speed, taking only &a40 ticks&f to smelt an item.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest17.title: Furnace v5.0
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest18.descri: &3Diamond Furnaces&f are even faster, taking only &a25 ticks&f to smelt an item.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest18.title: Furnace v6.0
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest19.descri: &3Obsidian Furnaces&f are slightly faster than &3Diamond Furnaces&f, taking only &a20 ticks&r to smelt an items, and are also blastproof.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest19.title: Furnace v7.0
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest2.descrip: This pack is intended to be played in the &bOverworld&r and &bLost City Dimensions&r.
If you wish to build your base in total safety, place the &6Void World Cake&r down on the ground, and eat a slice to be sent to the &7Void World&r.
The &2Overworld&r has ores to mine, and is a great place to gather resources.
Simply place down and eat any dimensional cake for access to that dimension.
If you're playing with friends, don't forget to invite them to an &eFTB Teams party&r.
Features new to &2CEu&r and quests with new content will be higlighted in &2dark green&r.
Features new to &9Monifactory&r and quests with new content will be higlighted in &9Blue&r.
Notes about things in &5Beta&r will be higlighted in &5Dark Purple&r.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest2.title: &9Genesis
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest20.descri: It smelts items at a blazing quick &a5 ticks&r each. At this point, you might as well just make a &3Multi Smelter&r.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest20.title: Furnace v8.0
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest21.descri: &9With EMI, instead of showing you a separate recipe for every tool-resource combination, tools are instead grouped. You can use any tool from that group - for example, the &6#forge:tools/hammers &9group means that any &aHammer &9can be used there.

First, make a &aHammer&f (not a &aMining Hammer&f, mind you... six ingots, not plates). Hammers can be used to turn &etwo ingots into one plate&f. &6Plates&f can make a &aFile&f, Files can make &6Rods&f, etc. Use EMI to work your way down the list of tools.
&6Wrought Iron&f is probably your best bet for a tool material right now, but better materials will become available as you progress.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest21.title: Some Starter Tools
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest22.descri: &aMining Hammers&r offer a relatively cheap way to mine out areas much faster. They clear a 3x3 area of blocks (unless you're crouching) and mine quickly.
&2GTCEu now has Mining Hammers natively! You can craft them with any GT tool material. &r
Your free 4 Diamond Mining Hammers should last you a while, and you can always fix them using an anvil and some diamonds.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest22.title: Mining Hammers
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest23.descri: &9Gregtech Axes are able to veinmine an entire tree at once!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest23.title: &9Tree chopping
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest24.descri: The &aCrescent Hammer&r is for use on machines from &bThermal Expansion&f, but can be used for basic wrench interactions with blocks from almost every mod. &9It can also now adjust Gregtech pipes.
The &aYeta Wrench&r is used with machines and conduits from &bEnder IO&f, and has several special display modes (&6sneak-mouse wheel&f to switch between them).
The &aGregTech Wrench&r is used to rotate GregTech machines and redefine their output sides. &2It also has some of the capabilities of the other Wrenches now.&r
You can see which mod a machine is from with the &9blue text&f at the bottom of its tooltip.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest24.subtit: Confused about all the Wrenches yet?
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest24.title: &9Wrenches Galore
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest25.descri: You might want to get yourself an anvil instead of breaking and crafting new tools every time. Anvils&f spawn abundantly in &bLost Cities&f buildings, so go and snatch one!

Put a damaged tool and some material it's made of inside. For example, you'll need to use &6Wrought Iron Ingots&f to repair tools made of &6Wrought Iron&f. The only tools unable to be repaired are the Mortar and the Plunger.
Also, you can now repair your free &6Mining Hammers&r with some &6Diamonds&r!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest25.subtit: &3Anvils&f can be used to repair almost all &bGregTech tools&f!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest25.title: Proper Tool Care
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest26.descri: &6Redstone&f: Found only deep in the world, in massive veins paired with &6Cinnabar&f and &6Ruby&f.

&6Copper&f: Two primary sources. &6Tetrahedrite&f veins are higher up, while &6Chalcopyrite&f veins are lower, paired with some small amounts of &6Iron&f. You'll also find &6Malachite&f inside of Iron veins; this is another type of copper ore.

&6Tin&f: Found essentially at ground level. &6Cassiterite&f is another type of tin ore, and they're always found together. If you cannot find a vein of tin, there are small amounts of tin inside veins of &6Aluminium&f and &6Rock Salt&f, which might be enough to hold you over until you find a proper tin vein.
&6Coal&f: Found in relatively shallow depths. &6Lignite Coal&f is &2removed.
&6Gold&f: Found inside of &6Magnetite&f veins, close to the surface.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest26.subtit: Before you continue, you'll need access to some more materials.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest26.title: More Materials
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest27.descri: For now, the best material to make these pipes out of is probably &6Tin&r.

Their advantage over &bEnder IO &3Item Conduits&r is their far higher &6throughput&r. An unupgraded EIO Item Conduit transports &98 items per second&r, and up to &9128&r when upgraded. In comparison, small low-tier Item Pipes can transfer &964 items per second&r, and those made from later materials can transfer &9multiple stacks per second&r.
They don't auto-extract by themselves, so you have to use &3Conveyor Covers&r etc. with them.
The priority mechanics are more complicated, so skip ahead if you are not interested:

A Destination will have a Routing Value calculated, which is the sum of all Routing Values of the individual Pipes to that Destination. Whichever Destination has the lowest Routing Value will be the one selected for Insertion.
Restrictive Pipes typically have the lowest Priority for insertion due to their higher Routing Value.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest27.subtit: &2Item Pipes are back in GTCEu! They will transport items instantly through them.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest27.title: &2GT Item Pipes
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest28.descri: Although most &ealloys&f require an &3Alloy Smelter&f, some alloys can be made simply by mixing the correct metal dusts together.

&9Steel is one of these alloys, being made by mixing Wrought Iron dust with Coal dust or Charcoal dust&r. &2Steel forms the basis of LV Machine Hulls&r, and allows you to make &6Belt Pouches&r for upgrading your &eTool Belt&r.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest28.title: &9Steel
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest29.descri: Feeding a &3Steam Dynamo&f with water by hand is a pretty silly idea.
A &6Water Collector&f will take care of that for you, albeit slowly. It does, however, auto-output the water, making it simple to use.
&2GTCEu has a Primitive Water Pump, which can do it faster. However, it requires Treated Wood, which requires Creosote from a Coke Oven.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest29.title: &9Infinite Water
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest3.descrip: In &9Monifactory&r, all dimensional transit is done through the power of &6TelePastries&r. No Portals here!
This quest is repeatable and gives you a free cake to the &2Overworld&r or &7Void World&r every hour. You can also refill your cakes with the items indicated in their tooltips.
&cDon't forget to have a way to get back!&r If you do forget, click on the Emergency Items heart on the right side of the quest book screen.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest3.title: Cake Based Dimensional Transit
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest30.descri: The &aHang Glider&f is a great way to cross long distances, if you're so inclined.
If you don't want to go exploring for Cows, just buy a pair of "&6Spawn Cow&f" eggs and breed them. Seriously, spend your &9coins&f!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest30.title: Glider
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest31.descri: Going out in search of a &6Rubber Tree&f is a viable option for sure. However, if this isn't appealing, you can also &eshear leaves&f and make &6Plantballs&f out of them. Plantballs smelt into &6Slime&f, and Slime smelts into &6Rubber&f.
You'll want to transition to Rubber Trees at some point, though, since the &eratio of leaves to rubber is quite poor&f.

Rubber can be hammered into sheets just like metals can be turned into plates. It's quite inefficient to do it this way, but such is the life of early game &bGregTech&f. At least rubber isn't particularly hard to come by.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest31.title: Rubber Sheets
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest32.descri: Although most &ealloys&f require an &3Alloy Smelter&f, some alloys can be made simply by mixing the correct metal dusts together.
Copper Dust mixed with Redstone makes &6Red Alloy Dust&f.
Iron Dust mixed with Redstone makes &6Conductive Iron Dust&f.
&3Smelt&f it into ingots, &ahammer&f it into &6Plates&f, and &acut&f them into &6Wires&f.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest32.title: From Dust to Wires
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest33.descri: The most basic cables, such as these &6Red Alloy Cables&f, can be wrapped in their &6Rubber&f insulation by hand.
More advanced types of cables will require an &3Assembling Machine&f and liquid &9Rubber&f, but you can do it the simple way for now.

&2CEu has GT6-style pipes and cables on by default. &rYou will need to use &aWire Cutters&r to connect each side of a cable to machines or other cables. Placing it against the machine or cable automatically connects it as well. The same behaviour follows for GT pipes, whose tool is the &aWrench&r.
This can save you from energy or fluids going the wrong way. But if you don't like this, disable the config option for "GT6 style pipes and cables" in the GregTech config file.

&2GT cables now support RF conversion natively! &rYou can plug an &9RF&r machine into an &9EU&r cable directly and it will convert the energy. You cannot, however, plug an &9RF&r power souce directly into an &9EU&r cable.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest33.title: &2Cables
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest34.descri: The &6Steam Dynamo&r will be your source of &9power&r for the early game. It requires &9Water&r and burnable fuel like &6Coal&r or &6Sugar Cane&r to produce power.

You'll need a small bit of &6Silver&f for this dynamo. If you haven't found a &6Galena vein&f yet (which is where Silver is), then consider "buying" some &6Silver Ore&r using &9Monicoins&r. You won't need a ton of silver and lead just yet, so it won't bankrupt you.
Keep in mind that &eDynamos only output power when burning through fuel, and only the block/cable attached directly to the coil will get provided with power&f.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest34.title: Steam Dynamo
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest35.descri: Better fuel means you need to use less of it.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest35.title: &9More Efficient
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest36.descri: These can be used to transport energy from your &3Steam Dynamos&r to various destinations.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest36.subtit: The most basic tier of &aRF&r energy conduits from &bEnder IO&r.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest36.title: Conductive Iron Energy Conduits
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest37.descri: &rThe &3Steam Dynamos&r&r&r you have made are generating &aRF power&r, but &bGregTech&r machines require &aEU power&r. With your first &6circuit&r in hand, you are ready to build a &eLow Voltage (LV) &3&2Energy Converter&r.
The &2Energy Converter&r is a special device that &econverts &2between &aRF power&r and &aEU power&r. They come in &2four sizes: 1A, 4A, 8A, and 16A.
&aRF&r converts into &aEU&r at a &e4 to 1 ratio&r. &a100 RF&r becomes &a25 EU&r, and vice-versa. &2Use a Soft Hammer to change the conversion direction.
&eNote that you need an RF buffer to output into when you convert EU->RF!&r
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest37.title: LV Power
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest38.descri: The &6Battery Buffer&r is a machine which can hold &6Batteries&r for energy storage. Each Battery accepts up to 2 amps and outputs up to 1 amp.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest38.title: Charging Batteries
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest39.descri: Although there are several types of rechargeable batteries you can make, &2Lithium Batteries&r are the best ones, and the only ones you should really consider making.
&6Lithium&r is possible to find inside of &6Tungsten&r veins, however, they are only found in the End dimension. Consider "buying" some Lithium with &9Monicoins&r.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest39.title: LV Power Storage
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest4.descrip: &bFunctional Storage&f provides a huge amount of storage for a single item type. Use them for things you have a lot of, such as stone, dirt and ores.
&9Framing Template items can be used to easily decorate your drawers.&r
Furthermore, you can do special stuff with your drawers, with &9Tools&r and &9Upgrades! Search &e@Functionalstorage&r in &bEMI&r to see them!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest4.title: &9Drawers
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest40.descri: The &9Tinker's Workstation&r is able to charge items at a modest rate, but can only charge items that use &aRF&r. &9This is also used for upgrading &bThermal&9 items&r.
The Turbo Charger is a little more expensive, but is able to charge items at a &omuch&r faster rate and is able to charge items that use &aRF&r and &aEU&r.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest40.title: &9Charging Items
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest41.descri: &6Sulfur Ore&r is the only source of &6Sulfur Dust&r that's currently available to you.
You may want to spend a few &9Monicoins&r on the ore to jumpstart your power storage.
Otherwise the ore is only available in &athe Nether&r, and the only way to get there is with a &6Nether Cake&r. Oh no!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest41.title: Sulfur Ore
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest42.descri: Basic &aFlux Capacitors&r hold a whopping &9500 kRF&r of energy and are useful for keeping your &aRF-powered&r equipment and tools charged.
Put one into your newly crafted &9Charger&r to charge it. You can then put it in your inventory to charge your items with &aRF&r.
The Flux Capacitor is a &bBauble&r, so open your inventory and look for the Baubles button, click it to reveal the additional bauble slots menu and put it into any slot you wish.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest42.title: &9Flux Capacitors
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest43.descri: Unlike &aRF power&r, which is safe to transport in any &6conduit&r, &aEU power &erequires caution&r. The key is to always &amatch or exceed&r the &eVoltage &rand&e Amperage&r of your power source with your &6cables&r and machines.

&cNEVER &rhook up your Energy Converter&r to a cable that has fewer &eAmps&r than your Energy Converter or Battery Buffer generates. For example, you must use &64x cable&r for a 4A Converter&r, and &616x cable&r for a filled 16-slot Battery Buffer&r. Cables with insufficient amperage rating will &cburn and be destroyed&r. &2Both the multiple-amp-source and multiple-face-input bugs from CE have been fixed - the Energy network now works as intended.&r
Similarly, your cable must match or exceed the &eVoltage&r of your machines, or they will &cburn and be destroyed&r.

&cNEVER&r connect a machine to excessive &eVoltage&r or it will &cvaporize&r. Touching a &6wire&r with connected &aEU power&r will &cinjure or kill you&r, so for your safety, &euse &6cables&e instead&r!
&2Superconductor-type wires do not damage you in CEu. The 0-loss cables in CE (Conductive Iron, Energetic Alloy, etc.) are considered Superconductors.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest43.title: A Primer on Power
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest44.descri: Now that you have everything you need to power your machines, it's time to put it all together.

Your Steam Dynamo needs burnable fuel (like &6Coal&r) and &9water&r. It will output RF power through the Excitation Coil (the red bit at the top). The orientation of the Steam Dynamo can be adjusted with a &aCrescent Hammer&r if needed.
&6Energy Conduits&r can be used to transfer that RF power, but the dynamo can also output RF directly into an Energy Converter by making the Excitation Coil touch the Energy Converter.

The Energy Converter transforms RF power into EU, outputting the resulting EU through the side with a red dot. The orientation can be adjusted using a &aWrench&r. Attach your &6Conductive Iron Wires&r to the output side of the Energy Converter.
Now all you need are some &bGregTech&r machines to power up! You can make whatever you want, but its recommended that you get these two first:
The &6Wiremill&r will make crafting wires much, much easier.
The &2Bender&r will make Plates from one ingot instead of two.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest44.title: Putting it all Together
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest45.descri: Open your inventory and look at the top-left corner of the screen. Click the map-looking icon called &eClaim Manager&r.
&6Click a chunk&r to claim it as yours. This will prevent unwanted creeper explosions and other players from interacting with your base.
&eIf you're playing on a server with custom settings, ask the server owner what methods are available&f.

To invite players to your &bFTB Utils&f party, look for a corresponding button in the same corner. Parties share claimed chunks with each other. You can configure permissions for your party's claimed chunks in the party settings menu.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest45.subtit: You might be wondering what chunkloading options there are in the pack.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest45.title: Claim Your Chunks and Invite Teammates!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest46.descri: While there are no types of veins that are extremely rare, you're likely to struggle with finding at least one of the less common vein types. This isn't really avoidable.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest46.rich_d: You will accumulate a lot of
Search for various ores (generally the first one listed in
) to find the coin recipes for them. Alternatively, hover your cursor over a coin and press
to see what you can buy with it.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest46.title: Spend Your Coins!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest47.descri: In most expert packs, you want to try to process as little ore as possible before you get access to ore doubling. It's a habit most of us pick up.
Obvious exceptions would be rare materials or anything you buy with &9Monicoins &fbecause you can't find it. Those are worth doubling, if possible.

But at least for now, you shouldn't feel any guilt about smelting the more common ores without doubling them! &eOre doubling can be safely ignored until you have the &2Steam Grinder&r&e or High Voltage machines.&r
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest47.rich_d: Click to go to the quest
You shouldn't feel any pressure to do that in
, though. Ore veins are massive, mining is extremely fast with
Macerators' byproducts aren't available until HV.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest47.title: &2Ore Doubling?
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest48.descri: If your server admin allows it, you can use JourneyMap to create and teleport to waypoints you set. You can access JourneyMap waypoints by hitting the N key by default. Use this feature to gather resources quickly.

If JourneyMap teleportation is disabled, you can still use the &e/sethome&r command to register where your house is, and &e/home&r to return to it. If you supply a name (default "home") then you can register and go to multiple locations. There are some &erestrictions&r on this though: there is a limit on the number of homes you can set, &eit takes a few seconds of standing still to activate&r and there is a &ecooldown&r between uses.
Later on you'll discover other means of teleportation.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest48.title: JourneyMap and Registering Homes
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest49.descri: &n&9Monifactory&r&r shares an official Discord server with Pansmith's other projects, which serves as a useful community resource.

On the server, there are flowcharts and guides to help you with many parts of the pack accessable via the server's helpful bot, development announcements and more are available in the &n#announcements&r channel, and the community helps with tech support questions, and investigates possible bug reports.
You can also chat with many fellow players there if you like, who are largely willing to help with general questions one might have.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest49.rich_d: To join the server, you can use the button on the Main Menu to go to the join URL, or if you're not into Discord you can find other projects from the modpack author on
Issue tracking and development is handled on the respective GitHub project repositories. The repository for this pack is
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest49.subtit: what's a voltage? can I eat it?
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest49.title: Discord and GitHub
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest5.descrip: &b&lEMI&r is the list of all items that you see every time you open your inventory. It's the better(tm) recipe book that shows you all available items and recipes in the modpack. Note that &b&lEMI&r is based on &b&lJEI&r, and people tend to use the names interchangably.
To see it in action, pull up a quest that requires an item of some sort and just click the item!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest5.rich_de: If you want to know how to craft an item, just hover your mouse over it and press
One of the remarkable features of EMI is that it's also capable of helping you with recipes, covered more in
. EMI will list all available recipes.
If you instead want to know what recipes use an item, hover over it and press
Hover over an item and press
to bookmark it. To remove a bookmarked item from the list, press
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest5.title: &9&lUse EMI! Use EMI! USE. EMI.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest50.descri: Each quest in the tab will give you a description of the machine and the minimum voltage required to run the recipe.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest50.rich_d: Click to go to the chapter
was added to help you visualise and give you tips on making chemicals, among other important things to automate. Use it wisely!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest50.title: &2Processing Lines Tab
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest51.descri: Circuits are the baseline of the entire &9Monifactory&r progression, so keep climbing!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest51.rich_d: Click to go to the chapter
was added so you can keep track of the important bits of the pack.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest51.title: Progression Tab
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest52.descri: &bGregTech&r adds an &einteractive in-world preview&r for all &bGregTech&r multiblocks! &6Shift-right-click&r a placed controller &ewith an empty hand&r to activate a hologram depicting the default layout of the structure to help you with building. As you place blocks, the structure will be validated and the &efirst incorrect block&r it detects will be highlighted in red.
&6Sneak-right-click&r to cycle from the full view through each layer. When on the final layer of the preview, this will remove the preview.
&6Sneak-left-click&r to go back to the previous layer, or close the preview from the full view.
In the &eJEI previews&r for multiblocks, &6left-click&r and drag the mouse to rotate the preview.
Additionally, you can &6right-click&r and drag the mouse to pan the preview or &6shift-right-click&r and drag to zoom in or out.
Some blocks in the multiblock preview have additional tooltips to provide more information on how the multiblock can form.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest52.title: Multiblock Machine Previews
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest53.rich_d: , allowing for quick, customizable, and easy sorting of any inventory! The keybind is
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest53.title: Inventory Sorting
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest54.descri: If you &osomehow&r run out of charge on your prospector, simply submit it back in and we'll give you a fresh one!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest54.title: Recharge Your Prospector!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest55.descri: This pack has &aSnad&r, which is simply a sand-like block that instantly grows sugar cane/cactus on top of it when it receives either a block update or a redstone update.
The sugar cane it produces can be used as a fuel for your dynamos, and later you can even brew it for &9Biomass&r.

This quest calls for a &aRedstone Clock&r, but there are other ways to make snad grow sugar cane even faster (like a vanilla observer clock pointing into the Snad). Make sure to set the timer to pulse as fast as possible.
To collect the sugar cane, you can use a piston and an observer.

For now, a &3Vacuum Chest&r should help keep the floor clean, and causes less lag than Hoppers. A &aVoid Upgrade&r in a &6Storage Drawer&r will automatically delete any items that overflow the drawer's capacity, so it's a good way to ensure you don't crash your server from accumulating a massive sugar cane pile before safer block breakers are available to you.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest55.title: Snad
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest56.descri: You may wish to &aautomatically sprint&r instead of having to press &eControl + W&r or &eW twice&r.
To achieve this, change the &bSprint&r keybind to &eW&r. (or the same keybind as Walk Forward)
A &aGrappling Hook&r is also very useful in an urban environment, allowing you to climb buildings with ease!
There are lots of ways to upgrade and improve your &aGrappling Hook&r, so play around with it.
Open your inventory and look for the &3Curios&r button, click it to reveal the additional curio slots, and put the hook in the hook-shaped slot.
The default key to fire a hook is &6C&r, however if you want to change it, simply search for &5category:ReHooked&r in the key binds screen and change it to whatever you want.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest56.title: Movin' Around
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest57.descri: All furnaces from &bIron Furnaces&r can be augmented to be &afaster&r, more &afuel efficient&r, and &asmelt multiple items at once&r!
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest57.title: Furnace Augments
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest58.descri: You can copy and paste settings from different &eFurnaces&r using a &6Furnace Setting Linker&r.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest58.title: Ctrl + C, Ctrl + V
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest6.title: &9Terminal
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest7.descrip: &c&rOres in &9Monifactory&f exist in large clusters, or '&eveins&f'. These veins are scattered around the world, and are relatively common. &2The upgraded HV Electric Prospector's Scanner you were given will tell you the types of ores you can find within a 7x7 chunk area!

While the Prospector requires energy to work, you are unlikely to deplete its battery. That said, the quest book will later guide you towards making &2an HV Battery&r to charge &aHV tools &rin your inventory.

In order to proceed, you'll need to locate a source of &6Iron&f. You have a few options. &6Magnetite&f veins are higher up and contain large amounts of iron, as well as some &6Vanadium&f and &6Gold&f. Another good source of iron is &9Goethite&f veins, which contain several types of iron. Finally, &6Pyrite&f can be found paired with &6Copper&f in several types of veins.

&6Wrought Iron&f is obtained simply by &esmelting Iron a second time&f. It has more durability than Iron, so it is better for making tools, but &cdo not convert your entire Iron supply over to Wrought Iron&f. The two materials are not interchangeable and you'll need Iron or Wrought Iron as demanded by various recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest7.title: Iron Supply
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest8.descrip: &bSophisticated Storage&r and &bSophisticated Backpacks&r are great options for storing items, both at your base and on the go, as well as offering a variety of both helpful and fun upgrades.

&bSophisticated Storage&r in particular is great for cheap storage. It's able to store 3 barrels' worth of items at its lowest tier (which costs only a bit of iron to craft), and can be upgraded to hold even more items.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest8.title: &9Sophisticated Storage Shenanigans
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest9.descrip: These are quests for a full stack of many of the materials in the game. Those are the materials you'll need to synthesize &5Omnium&r, the basic endgame resource. It's the pack's way of letting you know what materials you should be prepared to mass produce as you approach the end.

Of course, it's not necessary or even advisable to try to finish up all of these quests the moment they become available. Some will be incredibly easy (like &6Iron&f and &6Copper&f), while others will be brutally grindy at early tech levels. The rewards are all the same: &91 Moniquarter each&f, so use your best judgement on which ones to complete and which to ignore for later.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest9.rich_de: Click to go to the chapter
Elements and Alloys quest book tab
. This might seem a bit premature to suggest, but it has a reason.
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.quest9.title: Elements and Alloys
ftbquests.chapter.genesis.title: Genesis
ftbquests.chapter.into_the_microverse.qu: &6Black Steel&r will be used to make various items from &bExtended Crafting&r. It will also be the basis of other Steel types later on.
Black Steel
An advanced ingredient used for the &aUltimate Extended Crafting Table&r and other late-game recipes.
This is an even larger Extended Crafting Table, capable of handling 9x9 recipes.
&9PackagedAuto is now available, so just use that to automate these recipes.
&9Ultimate Crafting Table
This table allows you to craft 7x7 Extended Crafting Table recipes.
&9Don't forget that you can automate Extended Crafting recipes before you get PackagedAuto by converting your Extended Crafting tables into autocrafting tables.
&9Elite Crafting Table
With the Advanced Crafting Table, you can now craft 5x5 recipes.
&9You can automate Extended Crafting recipes before you get PackagedAuto by converting your Extended Crafting tables into autocrafting tables.
&9Advanced Crafting Table
Again, combining a few Components will make a Catalyst.
You may have noticed that The End portals in Strongholds are disabled.
The only way to access The End is to... &ebake a cake&r. You can refill it with &6Eyes of Ender&r.
Prepare some gear, eat a slice, and get ready for a fight!
The End...?
&9Ender Air&r, collected from a &3Gas Collector&r, can be sent into the &3Vacuum Freezer&r to turn it into &9Liquid Ender Air&r.
&9Liquid Ender Air&r can be sent into a &2Distillation Tower&r to break it down into its components.
&2Liquid Air and Liquid Nether Air give different useful components too.
&2Distilling Liquid Ender Air
With your Rocket built, fuel loaded, and destination set, it's time for the prelaunch checklist.
- &eMake sure you're wearing your Space Suit&r (all four pieces) and that it has a full tank of Oxygen.
- Two &aWaystones&r, with one set up to bring you back home.
When you're sure you're prepared, sit in your rocket and press &eSpace&r.
Liftoff!
Let me play among the stars
Fly Me To The Moon
Now that you've dealt with the dragon, seek the bedrock structure floating mid-air around the edge of the main island.
Carefully throw an &6Ender Pearl&r inside one (where there's a portal-looking texture) to teleport to a distant island.
Once there, gather some &6Chorus Flowers&r. You'll have to smash the flower itself to get it: simply breaking the stem of a plant will not drop the flower.
To get back to the main island, throw an Ender Pearl into another bedrock portal structure.
&6Engines&r provide thrust, and &6Tanks&r provide fuel for your engines, make sure to have a decent amount of both.
Being able to ride your rocket is important, too, so don't forget to add a &6seat&r.
While sitting on a rocket, you can open your inventory to open check the rocket's thrust, and insert fuel and a ID Chip.
&9Rocket Parts
Used for Ultimate tier &bExtended Crafting&r.
Don't worry if you can't make these for a while. You'll probably get to them around IV power.
Making yourself a space suit is the most important step towards your space adventures.
This suit lets you breathe in space, which is kind of important.
If you wish, you can hide the spacesuit from your playermodel via the cosmetic armor buttons.
&9Space Suit
&6Right-click &rwhile holding this to bring up a catalog of various locations.
In this case, you want to go to the &7Overworld's Moon&r, so select that.
Then, place it in the rocket's inventory, accessed by shift-right-clicking the rocket with an empty hand.
Tells your rocket where to go
&9Planet ID
The &9Rocket Scanner&r is used to create rockets from various blocks.

To use it, build the multiblock (facing either east or west), then place &6engines&r and &6tanks&r (as well as other blocks) within the given area. Once you are satisfied, press the &eBuild Rocket&r text in the Rocket Scanner's GUI.
Now it's time to think vertically
&9Gregtech Rockets
Even simple rockets demand &6Double Plates&r for their construction. In this case, made out of &6Steel&r.
Mix &9Oxygen&r and &9Dimethylhydrazine&r together to make &9Rocket Fuel&r.
This needs an &6HV&r Chemical Reactor. &9Dimethylamine&r and &9Monochloramine&r combine together into &9Dimethylhydrazine&r. &2You can also combine Methanol, Ammonia, and Hypochlorous Acid.
Dimethylhydrazine
&9Methanol&r and &9Ammonia&r combine together to make &9Dimethylamine&r.
I know you're expecting a Breaking Bad joke here, but I don't walt to go for such low hanging fruit.
&9Hypochlorous Acid&r and &9Ammonia&r combine together to make &9Monochloramine&r.
Monochloramine
&9Hydrogen&r and &9Nitrogen&r combine together to make &9Ammonia&r in an &6HV&r Chemical Reactor.

An easy way to get Nitrogen is to centrifuge &9Air&r, which will require you to build an &3Air Collector&r. You could also electrolyze &6Saltpeter&r, distill &9Fermented Biomass&r in a &3Distillation Tower&r, or get huge amounts from &2distlling Liquid Air in a Distillation Tower.&r.
&2Ammonia
&9Water&r and &9Chlorine&r can be combined to make &9Hypochlorous Acid&r. If you add &9Mercury&r to catalyze the reaction, the yield is much better.
&ePlease note that Hypochlorous Acid and Hydrochloric Acid are different things.&r
You're already familiar with Chlorine production from your forays into Plastics, but a great source of Mercury is &2centrifuging &6Redstone&r.
A component used for more advanced items related to &bExtended Crafting&r.
&9Oxygen&r, &9Hydrogen&r, and &6Carbon&r combine together in a &3Chemical Reactor&r to make &9Methanol&r.
Methanol
Here comes the chemistry.

It might seem crazy right now, but you'll want a dedicated &3Chemical Reactor&r for pretty much every chemical you want to process. You probably want to hold off on doing that until you've got a solid base of autocrafting though... it stings a lot less when you can just request crafts of Chemical Reactors from your AE2 system.
MV Chemical Reactor
The Moon is a barren, lifeless rock... So why did you want to come here?

One major draw is that &6Moon Turf&r, which makes up the surface of the Moon, is an efficient means of obtaining &9Deuterium&r. It will be useful for producing &9Microversium&r, &9Tritium&r, plasmas from fusion, and crystallizing &6Dilithium&r.

The Moon also contains fluid deposits of &eDeuterium&r and &eHelium-3&r, which you can harvest with a &3Fluid Rig&r. However, you will want to use the second Fluid Rig tier to extract it, as the amount of Deuterium and Helium-3 is too low to be anything appreciable from a first tier Fluid Rig.
Space exploration isn't mandatory in this pack, so if you don't feel like exploring space with &bAdvanced Rocketry&r, then you can centrifuge &9Hydrogen&r for &eDeuterium&r instead.
Just keep in mind that it's much less rewarding to skip this and you'll need lots of Hydrogen to compensate, although you won't need too much for the first &3Microverse Projector&r.
In &6HV&r Age and more effectively in &9IV&r Age, you can also get this from processing &9Ender Air&r, which may be better than going to the moon, depending on your circumstances.&r

There are also several ores that are rare on the Overworld but exist in abundance on the Moon. In particular, the Moon contains large quantities of &6Titanium&r (in the form of &6Rutile Ore&r and &6Ilmenite Ore&r) and &6Tungsten&r (in the form of &6Scheelite Ore&r and &6Tungstate Ore&r).
&2Deuterium
&6Hellish Matter&r and &6Ender Pearl&r can be crafted into Extraterrestrial Matter.
This is your first &3Microverse Projector&r.

These structures are used to project &6Micro Miners&r into a &eMicroverse&r to obtain valuable loot such as &6ores&r, &6gems&r, and otherwise unobtainable items&r like &6Radium Salt&r and &6Naquadah Dust&r. &cKeep in mind that Micro Miners are single-use!&r

Microverse Projectors are &bGregTech&r multiblocks, which means that they're just as flexible as other machines in terms of the I/O block placement: &epositions of Buses and Hatches can be swapped with any Microverse Projector Casing&r.

A single &6HV Energy Input&r supports missions up to 1024 EU/t. To process the rest, you'll need to upgrade the multiblock to at least &eEV power&r, which is either &6two HV Energy Inputs&r or &6one EV Energy Input&r. Missions will also overclock, increasing in speed each time the projector's energy tier increases and available power reaches the next multiple of four times the base mission power.
Hover your mouse over the Small Microverse Projector and press &bU&r to see all available missions.
&6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
&2Small Microverse Projector
Very fluxy.
A reagent used in the majority of &6Micro Miner&r missions.
There are several ways to produce &6Quantum Flux&r. All are viable, so figure out which one works best for you.
This is your first Micro Miner ever. &2You'll need that Phosphorous in the LV Field Generators.&r
* Galena Ore
&2* Molybdenum Ore&r
&6* Moon Turf
* Dilithium
* Salt Ore&r
When equipped with a Gemstone Sensor (which may not be available to you yet):
&2* Perfect Diamond
&6* Apatite Ore
* Tricalcium Phosphate Ore
* Quartzite Ore&r
Yes, not the last: these things aren't reusable.
Can also be used to bring &bStellar Creation Data&r, but less efficiently than the Tier Two.
This one can get you:
&6* Dense Iron Ore
* Cassiterite Ore
* Redstone Ore
* Nickel Ore
&2* Ilmenite Ore&r
&6* Uraninite Ore
&2First Foray Into The Microverse

Place down a &6Waystone&r, set a memorable name (and enable &6Global&r if you want other players to access it), in order to be able to easily warp to that location, either using a &6Warp Scroll&r, a &6Warp Stone&r or a second Waystone.
Thinking with Waystones
Waystones also &anaturally generate&r across the world, so nothing is stopping you from simply roaming around and stealing Waystones for your own needs.
Exploration can pay off!
With access to &6Crystaltine components&r, &3Auto Crafting Tables&r are now an option for automation of any size of crafting table - including 3x3.

Every &3Auto Crafting Table&r comes with three recipe slots in the top-right corner. To configure a recipe, the crafting grid must be filled with the recipe you wish to automate, and then saved to the table by &8Shift-Left-Clicking&r one of those recipe slots.
Saved recipes must then be selected with a &8Left-Click&r to indicate that that recipe should be crafted. Only one recipe can be selected at a time.

Lastly, place an inventory atop the table - The &3Auto Crafting Table&r cannot be inserted to, and &ecan only pull items from that inventory&r. At this point you can put ingredients in the inventory and &aRF&r power in the table to begin automated crafting.
In compensation for the cost of the &6Crystaltine Ingots&r and confusing logistics, these tables have throughput capabilities comparable to fully-accelerated &3Molecular Assemblers&r.
Any Auto Crafting Table
Auto Crafting Tables
Combine several components into a catalyst.
&6Phosphorus&r can be obtained by processing &6Tricalcium Phosphate Ore&r or &6Apatite Ore&r into dust and electrolyzing several times.
Both ores are found in &6Apatite&r veins.
Phosphorus
&9Phosphoric Acid&r is a key component of &6Luminessence&r, which will be used extensively for such things as &6Nether Stars&r, &6Lumium Blend&r, and &bExtended Crafting&r components.
It can be made using several equally viable recipes:
&6Phosphorus&r, &9Oxygen&r, and &9Water&r can be chemically reacted to produce &9Phosphoric Acid&r (Requires the &3Large Chemical Reactor&r).
Alternatively, you can combine &6Phosphorus Pentoxide&r and Water for a much faster reaction.
Otherwise, you can react &6Apatite Dust&r, &9Sulfuric Acid&r, and Water to get Phosphoric Acid, &9Hydrochloric Acid&r, and a whole bunch of &6Gypsum Dust&r.
Phosphoric Acid
&2Sulfuric Acid is mainly produced in a 3-step process:&r
-&6 Sulfur&o&r added to &9Oxygen&r to produce &9Sulfur Dioxide&r. &9SO₂&r also can come from treating certain &6Sulfur-containing Dusts&r with &9Oxygen&r in the EBF, or by processing &eNether Air&r.
- &9Sulfur Dioxide&r added to more &9Oxygen&r, with &cVanadium Pentoxide&r catalyst, to produce &9Sulfur Trioxide&r.
- &9Sulfur Trioxide&r added to &9Water&r, to produce &eSulfuric Acid&r.
The shortcut Sulfur + Water reaction is locked behind the Large Chemical Reactor, unlocked at EV.
You can also get Sulfuric Acid by adding &9Oxygen&r to &9Hydrogen Sulfide&r, which can be obtained via Petroleum, or by combining &9Hydrogen&r and &6Sulfur&r.
&rYou'll need huge amounts of this for a whole range of chemical reactions, as it is a very common ingredient.
Sulfur can be electrolyzed from many things.
&2Sulfuric Acid
&6Luminessence&r is used in a number of things, but right now, it will be a component in your &aExtended Crafting Tables&r.
A common component used by &bExtended Crafting&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest1.descr: The &3Advanced Microverse Projector&r is a more powerful projector required for sending &6Tier Four&r through &6Tier Six Micro Miners&r into microverses.

Initial missions can operate on &eIV power&r, while &eLuV power&r is required for later missions. As with the prior projector, this structure supports overclocking and the position of buses and hatches can be swapped with any &6Microverse Projector Casing&r.
&6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest1.title: Advanced Microverse Projector
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest10.desc: Coming into &9Ludicrous Voltage&r, many new advanced materials will be required to craft items and components. Most of these materials require &6RTM Alloy Coils&r.
&6Ruridit&r is an alloy of Ruthenium and Iridium. It is used in LuV components alongside &6HSS-S&r.
&6Niobium-Titanium&r is the main LuV cable material. Later on, large quantities are required for &6Wetware Circuits&r.
&6Vanadium-Gallium&r is the main ZPM cable material, but it is used now as an advanced conductive material for certain recipes.
&6Osmiridium&r (not from the ore) is used to make the &6Ludicrous Voltage Coil&r, for LuV-tier energy I/O. It is later used to make ZPM components.
&6Indium Tin Barium Titanium Cuprate&r is a LuV superconductor. Its uses are more limited, but it is used in places like the &3Fusion Reactor&r.
Finally, &6Samarium&r is used for LuV+ motors. It is obtained from &6Rare Earth&r.
These materials take a long time at high temperatures to smelt, so find a way to keep a stock of them.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest11.desc: &2Thin Polyphenylene Sulfide Sheets are required for wrapping LuV+ cables.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest12.desc: With &6&2Rhodium Plated Lumium-Palladium&r,&6 Niobium-Titanium&r, &2and Polyphenylene Sulfide&r, you can now make hulls for Ludicrous Voltage (LuV) &bGregTech&r machines.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest13.desc: &2Rhodium Plated Lumium-Palladium is a mixture of Rhodium, Lumium and Palladium. It forms the basis of LuV Machine Hulls.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest14.desc: Glowing! &9But all the GTM machines glow already if Shimmer is installed, so...&r
This one takes a significant amount of time to cook, so make sure to have it going constantly.
Wires made from &6Lumium&r transmit IV power losslessly, and it forms part of the basis for &6LuV Machine Hulls&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest15.desc: &6Iridium&r is an advanced material used for Micro Miners, and for alloying with &6Osmium&r into &6Osmiridium&r.
You can also get tons of this from &6Platinum Group Sludge&r.
&2Osmiridium 80/20 Ore and Iridosmine 80/20 Ore&r is available renewably from the Tier Four and Tier Six micro miners, as well as semi-renewably from the Tier Five micro miner.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest16.desc: &2Double Plates&r made from &6Iridium&r for Tier Five and Tier Eight Micro Miners.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest17.desc: &2Wetware- and Crystal-related processes require some stronger sterilization.&r
You will need to build another &3Cleanroom&r to run these recipes inside. Instead of &3Filter Casings&r, use &3Sterilizing Filter Casings&r in the top face.
These casings are expensive! You'll need &3Fusion MK II&r to get the &6Tritanium&r.
Note that a Sterile Cleanroom cannot handle recipes which require regular Cleanrooms.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest18.desc: &2Bacterial Sludge will be used in the Crystal and Wetware processes.
Plant Balls can be macerated to obtain Bio Chaff, which can be further broken down to Bacteria. Then, combine it with Biomass to get Bacterial Sludge.
You will also get a bit back from growing Stem Cells later.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest19.desc: &2Use Uranium-238 (or more efficiently, Uranium-235) to enrich Bacterial Sludge, and distill it to Mutagen. You can also use Naquadria to double your Enriched Bacterial Sludge yield.
Mutagen is used in Growth Medium production.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest2.descr: Eventually, when you unlock the &aHyperbolic Microverse Projector&r, you can also use it to gain a massive amount of &bStellar Creation Data&r at once.
All of the Tier Four missions require &68 Quantum Flux&r and a stack of &6Petrotheum Dust&r.
This miner is the first convenient source of &6Osmium&r and &6Iridium&r, via a mission requiring &6Wither Realm Data&r.

A &6Composition Sensor&r instead directs the miner to obtain &6Dense Oilsands Ore&r, equivalent to &232&r stacks of &6End Oilsands Ore&r, and 32 &6Compressed Infinity Dust Blocks&r, equivalent to 2592 &6Infinity Dust&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest2.title: Tier Four Micro Miner
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest20.desc: &9Sterilized Growth Medium&r is needed for &6Wetware Circuits&r.

You'll need to mix &6Mincemeat&r, &2Calcium, Salt, Agar, and Mutagen&r in a mixer to make &9Raw Growth Medium&r, then use a &3Fluid Heater&r to sterilize it. &2This is a significantly more involved process than before.&r
Mincemeat comes from pulverizing any kind of animal meat.
A &aFisher&r might be useful for this endeavor - especially &bThermal's&r &6Aquatic Entangler&r which can operate passively, produces only &6Fishes&r, and &eaccepts augments&r.
&2Agar is produced from Mincemeat through multiple steps.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest21.desc: The most advanced substrate available, prepared for bleeding-edge bioengineering technology.
&6Wetware Circuit Boards&r are the basis of &6Wetware&r circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest22.desc: &2Double Plates&r required for the next two tiers of Micro Miners.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest23.desc: The only source of &6Naquadah &2Ore&r. Along with it, &2Sheldonite Ore&r (for &6PGS&r) and &2Kaemanite Ore&r (for &6Trinium&r), via a mission with &6Stabilized Plutonium&r.
This microminer will also be important much later, as the sole source of &2Stabilized Oganesson&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest24.desc: &6HSS-G&r is the fifth coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 5400K so it can process more advanced materials, such as &6Naquadah&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest25.desc: An otherworldly material exclusive to Microverses, &6Naquadah&r is an important material in the late game.
It can be alloyed and enriched to various forms, and is the eventual source of &6Neutronium&r in a &3MK III Fusion Reactor&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest26.desc: The &6Naquadah-doped Boule&r produces even more wafers per boule. It also is relatively cheap, due to the abundance of Naquadah that is gained from the &eTier 5 Micro Miner Mission&r.

This boule also allows the production of &6Advanced System-on-Chip&r wafers, which are used to make the final forms of &6Quantum&r and &2Nanocircuits&r very cheaply. However, you might not be able to take advantage of the &6Advanced System-on-Chip&r yet, due to the power requirements.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest27.desc: A complex material from &bThermal Expansion&r cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r, or an &2Alloy Blast Smelter&r.
&6Enderium&r needs a lot of heat and is incredibly slow without overclocking. &2You can use small amounts of Krypton from Liquid Ender Air distillation to significantly decrease the smelting time.&r
&9Enderium also requires Tantalum, which can be renewably created by macerating and processing dragon scales.

As with all later blast furnace materials, dedicate a furnace to keeping these in stock and have it running constantly to ensure a stable supply (turning it off when you have an acceptably vast stockpile).
In addition to its other uses, Enderium gets you access to &aResonant Integral Components&r for machines. These quests can be found on the &eProgression&r tab.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest28.desc: &6Naquadah&r is the sixth coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 7200K so it can process more advanced materials.
&2You cannot skip a coil material anymore.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest29.desc: &2Double Plates&r made from &6Enderium&r used for the Tier Six Micro Miner.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest3.descr: &6Indium&r is a rare material requiring specialized bulk ore processing to acquire. It is useful for making &6Indium Gallium Phosphide&r (InGaP).

You will need to purify (with a &3Washer&r or &3Chemical Bath&r) &6Galena&r and &6Sphalerite&r to get &6Crushed Purified&r dusts. These need to be placed together in a &3Chemical Reactor&r along with &9Sulfuric Acid&r, which will result in &9Indium Concentrate&r.

This in turn needs to be reacted with &6Aluminium&r in another Chemical Reactor, to create &2Small Piles of Indium Dust, Aluminium Sulfite and &9Lead-Zinc Solution&r. The latter two can be centrifuged into various useful materials, and the Indium piles can be combined into full dusts.
&2Indium can also be obtained from the Naquadah processing chain in LuV.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest3.title: Indium
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest30.desc: The first decent source of &6Dragon Eggs&r and &6Stabilized Einsteinium&r.
Once you reach the &aHyperbolic Microverse Projector&r, this microminer can also get the following:
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest31.desc: Each craft in an &3LuV Chemical Reactor&r takes five minutes, so it's probably a good idea to have more than one machine running this recipe. At least you get &2128 from a single craft.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest31.subt: Just ignore the protesters outside your base.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest32.desc: The next circuit theme, Wetware, will require a lot of them.

Tier Six Micro Miners are the first option to get some eggs (enough for this quest, as it happens). Later on, you'll also get substantial quantities from Tier Eight Micro Miners while you accumulate &6Dragon Scales&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest33.desc: &9Omnium&r, as the name suggests, is an incredible material composed of all elements and alloys you've encountered so far.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest34.desc: &2Upgraded forms of the EBF and Vacuum Freezer.&r
Accepts any &6Parallel Control Hatch&r, parallelizing up to &e4096x&r with the best hatch!
The &aRotary Hearth Furnace&r is quite big!
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest35.desc: Cryolobus is a complex material needed in vast quantities.
You can create it with a &9Sculk Catalyst&r and &6Manyullyn&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest36.desc: You'll need at least &6Naquadah Coil Blocks&r in your blast furnace to smelt &6Cryolobus&r, as well as a healthy supply of &2Cetane-Boosted Diesel&r or &2Gasoline&r to reach the immense heat it takes to liquefy.
Cryolobus gets so hot that it requires the potent coolant &9Gelid Cryotheum&r to aid your &3Vacuum Freezer&r in turning it into usable ingots.

There are several ways to make Cryolobus: dust can be smelted into ingots, but you can also turn &6Warden Tendrils&r, which contain Cryolobus, directly into ingots. It uses a lot of&2 combustion fuel&r, but is the most efficient way to craft cryolobus.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest37.desc: A much more efficient version of the &3Empowerer&r.
This is a digital upgrade to the &3Crafting Core&r, allowing you to craft Empowerer recipes directly through &bPackagedAuto&r.
The &aMarked Pedestals&r can be placed freely within three blocks' distance of the Crafting block, as long as they are on the same Y-level.

As usual with PackagedAuto crafters, you need to encode the recipe in the correct mode and place a copy in two places: a &3Packager&r somewhere on your network, and an &3Unpackager&r adjacent to the &3Combination Package Crafter&r.
These recipes require large amounts of RF and it &ewill not use power from your &aME Network&r, so you must also connect the package crafter directly to energy conduits.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest38.desc: Coating &6Cryococcus&r with &9Liquid Nether Star&r and freezing it solid results in a superconductive material capable of transmitting enormous amounts of energy.
These wires losslessly transmit &4UHV&r power, and can also be made into the final form of RF conduits that can transmit a whopping &a134 million RF/t&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest39.desc: &2There are 3 materials you will need from processing Naquadah: Enriched Naquadah (Nq+), Naquadria (Nq*), and Trinium (Ke).
There are 3 different ways to process Naquadah, each resulting in different materials.&r
First is by &9processing ores&r from the &6Tier Five Micro Miner&r. &6Naquadah Ore&r yields &6Enriched Naquadah&r (through the &3Magnetic Separator&r) and &6Kaemanite Ore&r yields &6Trinium&r.
Second is by combining &6Naquadah Dust&r with certain heavy elements and Ender IO crystal grains. This can provide &6Enriched Naquadah&r and &6Naquadria&r.

Finally, you can do the full CEu processing of &6Naquadah Dust&r with &9Fluoroantimonic Acid&r, the strongest acid known to man. This is a decently involved process, but not only does it yield all 2 other Nq materials, it also grants byproducts of &6Titanium, Sulfur, Indium, Phosphorus, Barium, and Gallium&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest4.descr: &6QBit CPUs&r are an advanced Circuit Wafer crucial for &6Quantum Circuits&r.
There are two methods of creating them:

The simpler recipe uses two &6Quantum Eyes&r and two ingots' worth of molten &9Gallium Arsenide&r to enhance a &6NanoCPU Wafer&r. This recipe is slow and requires substantially more &9Radon&r per craft.

The other route instead uses &6Indium Gallium Phosphide&r and a tiny amount of Radon. This skips the slow-crafting Quantum Eyes, using far less Radon in the process, but requires the infrastructure in place for obtaining &6Indium&r.
The second route is overall better, and you will need Indium processing to complete the pack so might as well do it.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest4.title: QBit Processing Unit
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest40.desc: &2A heavy Naquadah isotope with more nuclear capability.

&6Enriched Naquadah&r is meant to be used in as-of-yet-unimplemented CEu-native reactors. It's used in small amounts for &3Trinium Coil blocks&r, or in Moni reactors, though Naquadria is better for that purpose.
At least it's the easiest to obtain, and you can get it by mixing, the full Naquadah chain, or by passing Purified Naquadah Dust through an Electromagnetic Separator.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest41.desc: &2A strong heavy element obtained from the Naquadah chain.

&6Trinium&r can come from &6Kaemanite Ore&r, but you will probably want to bolster its production with &6Naquadah Dust&r processing. It comes out at the second stage, so if you don't mind storing the intermediates and have Fluorine under control, you can hold off doing the full chain if you don't need to yet. You get &91 Trinium per 6 Naquadah processed&r.

This will be required in large quantities for &6Trinium Coils&r, &6Superconducting Coil Blocks&r, and &6Naquadah Alloy&r, among other things. You will need at least 5.5 stacks for a &3Fusion Reactor MK I&r, so stock up on it!
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest42.desc: &2Trinium&r is the seventh coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 9001K so it can process more advanced materials.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest43.desc: &2Naquadah Alloy is different in CEu. It requires Naquadah, Osmiridium and Trinium.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest44.desc: &6Naquadria&o&r is used in the construction of &6UV components&r, the &3Fusion Reactor MK II&r, and in fusing &6Neutronium&r. Each piece of Naquadria also makes &94 times&r more power than &6Enriched Naquadah&r in &3Naquadah Reactors&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest45.desc: &6ZPM Machine Hulls&r are made with &2Naquadah Alloy Plates,&r but you'll notice they also need &2Polybenzimidazole&r.
ZPM stands for Zero Point Module.

This is the last tier of machine that's sensible to produce before you reach the &9Creative Tank&r. Multiblock hatches are a different matter: feel free to upgrade your &3EBF&rs to Ultimate Voltage, if you can handle the power drain.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest46.desc: A complex plating material used exclusively for the Tier Nine Micro Miner.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest47.desc: You don't need it just yet, but you can make it now.
This is a critical material for the End Game.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest48.desc: The source of &9Warden Hearts&r and the valuable &9Lair of The Warden Data&r.
As a bonus, brings &9Sculk Catalysts, Warden Tendrils, &2Blocks of Ruthenium&r, and plenty of different precious metals and gems.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest49.desc: With a &3Fusion Reactor&r, you can make Europium!
This element is needed for making &9Sculk-related items&r, as well as the &6Fusion Reactor Computer MK II&r, &2Crystal Chip growing&r, and &6Wetware Supercomputers&r.
You make it by fusing molten &9Neodymium&r and &9Hydrogen&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest5.descr: &2Your first few Raw Crystal Chips must be grown in an Autoclave from liquid Enderium, or more efficiently with Europium, and Exquisite Emeralds or Exquisite Olivine.
After the first few, you can smash them into pieces using a Forge Hammer, and duplicate them with Bacterial Sludge, Mutagen, or more Europium or Enderium.
Bacterial Sludge can later be obtained in the byproducts of getting Stem Cells.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest5.title: Crystal Growing
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest50.desc: The &3Fusion Reactor&r is a multiblock that uses enormous amounts of energy to fuse fluids into new elements. This one is less flexible than the previous GregTech multiblocks, as you can only put hatches where the preview shows. &6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.

The &bEMI&r preview shows &eall valid hatch locations&r, but you don't actually need that many fluid hatches. You can replace any of the hatch positions in the structure with &2Fusion Machine Casings&r as long as you have at least &atwo Fluid Input Hatches&r and &aone Fluid Output Hatch&r. It's possible to use input/output hatches in every valid location, if you prefer.

Because of this, the quest only asks for &248 Fusion Machine Casings&r. If you want to use the minimum number of fluid hatches, you'll need to craft an additional &229 Fusion Machine Casings&r. In addition to the &a48 Fusion Machine Casings&r, you will also need &631 Fusion Glass&r or &631 Fusion Machine Casings&r. &bFusion Glass is cheaper, and looks cooler&r, but it's your choice.

Each &aEnergy Hatch&r increases the reactor's power buffer. &cYou cannot use 4x or 16x Energy Hatches in Fusion Reactors. &aAll 16 Energy Hatches&r are required to be able to process all Mark 1 recipes and give a power buffer of &e160M EU&r. &2However, not all energy hatches need to be connected to power. For example, a recipe that requires LuV power draw would only need one or more hatches connected to power, but a recipe that needs ZPM power draw would need at least two hatches connected to power.&r &cThey still need to be present on the structure!&r

In addition to the recipe power drain, Fusion Reactors have a &eheat&r mechanic related to the recipe's &e"EU To Start"&r. This amount of power is drained from the reactor's buffer before starting the recipe to heat up the reactor to the necessary temperature, and is independent of the recipe's EU/t cost. As such, this determines the minimum tier of reactor you need for a recipe.

If the reactor stops processing, it will &erapidly lose heat&r, even if you pause it with a soft hammer. On the other hand, if the reactor is already at the required temperature for a recipe, &eno additional power&r is required to heat up the reactor! This is true even if you switch between different recipes. This mechanic incentivizes continuous use of the reactor.
If you switch to a recipe that requires more heat, &eonly the difference&r in heat values is consumed as EU to reach the target heat (up to a maximum heat equal to the reactor's current buffer).
Fusion Reactors &2overclock, but only once per fusion tier, instead of based on energy input.&r They gate the next tier of materials, so you will eventually want to make more than one.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest51.desc: &2Double Plates&r used for the Tier Seven Micro Miner.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest52.desc: &9Mesol Energy Cores&r are your first proper &9Energy Cores&r.
They (as well as future Energy Cores) require XP Juice to craft.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest54.desc: &9Warden Hearts&r are needed for both &9Cryococcus&r and &6The Ultimate Material&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest54.subt: It continues to beat, even after removal from its host.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest55.desc: The multiblock uses energy cores to &erelease extremely large amounts of energy at once&r to craft things. While the batteries themselves are lost, you are able to recover some of the spent energy.
&5...once energy voiding is implemented in GTm.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest55.subt: What good is a battery if you don't use it?
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest56.desc: &9Bathyal Energy Cores&r are the second tier of core, used for intermediate crafting recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest57.desc: &9This Micro Miner also brings back Dragon Eggs and Ender Dragon Scales, as well as Neutronium, depending on the mission&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest58.desc: The &3Advanced Microverse Projector II&r is an even more powerful projector required for sending &6Tier Seven&r through &6Tier Ten Micro Miners&r into microverses.

Tier Seven missions will operate on &eLuV power&r, but higher energy tiers will be required for later missions. As with the previous projector, this structure supports overclocking and the position of buses and hatches can be swapped with any &6Microverse Projector Casing&r.
&6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest59.desc: &6Cryococcus&r is a powerful material used for crafting high-grade components, items, and machines from &9Sculk&r.
Five &6Cryolobus Blocks&r can be processed in the Discharger to create an equal output of five &6Cryococcus Blocks&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest6.descr: By baking a &2Raw Crystal Chip &rand &6Emerald&r or &6Olivine Plates&r with &9Helium&r in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r, you can create an &6Engraved Crystal Chip&r.
This is a material needed for &6Crystal Circuits&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest6.title: &2Engraved Crystal Chip
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest60.desc: &6Cryococcus&r, &9Bathyal Energy Cores&r, and &6Stabilized Einsteinium&r can be used to create a &9Abyssal Energy Core&r.
This is an important component in the Tier Nine and Tier Ten Micro Miners, as well as some End Game items.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest61.desc: Combines &bStellar Creation Data&r into &9Universe Creation Data&r, which is a crucial component for the Tier Ten Micro Miner mission.
The alternate mission brings a decent quantity of &6Neutronium&r. It might be easier to just make all your Neutronium in the reactor, but it's up to you.
The Tier Nine Micro Miner will also be important later on, as it will be your main source of &9Quasi-Stable Neutron Stars&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest62.desc: &9Hadal Warp Engines&r are components needed for the Tier Nine and Tier Ten Micro Miners, as well as a few End Game recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest63.desc: &6Hadal Shards&r are a component in &9Hadal Energy Cores&r and &9Hadal Warp Engines&r.
They come exclusively from Tier Eight Micro Miners. You'll need the Tier Seven Micro Miner for the &6Lair of the Warden Data&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest64.desc: &6Neutronium&r is a hyper-dense material normally found in the hearts of neutron stars: the collapsed cores of stars between ten and thirty times the size of the Sun.

Fun fact: a single neutronium block is approximately 2884 million metric tons and somewhere around 600000K, yet you're somehow capable of holding one with your bare hands. Don't think about it too much.
Neutronium is obtained by fusing &9Liquid Naquadria&r with &9Liquid Americium&r, &2or from the Tier Eight Micro Miner.&r
You might consider using Tier Nine Micro Miners to supplement the fusion, as it is net-positive for Neutronium. These miners are expensive though, so it's up to you.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest65.desc: The highest tier of &9energy core&r. You will need these to reach the &9Creative Tank&r.
Each core requires two ingots of &6Neutronium&r and a &6Hadal Shard&r, as well as plenty of the previous energy cores.
Hope you've got those Tier Eight Micro Miners automated.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest66.desc: &2For making Wetware Circuits more easily. You need UV-tier power to make them that way.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest67.desc: Allows for the creation of HASoCs.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest68.desc: &3World Accelerators&r accelerate the ticks of any non-GregTech machine adjacent to them.

The &6HV&r WA accelerates by 8x, the &5EV&r WA accelerates by 16x, and the &1IV&r WA accelerates by 32x. They require an input of 8A of their voltage tier. Be sure to right-click the WA once with a &aScrewdriver&r to set it to &eTile Entity Mode&r, otherwise it will accelerate random ticks in a radius around it instead.
Make them in an &3Assembly Line&r with some very advanced components.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest69.desc: The &3Active Transformer&r is a device which can convert any number and type of &9GT Energy Inputs&r into any number and type of &9GT Energy Outputs&r. That includes &664A Substation Hatches&r, as well as &aLaser Hatches&r - refer to the nearby quests for more details on those.
With &9RF Conduits&r and &3Energy Converters&r in this pack, this probably has limited use, but you can build it if you want.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest7.descr: The &3Assembly Line&r is a large multiblock structure that crafts complex materials, similar to an &3Assembling Machine&r. These will be crucial going forward for making a variety of components and machinery.

Make sure your power generation and circuit production are up to the challenge. &2None of the Assembly Line recipes require programmed circuits anymore.&r It is &anot required&r to insert items or fluids in the correct order.

This quest calls for an Assembly Line that's 10 units long, allowing for 9 inputs and one output. This is a large enough Assembly Line to make &6LuV components&r, but you'll need to expand to more inputs for later projects.
The structure of the Assembly Line is a little stricter than other multiblocks:

- The &aInput Buses&r can only be placed along the bottom, must all be &8ULV&r tier, and must face downwards. The &aOutput Bus&r must be placed at the very end of the row of Input Buses, and can be any tier.
- &aFluid Hatches&r can only replace the &6Steel Casings&r along the bottom.
- &aEnergy Hatches&r can only be placed within the top row of &6Steel Casings&r.

- The &2Data Access Hatch&r must replace a &6Grate Casing&r on the same side as the Assembly Line controller block. Later, you can replace this with an &2Optical Data Reception Hatch&r. Refer to adjacent quests for how the Assembly Line data system works.
If your recipe is not running, ensure you have the corresponding &edata&r for the recipe in a &2Data Access Hatch&r or connected &3Data Bank&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest7.title: &2Assembly Line
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest70.desc: The &3Power Substation&r is GregTech's native mass power storage solution.

The structure can accept up to 18 layers of 3x3 &aLapotronic Capacitor&r blocks. GT batteries can hold &96x&r the EU their item counterparts can hold when crafted into a &aLapotronic Capacitor&r. The structure need not be made of all of the same tier blocks, but it must be full, so fill any empty space with &aEmpty Capacitor Blocks&r.
Insert power through &6Energy Hatches&r and extract from &6Dynamo Hatches&r, each of any tier. The Power Substation can accept special &664A Substation Hatches&r, as well as &aLaser Hatches&r.

The Power Substation will &cpassively lose 1%&r of its total capacity every 24 (real-life) hours, up to 100,000 EU/t per capacitor block. This is equivalent to &95.8 billionths&r of its total capacity per tick, so this should not be a concern under regular operation.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest71.desc: &aLasers&r are &9GregTech&r's native solution to high-volume power transfer. Each power tier starting at &1IV&r has &aLaser Hatches&r capable of transferring &9256A&r, &91,024A&r and &94,096A&r of their voltage's power!

Energy in the Laser Network flows from &aLaser Sources&r through &6Laser Transmitting Cables&r to &aLaser Targets&r. All these must be in a straight line - lasers don't bend, after all. Similarly to other power-related blocks, the tier of the &aLaser Target&r must not be lower than the tier of the &aLaser Source&r.
You can choose to use these when moving power between &3Active Transformers&r and your &3Power Substation&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest72.desc: Double Plates used exclusively for the Tier Eight and Tier Eleven Micro Miners.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest73.desc: &2Perfect Gems are equivalent to 8 of the base gem.
&211 Perfect Diamonds are used in crafting each Crystal Matrix Ingot.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest74.desc: Some Micro Miner missions use a &6Gemstone Sensor&r to scout out gems instead of ores.
&6&2Perfect Gems&r can be obtained from such missions.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest75.desc: The &aImplosion Compressor&f is like an autoclave that uses explosions instead of water.
It is the only way to turn some gem dusts into gemstones. However, for some gemstones, like &6Apatite&r, it is much more efficient to use an &3Autoclave&r&r with &9Distilled Water&r.
It will also be vital for processing &5Motes of Omnium&f.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest76.desc: &6TNT&r is an explosive made from &9Toluene&r, a distillation byproduct of &9Wood Tar&r or various &eSteam-Cracked Fuels&r. Besides its typical uses in Minecraft, it is a crafting ingredient you can use in the &3Implosion Compressor&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest77.desc: The &3Naquadah Reactor&r is a structure used to generate considerable amounts of EU power from decaying &6Enriched Naquadah&r or &6Naquadria&r into &6Lead&r.
&6Sneak-right click&r the controller to enable the in-world preview.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest78.desc: The &3Naquadah Reactor II&r is an upgraded reactor that can generate immense amounts of EU energy from the same types of fuels as the MK I. The materials it requires are similar to the MK I, and you can almost reuse the same structure. Make sure you are prepared for the UV power output by adding a &6UV Energy Output Hatch&r.
This is a pretty expensive structure though, as it needs a block of &9Omnium&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest79.desc: The &6Advanced System-on-Chip&r (or &6ASoC&r) is the &2penultimate&r component miniaturization. These unlock the most efficient recipe for producing &2Nanocircuits&r and &6Quantum Circuits&r.
The latter circuits must be made in a &aZPM Assembling Machine&r.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest8.descr: The &3Assembly Line&r needs to be provided with &edata&r on how to craft items before it can craft them. Data on how to craft each item is stored in a &6Data Stick&r and read by a &aData Access Hatch&r. This data is required to craft &6LuV components&r and the &3Fusion Reactor&r, among other things.
To begin, craft a &3Scanner&r and a few &6Data Sticks&r. The initial Scanner recipes run at &6HV&r, but &1IV&r is required relatively soon so might as well make that one.

Press &bR&r on the item you want to craft in the and navigate to the &bScanner tab&r. This will tell you which item needs to be scanned to make the data for the new item. For example, &9LuV &6Electric Motors&r will require an &1IV&r &6Electric Motor&r to be scanned.

Place a &6Data Stick&r with the item to be scanned in the &3Scanner&r. The item will be &cconsumed&r and its data will be written to the &6Data Stick&r. Each &6Data item&r can only hold a &csingle recipe&r.
Finally, place the &6Data Stick&r into the &aData Access Hatch&r of your &3Assembly Line&r. It will now be able to craft that item.
Later, you will need more advanced &6Data Orbs&r and &6Data Modules&r to store data, and a &3Data Bank&r to read them.
If you need to create duplicate Data items, you can copy the data to a blank data item of the same type using the Scanner.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest8.title: &9Assembly Line Data
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest80.desc: This is the flight of our lives.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest81.desc: Interestingly enough, &eSculk itself functions great as a biobattery&r, being able to store and quickly release mass amounts of energy. The &3Sculk Charger&r should be able to get you started in taking advantage of it.

To use it, set the recipe in the same way you would for an &3Auto Crafting Table&r, then place an inventory (such as a Barrel) on top, and connect power to &eboth the charger and a nearby pylon&r. Items can be extacted from the charger in any manner.
The charger and pylon themselves &ehave extreme throughput&r, so don't worry about having to wait for it to craft items.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest82.rich: While the charger itself has extreme throughput, it is recommended to either create a
or keep the cores themselves in stock, as a single core requires 200 million RF to craft.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest83.desc: When equipped with a &6Block of Netherrack:
When equipped with a &6Block of Endstone:
All of the Tier Four missions require &68 Quantum Flux&r and a stack of &6Aerotheum Dust&r.
&6* Wither Realm Data\n* Nether Star Block
This miner will be your primary source of mob drops, for all, if not most, of your game.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest83.titl: Tier Four and a Half Microminer
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest84.desc: The Eighth and a Half Micro Miner.

An alternative source for &6Duranium&r (via &6Dulysite Ore&r, mission with &aGemstone Sensors&r), and an alternative source for &6Darmstadtium&r (via &6Darmstadtite Ore&r, mission with &aIridium Neutron Reflectors&r).
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest85.desc: &9The upgraded form of the Soul Binder.&r
Accepts any &6Parallel Control Hatch&r, parallelizing up to &e4096x&r with the best hatch!
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest9.descr: &6Crystal CPUs&r are the cores of &6Crystal Circuits&r.
You'll need a &2LuV Laser Engraver&r to craft this.
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.quest9.title: &2Crystal Processing Unit
ftbquests.chapter.late_game.title: Late Game
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest1.de: Normally, this block acts as a source of &echannels&r, but that mechanic is disabled by default in &5Monifactory&r.

You don't have to make this to operate a network when channels are disabled, but if you do, &eyour network will consume less power&r than if it did not have a Controller. Plus, they look kind of cool.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest1.su: The &aME Controller&r acts as the 'brain' and a bit of power storage for an &eME Network&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest10.d: If you like exploring, you can find them in meteors with a &aMeteor Compass&r.
If you don't want to do that, or are having trouble finding one you need, feel free to etch them yourself with a &3Laser Engraver&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest11.d: This compass will lead you to the nearest meteor impact. Use your favorite mining tools to smash through the &6Skystone&r shell and get to the juicy center where a &6Mysterious Cube&r with the plates are found.
Please note that while they're often in a big crater, the meteors might be buried underground; when the compass is spinning wildly, you're right on top of one.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest11.s: &bApplied Energistics&r uses &aPresses&r found in cubes at the heart of meteors as templates for &3Inscribers&r to make &6inscribed circuits&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest12.d: With ten slots for Storage Cells, you can store a huge number of items inside this single block, and search through them all with a &6Terminal&r. You just gotta make all those Storage Cells.
If you somehow run out of room, you can make another ME Drive for even more slots! So many cells, so many items!
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest12.s: *Slaps &6ME Drive&r* this bad boy can fit so many &6Storage Cells&r in it!
