ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest13.d: Run the materials through &3Inscribers&r with &aPresses&r to make the printed variant, then combine the printed materials and circuit to form the Engineering Processor.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest13.s: &6Engineering Processors&r are made from a &6Printed Engineering Circuit&r, &6Printed Silicon&r, and any tier one circuit.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest14.d: A &6P2P Tunnel&r (&aPoint-to-Point Tunnel&r) is a powerful tool from &bApplied Energistics 2&r that can be used to send items, redstone, RF/EU or fluids from one location to another using your ME system, without the need to use any disk storage space. &cTransporting RF/EU has a 5% tax on the input energy.&r
Each P2P tunnel system may have only &cone input&r but &eany number of outputs&r. There is no limit on how many P2P tunnels, or P2P tunnel systems, you can have on one network.

By default, a P2P tunnel is an &6ME tunnel&r, which transmits Applied Energistics channels and power. Since channels are disabled, you will most likely not be using the default tunnel. You can change the mode of your P2P tunnels by right clicking the tunnel with the respective item seen in &bEMI&r.

To configure your P2P tunnels, take a &6Memory Card&r. While holding the memory card, &ashift-right click&r the unconfigured tunnel, to set the frequency of the input, and save the frequency to the memory card. Once the first tunnel has been set up this way and the memory card is configured with the frequency, any subsequent tunnel you &aright-click&r with the memory card will be set as the output of the most recent frequency used.

You can also use memory cards to copy the configuration of ME blocks and tile-entities, such as &6Interfaces&r and &6Storage Buses&r. &aShift-right click&r a ME block to copy its configuration, and &aright-click&r to paste that configuration. Note that this doesn't copy upgrades applied to the block.
You can also &ashift-right click&r to empty the frequency, or the ME block configuration, set in the card.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest15.d: This handy terminal allows you to see the pattern slots of all &aME Pattern Providers&r in your network in one place.
This means you don't have to run to your ME Pattern Providers each time you make a new pattern for them.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest16.d: Well, you need patterns too I guess.
The details of autocrafting will be explained in a later quest.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest17.d: This version of the Pattern Provider boosts the pattern capacity from 9 to 36. It can be made directly, or it can be upgraded to using a &6Pattern Provider Upgrade&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest17.s: A very useful upgrade to the Pattern Provider.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest18.d: &aME Pattern Providers&r and &aME Interfaces&r are extremely important for automation. You'll be making a lot of these, if you're playing the pack right.
These can be filled with encoded &aPatterns&r to perform on-demand autocrafting. Any item pushed into an &aME Pattern Provider&r is digitized and placed in your ME Network storage.

When adjacent to one or more &aMolecular Assemblers&r, &3Crafting Table&r and &3Stonecutter&r patterns can be crafted. It will use as many adjacent &aMolecular Assemblers&r as possible, restricted by availability and number of &aCo-processors&r in your crafting CPU multiblock.

When adjacent to any other block, you can use &aprocessing patterns&r with a machine to insert items into the machine. Processing patterns require that the finished item is inserted back into the ME Network through &aInterfaces&r or &aPattern Providers&r.

&aME Pattern Providers&r can be wrenched to ensure they only communicate with a particular adjacent block, or can be crafted into a micropart form to fit multiple in the same block space (each micropart only interacting with the adjacent block face).
Also, if you connect a gadget from &bBuilding Gadgets&r to the Pattern Provider, the gadget will pull materials straight from the attached AE2 network, &aNOT&r the Pattern Provider.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest18.r: There is information about the Gadgets, and how to connect them to inventories, in the
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest19.d: Encode them in a &aPattern Encoding Terminal&r.
Note that recipes encoded with Substitutions on will use existing equivalent items, but &ewill only automatically craft the exact item specified in the recipe.&r
Use recipes that use machines instead!
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest19.s: &aPatterns&r are used to encode a single crafting table or processing recipe for on-demand automation with &bApplied Energistics&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest2.de: Please note that all six variants of &6ME Terminals&r are &emicroparts&r, which means they need to be attached to an &6ME Cable&r (not conduit) to function.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest2.su: Access all of your items on a single screen. Soon, anyway.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest20.d: &bPackagedAuto&r is an addon for &bApplied Energistics 2&r. Its main purpose in &5Monifactory&r is to allow you to eventually automate &bExtended Crafting&r recipes, but you may come up with other fun uses for it as well.

&bApplied Energistics 2&r stores recipes in &aPatterns&r, but so far they have been limited to at most 9 stacks of items as input (a standard 3x3 crafting grid). PackagedAuto stores recipes in &aPackage Recipe Holders&r, which don't have this limitation. Additionally, each Holder can store up to &e20 different recipes&r. Holders must be encoded in the &3Package Recipe Encoder&r.
In the vast majority of situations you'll need two identically-encoded Holders, as the following machines work together.

The &3Packager&r is a machine that compresses ingredients for a specific recipe into a set of &6Recipe Packages&r. Each package in a set can hold up to 9 stacks of ingredient items. A simple recipe might consist of one package, but a complex recipe can have up to 9 packages in its set (for 81 total item stacks).

The &3Unpackager&r is a machine that extracts ingredient items from complete sets of Recipe Packages made in a Packager, ejecting the items into an adjacent inventory. It will only extract the items if &eall packages in a set are present&r.
When both a Packager and Unpackager are connected to an ME Network and have the same recipe, the resulting item will appear as craftable in your &aTerminal&r.

&3Packager Extensions&r will act like a clone of an adjacent Packager - including access to patterns in its Package Recipe Holder - allowing you to craft recipe packages faster. Simply place the Packager Extensions around the Packager. Up to 26 extensions in a 3x3x3 cube around the Packager are supported.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest21.d: If you've tried to insert or remove a lot of items quickly, you might notice your ME network &eflickers offline&r briefly. This is because digitizing and re-materializing items requires energy!

Your network doesn't naturally store very much energy and the &6Energy Acceptor&r only intermittently refills the network's power. To keep things stable, you will need to add some energy storage in your network using &6Energy Cells&r.

Just place one anywhere in your network and it will fill up with AE energy received from the Energy Acceptor. Now, you should have enough energy in your network to prevent these power losses. Feel free to add more energy cells, or upgrade to &6Dense Energy Cells&r if you continue to experience problems.

If you've opted to enable channels in your AE2 configs, you will innately have some energy storage from the &3ME Controller&r, but we assume you know what you're doing at that point. &eThe mechanics of AE2 Channels are outside the scope of the quest book, and this is the only time it will be mentioned.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest22.d: All unformatted Storage Cells are limited to at most 63 distinct item types, with the first item of each new type taking up a chunk of the total bytes of cell storage, and subsequent items of existing types taking a small number of bytes thereafter.

A &61k ME Storage Cell&r is the first and smallest cell for storing items. If you are going to be storing many different kinds of items in your network, you will need to make an &6ME Drive&r and fill it with multiple Storage Cells.

The &64k ME Storage Cell&r is the next size up. With four times the bytes it holds substantially more items per type, but it requires a more advanced technology than you currently have available: AE &6Processors&r made in an &3Inscriber&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest22.s: &bApplied Energistics&r uses &6Storage Cells&r as its primary means of digital item and fluid storage.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest23.d: Unformatted disks always have a hard limit of 63 distinct types of items, but each step up has roughly four times the total storage space of the prior disk.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest23.s: A component used primarily for making bigger &6Storage Cells&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest24.s: The third component for AE &6Storage Cells&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest25.d: Used for storing really big amounts of things, like in a &664k ME Storage Cell&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest25.s: The penultimate item storage component in &bApplied Energistics&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest26.d: Firstly, you will need a &3Matter Condenser&r. Stick a &664k ME Storage Component&r in, change the mode to 'Singularity', and stuff lots of items (or fluids) in, &9done easily with an infinity cell&r.
If you don't have that, you can provide it with the output of regular &6Water&r or &6Cobblestone&r generation methods.

After you have made the &eSingularity&r you will need from the &3Matter Condenser&r, you need to set up a &aQuantum Ring Multiblock&r. Build a 3 by 3 vertical ring with your &6Quantum Rings&r, leaving a hole in the middle. Finally, stick your &6Quantum Link Chamber&r in the hole, and connect it to your ME system. If you built it correctly, the textures of the rings should combine, leaving you with a &aMultiblock&r.
Next, create a pair of &eQuantum Entangled Singularities&r by throwing Ender Dust and a Singularity into the vicinity of an explosion.
&9Now that you have Quantum Entangled Singularities, put one into the&r &6Quantum Link Chamber&r&9 of the &r&aQuantum Ring&r&9, and the other in the&r &6Wireless Terminal&r!
You should be good to go! You can now access AE2 anywhere, including in different dimensions!
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest26.s: Accessing AE2 from anywhere is a bit more expensive and complex, but it's well worth the effort.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest27.d: Accessing &bApplied Energistics 2&r wirelessly saves a huge amount of time, and is highly recommended to set up.
First, you will need a &6Wireless Access Point&r. Connect it to your network. Like the &6Terminal&r, the Wireless Access Point is a &emicropart&r, so you must place it on a &6ME Cable&r.
Next, you need a &6Wireless Terminal&r, or any of its variants. You can have as many Wireless Terminals connected to the system as you want.
Finally, put your &6Wireless Terminal&r into the &6Wireless Access Point&r. This will connect it to the system.
You can equip these as a bauble, and use a hotkey to open them. Search 'Applied Energistics' as a &ecategory&r to see and edit these hotkeys.

The default range is only 16 blocks. However, you can put &6Wireless Boosters&r into the &6Wireless Access Point&r to increase the range. A better (but more expensive) solution that allows access from anywhere will be explained in the following quest, 'AE2 Everywhere!'.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest28.d: The ultimate item storage component in base &bApplied Energistics&r.
These have a massive capacity, hundreds of times that of a &61k ME Storage Component&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest29.d: This quest teaches you the basics about &bApplied Energistics 2&r autocrafting. If you are new to this mod, it is highly recommended that you watch a video or &3&lread the built-in guide&r&r. Just remember that channels are disabled by default in this pack.

Eventually, you'll need a lot of &6Patterns&r, lots of CPUs, and ones with more storage, and lots of &6&6&6Pattern Providers&r&r&r. If you run out of pattern slots in an &6Pattern Provider&r, you can add more &6Pattern Providers&r, or use &6Extended Pattern Providers&r, which have 36 slots each.
By now, you should have &6ME Pattern Providers, &6Molecular Assemblers, Crafting Units, Patterns&r and a &6Pattern Encoding Terminal&r.
First, for all crafts, you'll need a &eCrafting CPU&r. These are structures that must be in a solid rectangular prism composed of:
&6* Crafting Storages&r, which determine how big a craft can be. For now, &64k Crafting Storages&r should be enough. You must have at least one per CPU.
&6* Co-Processing Units&r, which are used to craft multiple things at once. These are optional.
&6* Crafting Monitors&r, used to see what is crafting. Not needed, and you can right-click on the CPU to find out what is crafting anyways, so this is pretty much just decoration.
&6* Crafting Units&r, which aren't needed at all, and are just used to fill holes if you have a lack of materials.

Second, you'll need the place for the autocrafting. For Crafting Table recipes, you'll need &6Molecular Assemblers&r. &6Pattern Providers&r are placed next to them. Autocrafting with &bGregTech&r is explained later, in the quest following this one.

Finally, you'll need a &6Pattern&r. In order to make this, put empty &6Patterns&r in the &6Pattern Encoding Terminal&r, and find the recipe in &bEMI&r, while still in the &6Pattern Encoding Terminal&r. Then, click '+' in &bEMI&r, and press the arrow to encode the recipe. This goes in the &6Interface&r that you set up in the last step. You can use &6Interface Terminals&r to access &6Interfaces'&r pattern slots.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest3.de: Run the materials through &3Inscribers&r with &aPresses&r to make the printed variant, then combine the printed materials and circuit to form the Calculation Processor.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest3.su: &6Calculation Processors&r are made from a &6Printed Calculation Circuit&r, &6Printed Silicon&r, and any &6tier one circuit&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest30.d: It's a micropart, so you need to place it on an &6ME Cable&r (not a conduit).
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest30.s: As the name suggests, this terminal lets you encode recipes onto &aBlank Patterns&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest31.d: Now that you have &6HSS-E&r, you can begin automating &bExtended Crafting&r recipes in a easier way than before.

To begin, you'll need to craft one of each extended &3Package Crafter&r listed above. Put an &3Unpackager&r on top of each one, and then a &3Packager&r anywhere you want. These are all AE2 devices, so you'll need to connect them to an ME Network.

Next, right-click the &3Package Recipe Encoder&r, and you should see a button saying "Processing": this button cycles through recipe types, including the various Extended Crafting tables. You'll have to choose the appropriate table for the recipe you want to encode.

&6Holders&r must be encoded in pairs: one for the Packager, and one for the Unpackager. Select the appropriate table for the recipe, look up the recipe you want to encode, and press &6[+]&r in &bEMI&r to fill it in. Put two Holders in the top-left slot and press Save to encode the recipe to both of them. Finally, put each Holder into the respective machines.
If you've done everything correctly, you should see the item appear as craftable in a Terminal.

While it might seem that the crafting process is slow, &ePackagedAuto is excellent at parallelizing&r. You can surround an Unpackager with Crafters and it will use all of them. It's also possible to add more Unpackagers with Crafters to keep up with the Packager, as long as the Holders are all the same.
If this is too confusing, try out
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest32.d: You can easily automate most &bGregTech&r machines with &aME Pattern Providers&r and processing &aPatterns&r early on by using the machines' auto-output feature.

Use &9the Machine's GUI&r to relocate the output side of a machine where you want it to be, then press the "Auto Output" and "Permit Input" buttons, and put an ME Pattern Provider on that side of the machine.
You can also permit input from the output side by shift-right-clicking with a screwdriver on the output side via the machine grid.
Right-click the machine and enable item auto-output (&6orange box&r in the bottom-left corner of the GUI).

Now, stuff the ME Pattern Provider with processing patterns. The next time you order an item, the ME Pattern Provider will push ingredients into the machine, and the machine will push outputs back into the Pattern Provider once they're ready, completing the craft. No need to use conduits or import buses!

Furthermore, you can use Blocking Mode, which ensures that no items are in the inventory before placing the items in, which is a handy way to prevent conflicts. Even better, blocking mode now ignores Programmable Circuits and Molds! Please note that non-consumable items should stay in the machine, and not be included in the pattern made. Yes, this means you should make a separate machine for each non-consumable, at least until you get Large Machines.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest33.d: Handling &6Patterns&r gets tedious pretty quickly, from not having enough slots to move tens of them at a time, to having to multiply them when upgrading your &3Large Machines&r, which, when equipped with &3Parallel Control Hatches&r, may require you to supply more than one item at a time to utilize them to their fullest.
You don't want to supply one ingot and get two wires when your &3Large Wire Factory&r can take &e64 ingots&r and make &e128 wires&r at a time, right?
That's where the the &6Pattern Modifier&r comes into play, which makes it possible to &emove, multiply, divide and clear patterns in bulk&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest34.d: Placing these in one of your &6ME Drives&r will provide your ME network with an &ainfinite&r amount of water or cobblestone. Use &6Interfaces&r or &6Export Buses&r to provide said substances to wherever you need it.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest34.s: It doesn't get any faster than this.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest35.d: The &6Extended Molecular Assembler&r is able to perform &a8 crafts at a time&r, and does each of those crafts &atwice as fast&r, meaning this assembler can do some serious work.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest36.d: &6Certus Quartz&r can be grown from &6Budding Certus Quartz&r blocks!
Check out the &9&lin-game guide&r&r or &eG&r on the item for specifics on how to get this set up.
Note that Monifactory adds a crafting recipe for Flawless Budding Certus Quartz — check EMI for details!
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest37.d: These can be configured to stock up to &99 item stacks (576 items)&r or &936 buckets (9 types, 4 buckets each)&r for passive autocrafting and to push into other inventories&r. Any item pushed into an &aME Interface&r is digitized and placed in your ME Network storage.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest38.d: This version of &aME Interface&r acts like two of them at once, allowing for 1152 items or 72 buckets of fluids.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest38.s: Neither do I, check my neighbour Extended Pattern Provider instead
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest39.d: Crafting in a digital grid is heaven after using primitive wooden tables for so long.
It's a micropart, so you need to place it on an &6ME Cable&r (not a conduit).
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest4.de: &3Extended Inscribers&r are able to perform up to 4 inscribing jobs at the same time, allowing easier automation.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest40.d: Combining an &aI/O Bus&r and an &aME Interface&r into a single block, these can be used in place of &aInput&r and &aOutput Buses&r in GregTech multiblocks to connect them directly to your AE2 network.
Note that only the Interface-textured side will connect to an ME network.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest41.d: The &aME Extended Drive&r can store up to 20 Storage Disks.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest42.d: &bApplied Energistics&r does not allow you to use tags when creating &6Processing Patterns&r. This can become annoying when dealing with recipes that use Gregtech Circuits, as normally you would have to remake your patterns when you unlock a new tier of circuit.

Instead, use &9Universal Circuits&r when creating your Processing Patterns, as all normal circuits can be converted to their &9Universal Circuit&r equivalent, which can be used in all the same recipes as regular circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest43.d: Managing P2P tunnels can be a pain in large numbers. Thankfully, the &6Advanced Memory Card&r fixes that by allowing you to manage all of your connections within a single card, as well as bind and unbind things on the fly, among other features.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest43.s: They really do have a GUI for everything now
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest44.d: &3Pattern P2P&r is somewhat like the other &aP2P&r types, but is able to copy a pattern provider's patterns to all of its outputs.

For example, you could have a Pattern P2P Input placed on a pattern provider, then 5 Outputs with the same ID placed on Assemblers. All 5 of those Assemblers would then &6act as if they each had their own pattern provider that all just so happened to have the same exact patterns&r, and will obey blocking rules, parallelize, and such.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest45.d: If somehow being able to store over a million items in a single &9256k Item Storage Cell&r isn't enough for you, there are now &9MEGA Cells&r!
&eMEGA Cells&r go up to 256M bytes, allowing them to store an insane amount of items. You will need high-end materials to make the housings for these cells.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest46.d: Run the plates through the respective &3Inscribers&r with &aPresses&r to make the printed plates, then combine the plates and circuit to form the Accumulation Processor.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest46.s: &6Accumulation Processors&r are made from a &6Black Steel Plate&r, a &6Silicon Plate&r, and any tier three circuit.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest47.d: These Crafting Units can be crafted with &eMEGA Cell Storage Components&r to make even larger crafting units, or can be crafted with &6Engineering Processors&r and &6Standard AE2 Storage Components&r to make denser &9Crafting Co-Processors&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest48.d: &9ME Packing Tape&r allows you to easily move &6ME Drives&r and &6Pattern Providers&r by packaging them up, which will retain their contents, such as cells and patterns.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest5.de: &3Inscribers&r are machines used to make &6inscribed circuits&r for &bApplied Energistics&r.
&9Inscribers can be set to automatically export items, can hold up to a stack of items within, as well as a variety of other features to aid in automation.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest5.su: Angry light forcing rocks to think
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest6.de: Run the materials through &3Inscribers&r with &aPresses&r to make the printed variant, then combine the printed materials and circuit to form the Logic Processor.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest6.su: &6Logic Processors&r are made from a &6Printed Logic Circuit&r, &6Printed Silicon&r, and any tier one circuit.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest7.de: These are the basic cables used by &3Applied Energistics&r to transport network connectivity. Due to the fact that channels are disabled, these cables will be your main method of transporting network connectivity, rather than the dense cables.

These cables do not share blockspace with conduits or cables for other mods, so they can be somewhat unwieldy to build with, but they do accept &3Applied Energistics &6Facades&r, so they can be hidden very easily. Keep in mind that a large number of facades leads to FPS lag.
Later, you can make a variant of the cable that can share blockspace with &3Ender IO&r conduits.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest8.de: The only downside is that &ethey will not connect to &bApplied Energistics&r &emicroparts&r like slab-form &6Interfaces&r or &6Level Emitters&r, so you have to use AE cables like &6Fluix Cables&r for those. &2Furthermore, they are known to sometimes disconnect from machine hulls and full-block interfaces, so use AE cables like &6Fluix Cables&r for those.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest8.su: &6ME Conduits&r have the advantage of being able to share a block space with other conduit types. Oh, and they're relatively cheaper to make.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest9.de: This is a rudimentary digital item storage device. By placing a &6Storage Cell&r inside it, you can access the contents as though you were looking through a chest. You can carry the disk to another location and place it down in a different ME Chest if you want, and the items will come with it.

&cDon't put Storage Cells inside other portable mod inventories like a Satchel, (or vice-versa) as you risk corrupting the contents of the Satchel and the Storage Cell.&r There's technical reasons why this happens (NBT overflow), and it's not unique to these items, but that's not really worth going into.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.quest9.su: The &aME Chest&r is somewhat impractical to use on its own, but it's a necessary ingredient for the much more useful &6ME Drive&r.
ftbquests.chapter.matterenergy.title: Matter-Energy
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest1.descri: &6Luminessence&r is used in a number of things beyond just Extended Crafting Tables, such as Nether Stars.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest10.descr: &6&6Redstone&r, a &6Snowball&r, and &6Blizz Powder&r creates &6Cryotheum Dust&r, a mixture imbued with potent elemental frost.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest100.desc: &2The Large Ore Drilling Plants mine ores from under them in a large radius. They require Drilling Fluid to operate.
They automatically macerate the ores, yielding 3 times more crushed ore than a normal Macerator, plus the normal amount of byproduct.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest101.desc: As you continue to progress, crafting times for more advanced &3Electric Blast Furnace&r recipes will continue to increase. More advanced coils increase the operating temperature so you can smelt more advanced materials, &2and they also grant energy efficiency bonuses and speed bonuses to overclocking.&r
Despite this, you'll still need to get your infrastructure for smelting, as well as power generation, up to par.

You don't need to get all eight of these completed and running just yet, but plan to at some point in the future. Instead of upgrading existing EBFs, have them passively automating a stock of materials and build new EBFs with higher specifications for new materials.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest102.desc: &2Large Turbines have been improved in CEu. They are quite complex to run, but can generate lots of power when done well and scale very well.&r
The best &6Large Steam Turbine&r fuel is a closely-guarded government secret.
Right now, you can make the &6Large Steam Turbine&r and &6Large Gas Turbine&r. Once you get a &3Fusion Reactor&r going, you can make the &6Large Plasma Turbine&r.

Each Large Turbine will need a &3Rotor Holder&r of the same or higher tier than the Large Turbine itself, and a &3Dynamo Hatch&r capable of handling the energy output. Each &3Rotor Holder&r tier above the Large Turbine &9doubles&r the energy production and adds 10%% to fuel efficiency.

You will need a &aRotor&r to go into each &3Rotor Holder&r&r. The Rotor will grant multiplicative Power and Efficiency bonuses depending on its material. Each Rotor also has a Durability, which is the number of seconds it will last.
&aExample: &r&6Large Gas Turbine&r, with &3HSS-E Rotor&r and &3IV Rotor Holder&r:
You can run the &6Large Gas Turbine&r off &9LPG&r and &9Methane&r from &3Fluid Rigs&r, or &9Nitrobenzene&r from &6Wood&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest103.desc: &2Fluid Rigs will harvest fluids from underground fluid veins. Note that the fluid veins are simply simulated and don't exist in the world. &r

Shift-right-click while holding the &3Prospector's Scanner&r to set it to fluid mode, then right click it in order to see the type and amount of fluid underground and to check the depletion state of the vein. The first number represents the base amount of fluid extracted per second. You can also check the &eFluid Vein Information EMI&r page for information on where they spawn.
In the &eOverworld&r, it can harvest: &9Oil, Light Oil, Heavy Oil, Raw Oil, Natural Gas

As Fluid Rigs work, they will deplete the vein under them, reducing their yields. When a vein is depleted, it still yields a small amount of its fluid. The first tier of Fluid Rig takes &9100,000 operations&r to deplete a vein. Higher tier Fluid Rigs harvest fluids far faster and deplete veins slower.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest104.desc: The full complexity of &bNuclearCraft&r is far too much for the scope of this quest guide, so &eyou're encouraged to watch a tutorial or read a guide online&r.

Finally, place the &3Fission Reactor Controller&r along any edge or corner of the reactor. Opening the Reactor Controller GUI should let you know that the structure was properly formed; if not, go back and check what you did wrong.
A redstone signal is required for the reactor to start working. &cReactors can overheat and melt if their temperature exceeds their ability to cool.&r

You can make a safety loop on the controller to automatically shut off the reactor when it starts getting hot. Place a Comparator facing a &aRedstone Conduit&r's input, and a &aRedstone NOT Filter&r outputting the result towards the reactor.

For the purposes of this particular quest, you'll be building a breeder reactor to make &6Plutonium&r and other nuclear elements. While this reactor may seem very expensive, it will be worth it, and you will probably expand it soon.
This reactor is capable of running any Low-Enriched fuel, such as TBU and LEU-235. This is a basic reactor and can be expanded, following the same pattern, to run faster.
First, set up your 215 &6Fission Reactor Casings&r to encase a 5x5x5 cube of air. Any of these casings can be changed to &6Transparent Fission Reactor Casings&r.

The Casings should cover the faces of the interior cube, &9as well as the edges and corners&r. You should have exactly the right number of Casings to encase a 5x5x5 space (with spots for the controller and ports).
Next, create a hole so you can get inside the cube.

Place the &6Reactor Cells&r in an alternating pattern, with the reactor cells at the corners, and spaces between each one. Alternate between each row, creating a grid pattern. Fill in the empty holes with &6Cryotheum Coolers&r.

Do this for every layer, alternating between &6Cryotheum Coolers&r on the corners and &6Reactor Cells&r on the corners. You should have the perfect amount of &6Reactor Cells&r and &6Cryotheum Coolers&r for this, and the third and final layers should be the same as the first one.
The reactor will now be complete when you reseal it up with the Casings you removed to access the interior.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest104.rich: Info on what exactly you are going to be doing with your fancy new reactor can be found in the
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest105.desc: Mixing &9Diesel&r (or less efficiently, &9Bio Diesel&r) with &9Tetranitromethane&r in an &3HV Mixer&r &2or Large Chemical Reactor&r produces &2Cetane-Boosted Diesel&r, an extremely potent fuel needed later for &6Cryolobus&r production.

If you have a very robust petrochemical infrastructure and can afford to burn it, this fuel along with proper oxygenation &2is a potent fuel in the Large Combustion Engine and Extreme Combustion Engine, producing &2720 EU/mB of fuel.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest105.subt: You will need either Diesel or Biodiesel
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest106.desc: &9While not required for progression, the space station serves as both a cool place to build a base, and opens the door to a variety of other space-related options!
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest107.desc: &2The Cracker gives you higher yields from cracking organic substances.
&2New in GTCEu, many organic substances offer the option of being Severely or Lightly cracked, as well as Hydro or Steam cracked, with each one granting different ratios of distillates.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest108.desc: &9JEAN Gasoline is the most powerful combustion fuel, using some anomalous ingredients to generate a staggering 81920 EU per mB of fuel. The trade-off is the extremely complex processing lines you must set up for it.
To refine High-Octane Gasoline to JEAN Gasoline, you will need:
To get the most out of this, run it in an Extreme Combustion Engine with Liquid Oxygen.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest109.desc: The &3Sequential Fabricator&r is an alternative to the &bEnder IO&r &3Crafter&r and the &bExtendedCrafting&r &3Auto Crafting Table&r. It is the most intuitive of the three, and can handle bucket crafting using Fluids.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest11.descr: Bits of a &6Blizz Rod&r. Using a &3Macerator&r doubles your yield.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest12.descr: Use it to craft a &aThermal Elemental Model&r. The rest of the dusts can be crafted from pristine matter.
Saves you from having to make a bucket of &9Elemental Reduction Fluid&r if you're not playing on Peaceful.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest12.subti: ...or, well, you might just do some exploration and kill a wild thermal elemental for a rod.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest12.title: I Don't Like Chemistry
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest13.descr: If you don't feel like searching for a Thermal Elemental, or can't because you're playing on Peaceful, you will need to make &eone&r batch of &9Elemental Reduction Fluid&r.
This will bootstrap being able to craft a &aThermal Elemental Model&r for HNN, and you can get all of the rods from &6Thermal Elemental Pristine Matter&r going forward.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest13.title: Elemental Reduction Fluid
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest14.descr: &2Hydrofluoric Acid is a dangerous acid made by mixing Hydrogen and Fluorine. It is used in the production of Polytetrafluoroethylene, and in Uranium and Naquadah processing.
Fluorine is best obtained from Topaz or Bastnasite Ore processing from their Micro Miner missions, and from processing renewable &9Deepslate.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest14.title: &2Hydrofluoric Acid
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest15.descr: Melting &6Mana Dust&r in a &3Fluid Extractor&r produces &9Primal Mana&r, which is needed for smelting various alloys from &bThermal Expansion&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest15.title: Primal Mana
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest16.descr: Mixing &6Titanium&r with &6Mana Dust&r creates &6Mana Infused Metal Dust&r. This can be smelted into ingots in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r equipped with &6Kanthal Coils&r or better.
Mana Infused Metal is the basis of &bThermal Expansion&r device casings, and is used for many advanced &aAugments&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest17.descr: Combining a &6Block of Mana Infused Metal&r with some &6Stainless Steel Plates&r gets you a &6Machine Frame&r.
These frames form the basis of &bThermal Expansion&r's more advanced machinery.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest17.title: Thermal Machine Frame
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest18.descr: The &3Aquatic Entangler&r is an alternative to the &bGregtech&r &3Fisher&r for producing &6Fish&r. You may find it to be useful later to produce &6Mincemeat&r en masse.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest19.descr: &6Rutile&r, &6Carbon&r, and &9Chlorine&r may be chemically reacted to form &9Titanium Tetrachloride&r.
This fluid is a precursor for metallic &6Titanium&r, as well as a titanium halide useful for catalyzing various polymer reactions (like plastics) for greater yields.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest19.title: Titanium Tetrachloride
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest2.descri: Yeah, you get to craft &6Nether Stars&r. Cool, huh?
Over the course of the pack, Nether Stars are going to be needed in quantities that far exceed a reasonable player's ability to farm Withers. &eCraft them, don't bother trying to farm them.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest2.title: Craftable Nether Stars
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest20.descr: Combining &9Titanium Tetrachloride&r with &6Magnesium&r in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r (approximating the Kroll process) will net you your first &6Titanium&r.
This process is a loop, and therefore will not cost you any resources (apart from &6Rutile&r) if you process it correctly.
Unfortunately, it is super hot. You'll need to cool it in a &3Vacuum Freezer&r for it to be usable.

If you haven't set one up yet or want to improve your setup, routing through AE is an alternative way to using item conduits. Simply set a Tag Storage Bus on the input bus of the freezer, set it to 'forge:hot_ingots', and set it to a high priority. This will accept any new Hot Ingots entering your system, and eliminates the need for a big conduit network.
Don't encode the Hot Ingot in a pattern though!
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest20.title: Hot Titanium
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest21.descr: A perfect material for making chopsticks.
Also the tier material for Extreme Voltage (EV).
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest21.title: Titanium
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest22.descr: &6Rutile&r is a &6Titanium&r precursor found in &6Ilmenite Ore&r and &6Bauxite Ore&r, which spawn uncommonly in the End.
&6&rLarger quantities of Ilmenite and Bauxite may be found on the Moon and other planets.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest22.title: Early Rutile
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest23.descr: You'll need an &3HV Chemical Reactor&r for processing &6Titanium&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest23.title: HV Chemical Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest24.descr: &2Polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE, or Teflon) is a polymer made from Carbon and Fluorine.
&2This polymer is most importantly used to make Large Chemical Reactors. It's also required for IV and LuV Machine Hulls, and can be substituted in some cases for higher yields.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest24.title: &2Polytetrafluoroethylene
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest25.descr: Heavy: avoid dropping it on your foot.
These &2double plates&r are used for two things-- &6Tier Two Micro Miners&r and the &3Space Station Assembler&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest25.title: &2Titanium Double Plates
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest26.descr: The Second Micro Miner! &2You'll need that Phosphorous in the LV Field Generators.&r
It is also a primary source of &6Stellar Creation Data&r, which will be useful much, much later.

When you eventually obtain the &aAdvanced Microverse Projector II&r, this Micro Miner can perform a mission that gives you large amounts of &6Dilithium Ore&r, as well as &6Certus Quartz, Nether Quartz, and Monazite Ore.&r

&2A new mission is available in CEu. This mission costs HV Electric Pumps and Cryotheum Dust. This nets you Solidified Neon, Xenon and Krypton, although it is better to get those from distilling Liquid Nether and Ender Air, because of their useful byproducts and the tiny amount of each element you get in this mission.&r
&9Don't forget that you can automate Extended Crafting recipes before you get PackagedAuto by converting your Extended Crafting tables into autocrafting tables.
This Micro Miner can get you:&6
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest26.title: &9Tier Two Micro Miner
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest27.descr: &9Radon&r will be needed in large quantities.

For now, you'll need to obtain it from Tier Two Micro Miner missions, in the form of &6Radon Salt&r. Electrolyze it for Radon and &6Rock Salt&r. &2You can also get it from distilling liquid Ender Air.&r
Later, it will be possible to make Radon using a &bGregTech &3Fusion Reactor&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest27.title: &2Radon
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest28.descr: You'll need an HV or better &3Chemical Bath&r to make these. The recipe is quite slow, so invest in the highest tier Chemical Baths you can and consider parallelizing the recipe.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest28.subti: When &6Ender Eyes&r just aren't creepy enough.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest29.descr: A more advanced type of &6Silicon Boule&r, formed by doping the &6Silicon&r crystal lattice with &6Phosphorus&r.

These are made in an &3EBF&r with &2Kanthal&r or better coils, and need &2Nitrogen&r for the process. It needs twice as much Silicon as the basic boules, but also results in twice as many doped Silicon Wafers when sliced.
Circuit Wafers can be made far more efficiently with these doped Silicon Wafers, but they are also needed for some more advanced types of Circuit Wafers that can't be engraved onto the basic ones.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest29.title: &2Phosphorus Doped Silicon Boule
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest3.descri: &6&6Redstone&r, &6Sulfur&r, and &6Blaze Powder&r creates &6Pyrotheum Dust&r, a mixture imbued with potent elemental flame.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest30.descr: This alloy is cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r into a &6Hot Nichrome Ingot&r which will damage you if it is held. To prevent this damage and obtain the desired ingot, the Hot Ingot must be cooled in a &3Vacuum Freezer&r.

It is best to directly route this Hot Ingot from the &6Output Bus&r of your Blast Furnace to the &6Input Bus&r of your &3Vacuum Freezer&r via conduits or a &6Tag Filter&r set to 'forge:hot_ingots' with a high piority.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest30.title: Nichrome Ingots
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest31.descr: &6Nichrome&r is the third coil material available, increasing your EBF's operating temperature to 3600K so it can process more advanced materials.
Note that an &6HV&r &3Assembler&r is required to make them. &cEach tier of coil requires their tier of Assembler&r - we won't remind you again.

&93600K&r is now also hot enough to grant a single &9100% efficient overclock&r to 1800K and below recipes. This means that one overclock will grant &94x speed&r instead of the normal &92x&r. In effect, you will get an additional 2x speed boost by overclocking once.

This means that the gas-boosted recipe for &6Aluminium&r will get cut from about &e7s&r to &e3s&r at HV. Once you upgrade your EBF to EV power, &6Stainless Steel Ingots&r will get cut from about &e37s&r to &e9s&r! It's well worth upgrading the EBFs producing these materials to &6Nichrome&r once you can afford it.
Later coils will give similar bonuses. Additionally, the EBF's temperature will increase by &9100K&r for each voltage tier above MV, which could make a difference for future materials.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest31.title: &2Nichrome Coil Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest32.descr: &3Vacuum Freezers&r are primarily used to cool down hot ingots.
They're also capable of freezing air into a liquid, and making superconductors.
At minimum you will need an energy input hatch, an input bus, an output bus, a maintenance hatch, and 21 &6Frost Proof Machine Casings&r for forming the multiblock for processing Hot Ingots.
If you want to deal with fluids as well, subtract two casings and use a fluid input and fluid output in their place.
Besides the controller placement, as usual the hatches/buses can go anywhere. Use the building guide in &bEMI&r which can be pulled up from the controller block.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest33.descr: You'll be needing large quantities of the various Noble Gases so you should get this automated and running continuously.
&2After liquefaction, Overworld Air grants Helium and Argon; Nether Air grants Helium-3 and Neon; Ender Air grants Helium, Krypton, Xenon, and Radon.
Certain Noble Gases (as well as Nitrogen) can also boost the speed of EBF processes.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest33.title: &2Noble Gases
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest34.descr: &9Air&r can be sent into the &3Vacuum Freezer&r to turn it into &9Liquid Air&r.
&9Liquid Air&r can be sent into a &2Distillation Tower&r to break it down into its components.
&2Liquid Nether Air and Liquid Ender Air give different useful components too.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest34.title: &2Distilling Liquid Air
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest35.descr: Note: this quest accepts LV/MV/HV/EV &3Gas Collectors&r.
A &3Gas Collector&r will suck up air at a decent rate, provided the top side is unobstructed. The collected Air is automatically ejected into an adjacent tank via the output face.

&2Gas Collectors in the Nether and End will collect Nether Air and Ender Air respectively, which yield different products. Make sure you set the correct circuit configuration for the dimension you are in.&r
IV+ air collectors are not part of this quest, but for reference they exist and are called &3Atmosphere Collectors&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest35.title: &2Basic Air Collection
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest36.descr: &9Nitrogen&r comprises 78% of the atmosphere. Because of this, after the first few processes of &9Liquid Air&r, you'll probably have more Nitrogen than you know what to do with.
If you got here centrifuging air, then it's gonna take you longer to get to that point.

Even so, don't void it unless you have secured a very large stockpile. Storage is cheap and Nitrogen is used in sizeable quantities for several notable things, one of which you'll be needing very soon.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest36.title: &2Nitrogen
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest37.descr: Note: this quest accepts LV/MV/HV Centrifuge.
Centrifuging air is a reliable way to get &9Nitrogen&r before you have access to &3Cryogenic Distillation&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest37.title: Air Centrifuging
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest38.descr: A simple combination of &9Nitrogen&r and &9Oxygen&r, the two most common elements in the air, yet this substance is very toxic. Chemistry is weird.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest38.title: Nitrogen Dioxide
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest39.descr: &9Nitrogen Dioxide&r, &9Oxygen&r, and &9Water&r will create &9Nitric Acid&r, the next step in your chemical journey.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest39.subti: Don't let the EPA catch you making this stuff.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest39.title: Nitric Acid
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest4.descri: Bits of a &6Blaze Rod&r. Using a &3Macerator&r doubles your yield.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest40.descr: &2A rudimentary version of Platinum Group Sludge (PGS) processing existed in the base pack. Here, it is a strong source of the Platinum Group Metals - Ruthenium, Rhodium, Palladium, Osmium, Iridium, and Platinum - as well as Gold. All of these elements will be used in IV-tier and above materials.

&rYou will need to treat certain ores with &9Nitric Acid&r to yield &6PGS&r - &6Sheldonite&r is the best. Then, using an &3HV+ Centrifuge&r and &9Aqua Regia&r, break it down into the PGS salts, and reduce those salts to the metals.
This is still optional, and you can get &6Ruthenium&r and &6Rhodium&r from &6Osmiridium 80/20 Ore&r and &6Iridosmine 80/20 Ore&r from Microverse adventures instead.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest40.subti: Is this that "Gregtech PGS" people refer to?
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest40.title: &2Platinum Group Processing
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest41.descr: There are several paths to &9Acetic Acid&r... probably the simplest is combining &9Oxygen&r, &9Hydrogen&r, and &6Carbon&r, but one of the several other methods may appeal to you more, especially if you have a &3Distillation Tower&r.
Look through &bEMI&r for the various options.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest41.title: Acetic Acid
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest42.descr: Or you can heat &9Acetone&r, or a few other approaches. Check out &bEMI&r for the various options.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest42.title: Ethenone
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest43.descr: This is the additive that will bring our diesel fuel to the next level.
Mix &9Nitric Acid&r and &9Ethenone&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r to make &9Tetranitromethane&r.
In a newly added route, you can also mix &9Nitric Acid&r and &9Methyl Acetate&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest43.title: Tetranitromethane
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest44.descr: Petrochemistry is the category of organic chemistry pertaining to petroleum, otherwise known as &9Oil&r.
&bGregTech&r's petrochemistry may seem daunting at first, given the sheer number of chemicals and processing options, but it's actually easier to get into than you think.

Oil is the starting point, and can be found in several variants which you can pump from finite natural wells in the Overworld, as well as coming renewably from &6Oilsands Ore&r and &6Soul Sand&r, and directly in liquid form from a &3Fluid Rig&r.

&2The Fluid Rig can also harvest Raw Oil, Heavy Oil, and Light Oil depending on your fluid vein. Raw Oil is similar to Oil, giving the same ratios when distilled but needing double the fluid. Heavy Oil and Light Oil give different ratios when distilled.&r
Start off by distilling the Oil. This will result in &9Sulfuric Heavy Fuel&r, &9Sulfuric Light Fuel&r, &9Sulfuric Naphtha&r, and/or &9Sulfuric Gas&r.
These will all need to be hydrodesulfurized using &9Hydrogen&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r, which produces the non-Sulfuric versions.
All of these products are useful, so figure out how you want to store the variety and large quantities of fluids.
The upcoming quests will guide you through the basics of petrochemistry. Once you've mastered that, feel free to explore further.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest44.title: Navigating Petrochem
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest45.descr: No, your monitor doesn't have a dead pixel on it, this is just a quest to track if you've made Diesel or Bio-Diesel cause FTB quests can't do proper logic gates.
(Yeah I could just make this quest invisible, but then the dependency lines don't render, kind of a lose-lose here)
Now get back to making that (bio)diesel!
Fun fact, these "invisible" task icons are actually just EIO painted stairs.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest45.title: Diesel or Bio-Diesel
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest46.descr: &9Diesel&r is a mixture of &9Light Fuel&r and &9Heavy Fuel&r.
The primary use is for making &2Cetane-Boosted Diesel&r, which you will want to stockpile in large quantities for the later production of &6Cryolobus &2(unless you use Gasoline instead).
The performance of Combustion Generators is also improved, but you probably want to refine Diesel anyway.

&2It's more power efficient to use singleblock Distilleries over a Distillation Tower for Oil, due to the overclocking mechanics being different. However, it is still recommended to use Distillation Towers, to get the other useful byproducts too. For Diesel, the correct ratio is 3 Distilleries for Light Oil and 2 Distilleries for Heavy Oil.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest46.title: Diesel
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest47.descr: &2Light Fuel's distillates are now more useful, and it is the only source of Octane for High-Octane Gasoline.
But if you choose to produce Diesel, a large proportion of the Light Fuel you produce still has to go into Diesel production.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest47.title: &2Light Fuel
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest48.descr: &9Heavy Fuel&r is mixed with &9Light Fuel&r to create &9Diesel&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest48.title: Heavy Fuel
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest49.descr: &9Hydrogen Sulfide&r is a byproduct of hydrodesulfurization. &2It also comes from distilling Liquid Nether Air.&r
A simple chemical reaction with &9Water&r reprocesses it into the useful &9Sulfuric Acid&r, or it can be electrolyzed for recovering the &9Hydrogen&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest49.title: &2Hydrogen Sulfide
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest5.descri: &6&6Redstone&r, &6Obsidian Dust&r, and &6Basalz Powder&r creates &6Petrotheum Dust&r, a mixture imbued with potent elemental earth.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest50.descr: Like other petroleum products, &9Sulfuric Gas&r &2or Natural Gas&r is hydrodesulfurized into &9Refinery Gas&r using &9Hydrogen&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r.

Refinery Gas can be cracked and further distilled for its constituents, but it is also useful as fuel for &3Gas Turbines&r. While it can be burned directly, centrifuging Refinery Gas produces &9LPG&r (Liquefied Petroleum Gas), which is an ideal fuel for Gas Turbines, and &9Methane&r which is a potential (suboptimal) turbine fuel but is also useful for various chemical reactions.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest50.title: &2Refinery Gas
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest51.descr: &9Naphtha&r is best utilized for Steam-Cracking and distilling for its constituents.
Notably, it contains &9Light Fuel&r and &9Heavy Fuel&r for making more &9Diesel&r, as well as many other useful chemicals for a variety of purposes.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest51.title: Naphtha
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest52.descr: &2The Large Chemical Reactor (LCR) is a multiblock Chemical Reactor with more input/output slots.&r
All &9Overclocks&r in the &3LCR&r are &6100% efficient&r; each overclock will &5quadruple the speed&r, as opposed to doubling it.
The &3LCR&r can also perform some exclusive reactions which allow you to combine multiple normal &3Chemical Reactor&r steps into a &6single step&r, such as:
The &3LCR&r also is required to perform some recipes, such as &aRaw Gasoline&r production, and &aPolybenzimidazole&r.
Any other recipe which could be done in a normal &9Chemical Reactor&r, as well as certain &9Mixer&r recipes, can also be done in an &3LCR&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest52.title: &2Large Chemical Reactor
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest53.descr: &2Gasoline is a powerful combustion fuel, generating 1600 EU per mB of fluid. It can also be substituted for Cetane-Boosted Diesel in Cryolobus production.
To get the most out of this, run it in an Extreme Combustion Engine with Liquid Oxygen.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest53.title: &2Gasoline
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest54.descr: &2High-Octane Gasoline is a even more powerful combustion fuel, generating 3200 EU per mB of fuel. It can also be used in Cryolobus production, using 75% less fuel than Cetane-Boosted Diesel or normal Gasoline. The trade-off is the very complex processing lines you must set up for it.
To refine Gasoline to High-Octane Gasoline, you will need:
To get the most out of this, run it in an Extreme Combustion Engine with Liquid Oxygen.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest54.title: &2High-Octane Gasoline
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest55.descr: The reaction that produces &9Bio Diesel&r is also the only source of &9Glycerol&r, which is an easy way to make &9Epichlorohydrin&r, an important ingredient of &9Epoxy&r.
&9Glycerol&r is also used in the production of &9Glyceryl Trinitrate&r, an important step in making &6Dynamite&r, which can be used later in the &3Implosion Compressor&r.
Even if you're otherwise going all in on petrochemistry for Epoxy, you'll probably end up with some Bio Diesel as a result of making Glycerol, unless you're using &6TNT&r.
Bio Diesel can be used for power, but it is probably better to convert it to &2Cetane-Boosted Diesel&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest55.title: Bio Diesel and Glycerol
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest56.descr: &6Sodium Hydroxide&r is a strong base, and an ingredient in &9Bio Diesel&r, among other reactions.

&2The only source&r is splitting &9Salt Water&r in an &3Electrolyzer&r - this is also a good source of &9Chlorine&r. You can get &9Salt Water&r from mixing &6Salt&r and &9Water&r (duh), &2dissolving Ghast Tears, or drilling it from Salt Water fluid veins, which only spawn over oceans.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest57.descr: You will need either &9Seed Oil&r or &9Fish Oil&r in the process of making &9Bio Diesel&r, created by extracting seeds or fish.
The easiest ways to get seeds are with a &9Greenhouse&r.
The easiest ways to get fish are via a &aGuardian Model&r from &bHNN&r, or using a &aGregtech Fisher&r.
Both are viable, so it's ultimately up to you.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest57.title: &9Bio Diesel Feedstock
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest58.descr: A colorless liquid with a pungent, garlic-like odor. It's needed in the production of &9Epoxy&r.
&2You can skip a step making this with the Large Chemical Reactor.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest58.title: &2Epichlorohydrin
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest59.descr: &rBPA can be produced using petrochemistry distillation products, or via distilling &9Charcoal Byproducts&r from your &3Pyrolyse Oven&r into useful components. Alternatively, you can get &9Phenol&r from &6Coal&r pyrolysis. &9Fermented Biomass&r is also useful to distill as it provides many useful products.
&2Using the Large Chemical Reactor, you can skip two steps in the Epoxy production line.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest59.title: &2Epoxy Production
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest6.descri: Bits of a &6Basalz Rod&r. Using a &3Macerator&r doubles your yield.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest60.descr: &2You only need this step if you are using normal Chemical Reactors. If you are using LCRs, the Allyl Chloride step is skipped.
&9Allyl Chloride&r provides an alternative means of producing &9Epichlorohydrin&r for &9Epoxy&r.
Reacting &9Chlorine&r and &9Propene&r will produce Allyl Chloride. Propene is distilled in a &3Distillation Tower&r from any one of various cracked petroleum products like &9Steam-Cracked Naphtha&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest60.title: Allyl Chloride
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest61.descr: These can be made into circuit boards as a substrate for advanced circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest61.title: Epoxy
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest62.descr: &6Tungsten&r is a material that requires an &3EV Electrolyzer,&2 Chemical Bath&r and an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r with at least &6Nichrome Coils&r.
It is only found from &6Tungstate Dust &2and &6Scheelite Dust&2, obtained from their respective ores.&r Tungstate is also obtainable in small quantities from centrifuging &6Endstone Dust&r.
Scheelite and Tungstate need to be &2bathed in Hydrochloric Acid to make Tungstic Acid, then electrolyzed&r to get to the Tungsten, which then needs to be cooked in the EBF for Tungsten Ingots.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest62.title: &2Tungsten
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest63.descr: An alloy of equal parts &6Tungsten&r and &6Carbon Dust&r.
&6Tungsten Carbide&r is a very dense, sturdy, and heat-resistant material useful for a variety of applications.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest63.title: Tungsten Carbide
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest64.descr: &2Double Plates&r for Micro Miners made from &6Tungsten Carbide&r.
You &2no longer need high tier Compressors to make these.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest64.title: &2Tungsten Carbide Double Plates
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest65.descr: The &3Crafting Core&r is used to convert special crystalline materials into empowered variants.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest65.title: &9Empowererment
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest66.descr: The Third Micro Miner. &2You'll need that Boron in the MV Field Generators.&r
Or with a Super Chest III:
When equipped with a Gemstone Sensor:
The Tier Three Micro Miner will also be used to obtain &2Netherite&r in the End Game.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest66.title: &2Tier Three Micro Miner
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest67.descr: &6Nano CPUs&r are advanced &6Circuit Wafers&r made from infusing a &6CPU Wafer&r with &6Carbon Fibers&r and &9Energized Glowstone&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r.
Then, cut the resulting wafer into dies using a &3Cutting Machine&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest68.descr: &6Carbon Fibers&r are useful for a variety of things.
&2They are made with Carbon Dust and polymers. Higher tier polymers grant higher yields. It's also not a chanced output anymore.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest68.title: &2Carbon Fibers
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest69.descr: &2A System-on-Chip can be engraved with HV power and Phosphorus Boules. This unlocks the ultimate tier one circuit recipe in the EV Circuit Assembler.
The ultimate tier two circuit recipe requires an IV Circuit Assembler.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest7.descri: &6Mana Dust&r is an important material. It is needed for a variety of materials related to &bThermal Expansion&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest70.descr: With &6Titanium&r smelting automated, you can now build Machine Hulls for Extreme Voltage machines.
EV motors require a better material than &6Steel&r for its magnetism.
&6Neodymium&r is required, which is mainly achieved from &6Rare Earth&r. The main sources of this are &6Redstone&r, and everything inside of &6Bastnasite&r veins.
&2Starting at EV, 4A Energy and Dynamo hatches are available at each tier.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest70.title: &2EV Machine Hulls
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest71.descr: &2Higher tier GT Batteries have been buffed to be quite strong - this one holds 25 MEU, or 100 MRF. You may want to consider using them over RF storage.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest71.title: &2EV Power Storage
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest72.descr: &9Deepslate Processing is a great way to get tons of Fluorine and Thorium. Therefore, it is recommended to setup this process as soon as possible.&r
&6Fluorine&r is needed in &6Polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE)&r, and &6Thorium&r is used in &bNuclearCraft &3Fission Reactors&r.
&3Rock Breakers&r are first used to achieve renewable &6Deepslate&r. This recipe runs at &9EV&r or higher.

After this, &3Macerators&r should pulverise the &9Deepslate&r into &9Deepslate Dust&r and a chance of &6Thorium&r. It is recommended to overclock this recipe as much as you can, in order to maximize the amount of &6Thorium&r you get.
A &3Centrifuge&r then turns &6Deepslate Dust&r into &6Biotite Dust&r and &6Silicon Dioxide Dust&r. The latter can be electrolysed, yielding &6Silicon&r and &6Oxygen&r.
&6Biotite Dust &ris then finally put into a &3Electrolyser&r. This yields &6Potassium, Magnesium, Aluminium&r and &6Silicon Dust&r, as well as some &6Fluorine&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest72.title: &9Deepslate Processing
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest73.descr: &2The Alloy Blast Smelter directly smelts dust combinations into molten Alloys, skipping the Mixer step, and applying a 3/4 discount to your EBF time. Some molten alloys may need to be cooled in a Vacuum Freezer before being usable.

&rThis is the only way to create some of the advanced alloys used in multiblock machines. You can also use it for most normal alloys if you want. In particular, &ethe speed and energy efficiency are better than the equivalent EBF recipe.&r
You can also use the ABS for most Alloy Smelter alloys (apart from &6Steel&r) like &eInvar&r, &e&eConductive Iron&r&r, and &e&eDark Steel&r&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest73.title: &2Alloy Blast Smelter
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest74.descr: &2Used in building the Alloy Blast Smelter.
&r&6Tantalum&r is obtained from &6Tantalite Ore&r, or in small quantities from centrifuging &eLava&r.

&6Molybdenum&r is obtained from &6Molybdenum, Molybdenite, Powellite, and Wulfenite ores&r. They spawn together in the &eNether&r rarely, or some of them come from &3Tier One&r and &3Five Micro Miners&r.
&2Remember, you need an appropriately tiered Mixer (HV for HSLA Steel, and EV for the others).
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest74.title: &2Advanced Alloys
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest75.descr: This alloy is cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r and cooled in a &3Vacuum Freezer&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest75.title: Tungstensteel
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest76.descr: &2With advanced alloys from the Alloy Blast Smelter and IV Machines, you can make large versions of most GT machines.

&rThese are formed like multiblocks. You can add a &3Parallel Control Hatch&r in order to allow them to process &9more recipes&r at the same time. The highest tier of Parallel Control Hatch can facilitate processing &94096 recipes&r at once!
&9Crafting Co-Processers increase the rate that your ME network will "push" batches of items out, perfect for machines like these.&r
Look up the usages of Parallel Hatches in EMI to see details of all the multiblock machines.
Most of the advanced alloys used to make the casings of these multiblocks are made in the &3Alloy Blast Smelter&r. If you can't seem to find the recipes for them, look for the &eMolten Fluid&r form.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest76.title: &9Multiblock Madness
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest77.descr: With &6Tungstensteel&r achieved, you can now make hulls for Insane Voltage (IV) &bGregTech&r machines.
&2Starting at IV, 16A Energy and Dynamo hatches are available at each tier.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest77.title: &2IV Machine Hulls
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest78.descr: &9Rubber&r has been sufficient for making cables so far, but you will soon discover that this basic type of rubber won't withstand more than &2Extreme Voltage&r. Higher quality rubber is necessary to properly insulate your wires.
There are two better types of rubber, and you will eventually need to make both of them. &eThese can also be used for insulating lower voltage wires more efficiently, requiring less fluid&r!

&9&2Both Styrene-Butadiene Rubber (SBR) and Silicone Rubber (SiR) can wrap any Cable tier.&r However, SBR requires petrochemistry infrastructure you may not have yet, and is not mandatory until you are making late-game components. On the other hand, SiR can conveniently be made from chemicals you are already familiar with. By setting this up now, you won't have to change your wire coating material later!

To make Silicone Rubber, you will need to create &6Polydimethylsiloxane Dust&r in one of several ways, then mix it with &6Sulfur&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r. You can then coat wires with it in an &3Assembling Machine&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest78.title: &2New Cable Coverings
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest79.descr: This is the highest tier of polymer. It is used in crafting &2Advanced SMD components and ZPM+ Machine Hulls,&r among other things.
This polymer can require up to &914 steps&r to create from scratch, but multiple steps are able to be skipped through distillation of various liquids. &6Check what steps you can easily skip!&r
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest79.title: &2Polybenzimidazole (PBI)
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest8.descri: &6&6Redstone&r, &6Saltpeter&r, and &6Blitz Powder&r creates &6Aerotheum Dust&r, a mixture imbued with potent elemental air.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest80.descr: An Insane Voltage tier &bGregTech&r battery. &2Equivalent to 125 Vibrant Capacitor Banks!
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest80.title: &2IV Power Storage
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest81.descr: Glowing! &2But all the GTCEu machines glow already, so...&r
Wires made from &6Lumium&r transmit IV power losslessly, and it forms part of the basis for &6LuV Machine Hulls&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest81.title: Lumium
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest82.descr: This alloy is cooked in an &3Electric Blast Furnace&r and cooled in a &3Vacuum Freezer&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest82.title: High Speed Steel Type G
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest83.descr: This one takes a significant amount of time to cook, so make sure to have it going constantly.
&6Signalum&r is noteworthy as the long-awaited next tier upgrade for your &bThermal Expansion&r machines and dynamos following "Reinforced" back in MV.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest83.title: Signalum
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest84.descr: The &6IV Assembling Machine&r is required for&2 Advanced SMD components&r.
Consider upgrading to a &6Large Assembling Factory&r, which is easier to upgrade and can accept Parallel Control Hatches.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest84.title: &2IV Assembling Machine
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest85.descr: The &3Slice'N'Splice&r is a machine from &bEnder IO&r.
It is used for making monster-head-related items that are components for various things.
It needs to be supplied with an Axe and Shears, which are slowly damaged over time as items are crafted.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest86.descr: The &3Soul Binder&r is an &bEnder IO&r machine which uses &aSoul Vials&r and Experience to enhance specific items.
It may be prudent to store &9Liquid XP&r in an adjacent &3Obelisk&r, which the Soul Binder can draw from directly, or you can insert it using other standard means of fluid routing.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest87.descr: Give me a little juice, FRIDAY!
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest87.title: Infinity War
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest88.descr: The &6Powered Spawner&r is a machine from &bEnder IO&r.

It is used to automate the spawning and capture of mobs. As with all &bEnder IO&r machines, it requires a capacitor, with a higher tier capacitor increasing the range, spawning rate, and capture rate.
In order to create a &6Powered Spawner&r for the mob type that you want, you must craft it using a &6Broken Spawner&r for that specific mob type. Once created, the mob type cannot be changed.

This &6Broken Spawner&r is set by putting a &6Broken Spawner&r, of any mob type, and a &6Soul Vial&r, of the specified mob, into a &aSoul Binder&r, with a few dashes of &aXP&r. Broken Spawners can be obtained by breaking a mob spawner. &eTIP: Spawners are all over the Lost Cities!&r
The spawner has two modes: Capture and Spawn.
In capture mode, you insert a &6Soul Vial&r into the machine, and the soul vial captures the &asoul&r of the set mob. This does not spawn any mobs, and thus works with any mob, even on peaceful.
In spawn mode, the spawner will spawn the mob that it is set to, until there is no space for them, or there are too many mobs in the area.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest89.descr: Made by adding some Iridium and Osmium to your HSS-G.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest89.title: High Speed Steel Type S
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest9.descri: Bits of a &6Blitz Rod&r. Using a &3Macerator&r doubles your yield.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest9.title: Blitz Powder
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest90.descr: Made by adding some Cobalt, Manganese and Silicon to your HSS-G.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest90.title: High Speed Steel Type E
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest91.descr: &2Advanced SMD Components&r are new to CEu and are required for &6Crystal, Wetware, and Matter circuits&r. They can also be substituted for the equivalent of 4 normal SMD components in Nano and Quantum circuits.
All of these components require &1IV&r power and liquid PBI.
Advanced SMD Transistor: Vanadium-Gallium Foil and Fine HSS-G Wire
Advanced SMD Resistor: Graphene Dust and Fine Platinum Wire
Advanced SMD Capacitor: Thin PBI Sheet and HSS-S Foil
Advanced SMD Diode: InGaP Dust and Fine Niobium-Titanium Wire
Advanced SMD Inductor: HSS-E Ring and Fine Palladium Wire
As with the normal SMD components, invest in an extremely robust automation system for these, as you won't stop needing them.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest91.title: &2Advanced SMD Components
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest92.descr: &6Yttrium Barium Cuprate&r (more accurately, Yttrium Barium Copper Oxide, or YBCO) is, among other things, a high-temperature superconductor material.
This is used as plates in &3Nuclearcraft&r, and will become an important cable material for later tiers of &bGregTech&r components.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest93.descr: Centrifuge &6Rare Earth&r, and among other useful materials, you'll get some &6Yttrium&r.
Because this recipe has chanced outputs, use a &2high tier Centrifuge to increase output chances&r, and &eensure the output slots don't fill up or excess items will be voided&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest94.descr: &6Barium&r is an element found in &6Barite&r, which may be found as &6Barite Ore&r, inside &6Quartz&r veins.
Barite can also be extracted from other Quartz ores via ore processing, &2and Naquadah Processing, available in LuV.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest94.title: &2Barium
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest95.descr: &6Rare Earth&r comes from either centrifuging certain Impure Dusts, or processing those same Purified Dusts.
The sources are essentially &6Redstone&r, and everything inside of &6Bastnasite&r veins.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest96.descr: &6Steel &2Double Plates&r can be augmented with &6Tungsten Plates&r and &6Tough Alloy&r to make &6Basic Reactor Plating&r.
That's right-- it's time to get into &bNuclearCraft&r.
Enhancing basic plating with &6YBCO&r and &6Hard Carbon Alloy&r results in a better plating material for more advanced &bNuclearCraft&r blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest96.title: NuclearCraft Platings
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest97.descr: &6Boron&r is currently obtainable by doing ore processing on &6Lepidolite Ore&r and &6Salt Ore&r (via &6Borax&r), and later on, it can be obtained via the Tier Five Micro Miner.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest98.descr: Alloying some &6Lithium&r into your &6Ferroboron&r results in &6Tough Alloy&r, a common component in &bNuclearCraft&r blocks.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest98.title: Tough Alloy
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest99.descr: &6Hard Carbon Alloy&r is an alloy made from &2Steel&r and &6Diamonds&r.
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.quest99.title: &2Hard Carbon Alloy
ftbquests.chapter.mid_game.title: Mid Game

ftbquests.chapter.omnium.quest148.descri: As the name suggests, this catalyst is formed from exotic non-elemental materials and alloys.
ftbquests.chapter.omnium.quest148.subtit: A small appetizer, before the &9Omnium&r main course.
ftbquests.chapter.omnium.quest149.descri: &9Omnium&r, as the name suggests, is an incredible material composed of all elements and alloys you've encountered so far.
ftbquests.chapter.omnium.quest149.subtit: Man, that's a LOT of quests linked to this one.

ftbquests.chapter.processing_lines.quest: The final step. Combine &6Pulsating Dust&r and &6Clay&r to make &6Pulsating Prediction Matrix&r.

Take note that a &3&3Chemical Reactor&r making &6Resonant Clathrate&r will supply 1 &3Alloy Smelter&r of the same tier, and that one &bMV &3Alloy Smelter&r making &6Pulsating Prediction Matrix&r supports 10.03 &3Simulation Chambers&r, with each higher tier doubling the amount of &3Simulation Chambers&r it supports.
&oThis step requires an Alloy Smelter at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Break up your &6Cobblestone&r into &6Gravel&r. Pretty much just another step of the &eCobbleworks&r, although it is used in &6Conduit Binders&r.
&oThis step requires a Forge Hammer at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Search your &6Gravel&r for &6Flint&r.
&oThis step requires a Sifter at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Crush your &6Clay&r to make &6Clay Dust&r.&r Turns into many useful resources.
&oThis step requires a Macerator at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r

Split your &6Clay Dust&r to make &6Sodium Dust&r, &6Silicon Dust&r, &6Lithium Dust&r, and &6Aluminium Dust&r.&r This is extremely important to passive, as you will need a lot of these resources, and this is the best way to get them.
&oThis step requires a Electrolyzer at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Sodium, Silicon, Lithium and Aluminium

&9Water&r can be achieved in many ways, but the most notable are: &6Water Collectors&r, which are very slow but cheap; &bThermal &6Aqueous Accumulators&r, which are a bit more expensive but way faster; and &bGregTech &6Infinite Water Covers&r, which are much more expensive, but save space because they're covers, and make water 16x faster than &6Accumulators&r.
Right now, you should probably use the &6Aqueous Accumulator&r.
In this case, you'll need &9Water&r for &6Clay&r.
&oYes, there's a quest for &9Water&r.
Water
Combine your &6Dust&r and some &6Water&r to make &6Clay&r.&r Turns into many useful resources.
&oThis step requires a Chemical Reactor at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Craft your &6Clay&r to make &6Clay Balls&r.&r You can also use &3Compacting Drawers&r. Used for &6Conduit Binders&r.
Break up your &6Sand&r into &6Dust&r. Used for nothing, apart from &6Clay&r and &6Netherrack&r.
&oThis step requires a Forge Hammer at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Break up your &6Gravel&r into &6Sand&r. Pretty much just another step of the &eCobbleworks&r, although it is used in &6Conduit Binders&r.
&oThis step requires a Forge Hammer at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r

&6Lava&r can be achieved in two main ways. The first is using a &3Chemical Reactor&r to turn &6Magma Blocks&r into &6Lava&r. The second is using a &bGregTech &6Fluid Drill&r in the Nether above a &6Lava&r vein.
In this case, you'll need &6Lava&r for &6Netherrack&r. You won't need much, although &6Lava&r can also be centrifuged for useful resources.
Lava
Combine your &6Quartz&r and &6Resonant Ender&r to make &6Resonant Clathrate&r. One &3Electrolyzer&r making &6Quartz&r supports 2.4 &3Chemical Reactors &rof the same tier.
&oThis step requires a Chemical Reactor at voltage &lMV&r&o or higher.&r
Combine your &6Dust&r and &6Lava&r into &6Netherrack&r. Pretty much used for nothing, apart from your first &6Hellish Matter&r and &6Netherrack Dust&r. No need to passive this.
&oThis step requires a Chemical Reactor at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Crush your &6Netherrack&r into &6Netherrack Dust&r. Used for nothing apart from &6Nether Cakes&r. No need to passive this.
&oThis step requires a Macerator at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Cool down your &6Lava&r into &6Obsidian&r. You'll need a lot of this, so it's probably wise to use &3Rock Breakers&r once you hit &6HV&r, as they produce &6Obsidian&r without consuming anything.
&oThis step requires a Fluid Solidifier at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher, or a Rock Breaker at voltage &lHV&r&o or higher.&r
Crush your &6Obsidian&r into &6Obsidian Dust&r. You'll need a lot of this for &6Petrotheum Dust&r.
&oThis step requires a Macerator at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r

Break up your &6Sandstone&r into &6Saltpeter&r. This is probably the best way to get &6Saltpeter&r, which you'll need a lot of for &6Aerotheum Dust&r. You can also get &6Saltpeter&r from &bHostile Neural Networks&r.
You can also electrolyze it for &6Potassium&r, although that isn't recommended because of how easily you can get &6Potassium&r from other sources and how much &6Saltpeter&r it costs.
&oThis step requires a Macerator at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Compact your &6Sand&r into &6Sandstone&r. It is recommended to use &3Ender IO Crafters&r or a &6Compressor&r.
Separate your &6Quartz Sand&r into &6Quartzite Dust&r and &6Certus Quartz Dust&r. This is a good renewable source of &6Certus Quartz&r, which you need for &bApplied Energistics 2&r.
&oThis step requires a Centrifuge at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Quartzite and Certus Quartz Dust
Crush your &6Sand&r into &6Quartz Sand&r. Can be centrifuged into useful resources.
This step requires a Macerator at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r

Smelt your &6Sand&r into &6Glass&r. If you're using a &3Electric Furnace&r to smelt it, it's more efficient to use the upgraded &3Furnaces&r, such as &3Iron Furnaces&r, which you can fuel with &6Sugar Cane&r. However, using an &3Arc Furnace&r doubles your glass output. Later, once you unlock them, &3Multi Smelters&r will be the best for this.
&oThis step requires a Furnace or Arc Furnace at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
Glass
Glass
Crush your &6Glass&r into &6Glass Dust&r. Used for nothing, apart from &6Silicon Dioxide Dust&r.
&oThis step requires a Macerator at voltage &lLV&r&o or higher.&r
